title: 人材紹介会社からヘッドハンティングの電話

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さん、幸田さんという方からお電話入っています。
conversation.en_sentence: Takada-san, we have a call from someone called Koda-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: どこの幸田さん？
conversation.en_sentence: Koda-san from where?

conversation.ja_sentence: 社名はおっしゃらなかったのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: He didn't say his company name.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、繋いでください。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, please connect me.

conversation.ja_sentence: お電話代わりました、広報IRの高田と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for holding, my name is Takada from the Public Relations Investor Relations.

conversation.ja_sentence: 突然のお電話で恐縮です。
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry for the sudden call.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は人材エージェントのR社の幸田と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: My name Koda from Company R which is a recruiting agency.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は人事担当ではないのですが、御社が私にどのようなご用件でしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm not a human resource staff but may I ask why you are calling me?

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、近いうちに上場をご検討されている企業様より、IRをお任せできる優秀な方のご紹介を依頼されております。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, there is a company that is planning to go public soon and they've asked me to introduce a good candidate to handle investor relations.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんのお話を伺う機会がございまして、是非一度私共とお会いしていただけないかと。
conversation.en_sentence: I had a conversation with someone and had a chance to learn about Takada-san so, I would love to have the opportunity to meet you once.

conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼ですが、どなたから私の話を聞かれたのでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, but who did you hear about me from?

conversation.ja_sentence: 金融関係の方、としか申し上げられませんが、大変優秀でいらっしゃると伺っております。
conversation.en_sentence: I can only say that it is someone from finance and I've heard that you are very good.

conversation.ja_sentence: お褒めいただいて恐縮ですが、現在の職場環境が気に入っておりますので。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the compliment but I very much like my current work environment.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうおっしゃらずに。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, don't say that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回のお話に限らず、今後も有益なお話をご紹介できるかもしれません。
conversation.en_sentence: Aside from the offer this time, I think I will be able to introduce something beneficial for next time too.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、むしろそのように愛社精神をお持ちの方こそ、こちらが求める人材でもあられるのですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: And, someone we are looking for is a person who is loyal to the company like you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 是非情報交換というくらいの軽いお気持ちでお会いさせていただければ。
conversation.en_sentence: If possible, I'd like to casually meet you to just exchange information.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今後の高田さんのキャリアアップの為にも是非。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it could lead to your career progression.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の近くまで参ります。
conversation.en_sentence: I can go to the area by your office.

conversation.ja_sentence: Rホテル１階のラウンジに、高田さんのご都合のよろしい日時でいかがでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about at the lounge on the first floor of Hotel R at a date and time at your convenience, Takada-san?

conversation.ja_sentence: 中々、強引なお誘いですこと。
conversation.en_sentence: That's a pretty aggressive invite.

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ですが、先程申し上げた通り、今はキャリアアップを他社に転職することで実現させるつもりもありません。
conversation.en_sentence: But sorry, as I mentioned earlier, I don't plan on upgrading my career by going to another company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 期末で忙しい時期ですし、申し訳ないですが、お会いするのはお断りします。
conversation.en_sentence: It's the month-end and is a busy time so I'd like to decline the meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ですが、今回はお忙しい時期ということで諦めます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will give up on it for now since it's a busy time for you.

conversation.ja_sentence: また落ち着かれた頃に、お誘いのご連絡を差し上げます。
conversation.en_sentence: But once things settle down, I'd like to contact you again to meet.

conversation.ja_sentence: その時は、よいお返事を頂けることを期待しておりますので。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope that I can get a more positive response at that time.

conversation.ja_sentence: それもまた難しいことをおっしゃるのですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's another difficult thing you're saying.

conversation.ja_sentence: ふふ、次の機会にお会いできることを心から祈っております。
conversation.en_sentence: Hehe, I truly hope that I will be able to meet you next time.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは失礼します。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you and bye now.

title: gossiping about the office 1

conversation.en_sentence: I just passed Mr. Ko's office and he was chewing out our office manager.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、高さんのオフィスの横を通ったら、うちのオフィスマネージャーをこっぴどく叱ってたんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Why?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何で？

conversation.en_sentence: Remember the move we did a couple of weeks ago?
conversation.ja_sentence: ２、３週間前にレイアウト変えたじゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ。

conversation.en_sentence: So, Mr. Ko didn't really think about the phone lines, so now the direct line to the lab is smack in the middle of the IT desk and it's really inconvenient.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、高さんは電話線についてあんまり考えてなかったみたいなんだけど、今、研究室への直通ラインがITデスクのど真ん中を通ってて、すっごく不便なんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: That's not her fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは彼女のせいじゃないじゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: He didn't release the seating chart until after we moved our desks.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼が、席を移動するまで、座席表を発表しなかったじゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: How dumb is that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何て抜けてるんだろ。

conversation.en_sentence: The IT guys had to spend a week getting the intranet lines sorted out because they weren’t told anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: ITの人たち、何も教えられてなかったから、一週間もかけてイントラネットラインを何とかしたんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: And you know how the intranet is organized.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、イントラネットがどれだけ整備されているか知ってるよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't see anything from the lab even though I'm in charge of relaying our customers' needs and checking on the progress of the lab.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は、顧客のニーズを伝えたり研究室の進捗をチェックしたりする担当だけど、研究室からは何にも見えないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I know, and some people aren't even allowed to see the intranet.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知ってるよ、イントラネットを見るのが許されていない人たちもいるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, the IT guys can't move the phone line, so we needed to call in the phone company and since the seating arrangement is really weird now, they have to lift up the raised floors diagonally across our entire office.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、ITの人たちは電話線を動かせないから、電話会社に連絡しなきゃいけなかったんだよね、で、今の席順が凄く変だから、彼らはオフィス全体のOAフロアを斜めに持ち上げてみないといけないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: They are fully booked Saturdays and Sundays until August so we are going to have to shut down the office for a full day next Thursday for them to fix the phone line!
conversation.ja_sentence: ８月まで、土曜と日曜は予約がいっぱいらしいから、電話線を直すために次の木曜、一日中オフィスを閉めないといけなくなったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Not her fault at all but you know our management, it's never their fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全然彼女のせいじゃないじゃない、でも、うちの経営陣っていつもそうだけど、自分たちで責任はとらないんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: She's the longest serving member in this office, besides the management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣の次に一番この職場に長くいるのは彼女だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hasn't she had enough?
conversation.ja_sentence: もう限界じゃないのかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, she is just here for the money and she's ok with that.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、彼女はここにお金のためだけにいて、それでいいらしいけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, she's kind of Zen, and hardly ever takes things personally.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、彼女は禅の精神持ってて、個人的に物を捉えることがほとんどないよね。

conversation.en_sentence: She's really good at what she does so if she had a little more ambition, she will make more money elsewhere!
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女、仕事がすごく出来るから、もうちょっと野心があれば他のところでもっとお金もらえると思うのに！

conversation.en_sentence: Some people are content where they are and are not interesting in advancing their positions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今いるところに満足して、昇進に興味がない人もいるからな。

conversation.en_sentence: Hear, hear.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうだわね。

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, didn't mean that in any disrespectful manner.
conversation.ja_sentence: ごめん、別に見下すつもりで言ったんじゃないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: No offense taken.
conversation.ja_sentence: 別に気にしてないわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm just here to put food on the table.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は、生活のためだけにここにいるんだから。

conversation.en_sentence: I do no overtime and I have no ambitions to take over Dr. Toshinaga's position.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残業もしないし、利永さんの立場を取って代わろうなんて野心もないし。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I mean, you could?
conversation.ja_sentence: え、つまり、出来るかもってこと？

conversation.en_sentence: Are you kidding me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 冗談でしょ？

conversation.en_sentence: She is never going to give up her cushy position of being able to blame everyone else.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の人を責めることばっかりできる、あんな美味しい仕事をあきらめるわけないじゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: When did you join Company R?
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はいつR社に入ったんだっけ？

conversation.en_sentence: 4 years ago when C Fund was courting Company R.
conversation.ja_sentence: CファンドがR社にアプローチしてた４年前。

conversation.en_sentence: They wanted to invest in us badly and Dr. Toshinaga needed a Mandarin speaker to help with the deal.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らがうちにひどく投資をしたがっていて、利永さんが取引のために北京語を話す人を必要としていたのよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So they brought me in.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、私が雇われたの。

conversation.en_sentence: Who referred you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰に紹介されたの？

conversation.en_sentence: I went to college with Mr. Ko.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高さんと一緒の大学だったのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You mean, you went to Yale?
conversation.ja_sentence: それって、イェールに行ったってこと？

conversation.en_sentence: Yep.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Why do we have so many Ivy Leaguers here?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして、ここにはアイビーリーグ大学出身者が多いんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Am I the only college dropout here?
conversation.ja_sentence: 大学中退したのって俺だけか？

title: 会食のお誘い

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、先週お話しした会食の件、ご都合いかがですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, I was wondering what your availability is for the dinner party I spoke about last week?

conversation.ja_sentence: 回答しておらずすみません。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh yes, sorry for not replying.

conversation.ja_sentence: 是非参加させてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please allow me to join you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 良かったです。
conversation.en_sentence: Great.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先方も鈴木さんが来られることを期待してましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: The party from the other company was also hoping you would be able to come.

conversation.ja_sentence: 佐藤部長ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Director Sato?

conversation.ja_sentence: 以前からよくしていただいてるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: He's done a lot for our company.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつからのお付き合いなんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: When did you two become acquainted?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私が新入社員の時からなので、もう15年くらいですかね。
conversation.en_sentence: Since I joined the company, so it must be about 15 years already.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなに長いんですね！
conversation.en_sentence: Oh really, that long?!

conversation.ja_sentence: お店はもう決まりましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: Have you decided on the restaurant?

conversation.ja_sentence: 和食料理のお店にしようかと思ってます。
conversation.en_sentence: I was planning on going to a Japanese restaurant.

conversation.ja_sentence: 佐藤部長のお気に入りのお店を何件か知っているので、良かったら候補に入れてください。
conversation.en_sentence: I know several restaurants that Director Sato likes, so if you like, you can add them to your considerations.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!

conversation.ja_sentence: 人気のお店ばかりだから、早めに予約した方がいいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: As they're all popular restaurants, it would be a good idea to book early.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Understood.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速取り掛かります。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll get on to it right away.

title: 出張旅費精算について

conversation.ja_sentence: 野口さん、先週はサンフランシスコ出張ご苦労様でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Noguchi, I hope you had a nice trip to San Francisco last week.

conversation.ja_sentence: まだ時差ボケが残ってますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I still have a jet lag.

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れのところ申し訳ないのですが、今週中に出張費の清算をお願いできますか。
conversation.en_sentence: I feel bad for asking when you're still tired, but can you finish your expense report for the trip this week?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、今週末が今月の締め日ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh right, the end of this week is the closing for this month.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今週中に精算書を提出いただかないと、翌月経費扱いになって払い戻しが遅れてしまいます。
conversation.en_sentence: If you don't submit your expense report this week, it won't be processed as this month's expense and you won't get paid until later.

conversation.ja_sentence: では今日明日中に領収証など整理して出しますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I'll try to collect all the receipts and do it either today or tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: サンフランシスコで本社のマイクとランチに行って私が二人分支払ったのですが、それも精算していいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I went to lunch with Mike from headquarters in San Francisco which I paid for both of us, and I wonder if I can expense it.

conversation.ja_sentence: すいませんが、それはちょっと。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm afraid not.

conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的には、社員同士は接待できないというルールになっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Basically our employees cannot entertain each other.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱりそうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: そう思ったんですが、ひょっとしたらと思い聞いてみました。
conversation.en_sentence: That's what I thought but I thought it wouldn't hurt to ask.

conversation.ja_sentence: すいません。
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry.

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、別にいいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Not a big deal.

conversation.ja_sentence: マイクとは付き合いも長く、同僚と言うよりも友人ですから。
conversation.en_sentence: Mike and I have known each other so long that it was more like a lunch with my buddy than a work lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: ランチ代はお支払いできなくてすいません。
conversation.en_sentence: I feel bad we can't pay for the lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、空港まで自分の車で行かれたのであれば、それは清算できるのでして下さいね。
conversation.en_sentence: But you can definitely expense it if you used your own car to go to the airport..

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: キロ数で計算するんでしたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: You can get paid by the kilometers you drove, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 精算書の指定欄に運転キロ数を入れていただくと自動計算されるようになっています。
conversation.en_sentence: If you enter the number of kilos in the assigned column on the form, it will automatically be calculated.

conversation.ja_sentence: 駐車代も精算できましたよね?
conversation.en_sentence: I can also expense the parking, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 領収書さえあれば。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as you have receipts.

conversation.ja_sentence: それが問題だ。
conversation.en_sentence: That could be a problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: 帰国後、どこに領収証を置いたか覚えてないんだよな。
conversation.en_sentence: Because I don't remember where I put those receipts after I came home.

conversation.ja_sentence: 頑張って探してくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Good luck finding them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 領収証さえあれば、請求された額はちゃんと払い戻しますので。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as you have all the receipts, you will get paid the full amount you claim.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I know.

conversation.ja_sentence: 整理が苦手で、いつも領収書探しに時間がかかってしまうんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I am so disorganized that it always takes forever to find my receipts.

conversation.ja_sentence: 出張の際に、領収書専用のフォルダーを使ってみてはどうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about trying to use a folder to keep your receipts when you travel?

conversation.ja_sentence: もらった領収書はそこに全部入れるようにすれば、後で探すのが楽だと思うんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: If you put all the receipts in there, it will be easier to find them later.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはいいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's a good idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次の出張の時に試してみます。
conversation.en_sentence: I might try that on the next trip.

conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ。
conversation.en_sentence: Great.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、取り急ぎ今回の出張費精算、早めにお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Anyway I'd appreciate it if you could finish your expense report as soon as possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最終的に処理する前に、記入漏れなどがないか確認したいので、出来れば水曜までに提出いただけますか。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to check if everyting is correct before officially processing it, so can you please give it to me by Wednesday if you can?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日が月曜だから、大丈夫だと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Today's Monday so, sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: お手数ですがよろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for taking care of it.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそいつもお世話になってます。
conversation.en_sentence: No, thank you for reminding me.

title: Meeting: Status Update

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's do a quick review of where we are in contacting startups.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新興企業に当たる前にちょっとおさらいしておこう。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: So I know that we talked to Company A who said they can introduce us to some startups.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社が新興企業を何社かうちに紹介してくれるっていう話だったよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Have they got back to us on this?
conversation.ja_sentence: その件で何か連絡あった？

conversation.en_sentence: No, not yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだありません。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll send them a follow-up email on this.
conversation.ja_sentence: これについてもう一度メールしてみますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: What's the situation with Company B again?
conversation.ja_sentence: B社の状況はどうなってる？

conversation.en_sentence: I contacted Company B last month to schedule a meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先月連絡して、ミーティングを設定しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: When's the meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングはいつ？

conversation.en_sentence: It's next Thursday at 9 o'clock.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の木曜の9時です。

conversation.en_sentence: They will give us a tour of the facility followed-up by a meeting at their office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 施設見学をさせてもらったあと、向こうのオフィスでミーティングします。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: 9 o'clock is a bit early.
conversation.ja_sentence: 9時とはちょっと早いな。

conversation.en_sentence: They told me that they have another meeting from 11 o'clock and that's the only time they can accommodate us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 11時に別のミーティングがあるそうで、9時しか空いていないそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: If that's the case then it can't be helped.
conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、仕方がないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Where is their office?
conversation.ja_sentence: B社のオフィスはどこ？

conversation.en_sentence: It's actually at University A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はA大学内にあります。

conversation.en_sentence: So that's around a thirty minute drive from our office.
conversation.ja_sentence: だからうちのオフィスから車で30分くらいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's go with the company car then.
conversation.ja_sentence: なら、会社の車で行こう。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: When should we leave the office?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何時にオフィスを出ればいい？

conversation.en_sentence: We should leave around eight fifteen.

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん

conversation.ja_sentence: で、実は月曜にA社からある書類がくるんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん

conversation.ja_sentence: 送るのはB社で、それともC社で？

conversation.ja_sentence: B社の方が安いけど、C社の方が配達速いよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、その通りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん

conversation.ja_sentence: どちらかと言えば緊急なので、C社にしましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, got it.

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great!

conversation.ja_speaker: イレイン ヤングさん

title: 納期の連絡

conversation.ja_sentence: お電話ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for calling.

conversation.ja_sentence: A株式会社です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is A Corporation.

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Tanaka from C Corporation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 佐藤部長はいらっしゃいますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is Director Sato there?

conversation.ja_sentence: おりますよ、少々お待ちください。

conversation.ja_sentence: お電話代わりました、佐藤です。

conversation.ja_sentence: 田中さん、いつもお世話になっております。

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週はわざわざ来ていただいてありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、受注いただきありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速ですが納期の件、2か月で問題なさそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Getting down to business, it seems that delivery in two months won't be an issue.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですか！
conversation.en_sentence: Really?!

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、本当に助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks a lot, that's really helpful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 毎回と言われると厳しいのですが、初回ですし今回は特別に、と工場長からOK頂きました。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be tough if you said you wanted it done that quickly every time, but as it's the first time, I got the okay from the factory manager, as a special favor for this time.

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次回以降はもっとリードタイムを十分に取るようにします。

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_sentence: ではこのまま進めさせていただきますので、宜しくお願い致します。

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, thank you, too.

title: 受注業者選択ミーティング

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、今後の受注業者を決めるためのミーティングを始めます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let's get this meeting to decide our future contractor underway.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今までのH社で行くか、C社に変更するかを話し合いたいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to discuss whether we should continue to go with Company H, or switch to Company C.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、まずH社のメリットを教えてください。
conversation.en_sentence: So, first of all, please tell us the merits of Company H.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もう5年は継続して納入してもらっているので相互間での受注システムが出来上がっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, well, we've been continuously supplied by them for 5 years already, and we have established an ordering system between us.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、デメリットは何でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: So, what are the disadvantages?

conversation.ja_sentence: リードタイムが長く、また先方の担当者の対応があまり良くなく、何度要求しても改善されません。
conversation.en_sentence: The lead times are long, and the interaction on the part of the person in charge is not great, even though we have requested improvement many times.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、C社のメリットは何でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, and what are the merits of Company C?

conversation.ja_sentence: C社は何といっても対応が早いです。
conversation.en_sentence: Company C are, above all else, very quick to respond.

conversation.ja_sentence: 納期も問題なく、柔軟に対応してくれます。
conversation.en_sentence: They always respond flexibly, and delivery times are not a problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、デメリットを教えてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please list some disadvantages.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい受注先なので、スムーズな業務の流れを確立するために担当者ベースですり合わせが必要です。
conversation.en_sentence: As we are a new customer, it's necessary to constantly iron out the kinks with the person in charge in order to establish a smooth flow of work.

conversation.ja_sentence: なので、長い目で見ればC社の方が良いのかもしれません。
conversation.en_sentence: So, in the long run, Company C might be better.

conversation.ja_sentence: 料金面ではどうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What about on the money side of things?

conversation.ja_sentence: H社の方が若干安いですが、そこまで変わらないです。
conversation.en_sentence: Company H is slightly cheaper, but there's not much difference.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、C社に変更したほうが良さそうかと思いますが、みなさんどうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Well I think it would be better to change to Company C, what do you all think?

conversation.ja_sentence: 賛成です。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私も賛成です。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的に後どのくらいで変更できそうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How long exactly is the change likely to take?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、C社にも確認しないといけませんが、後3か月ほどで変更できるかと思われます。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I need to check this with Company C, but it seems like we will be able to change to them in about 3 months.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、こちらもその予定で動きますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, we will also move along those lines.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: またスケジュールの詳細は改めて連絡します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will let you know the detailed schedule another time.

title: オフィス向け宅配弁当のモニター

conversation.ja_sentence: さっき受付に来てた人は誰？
conversation.en_sentence: Who was that at the reception earlier?

conversation.ja_sentence: この辺りのオフィス向けに弁当の宅配をしている業者さんだって。
conversation.en_sentence: It was a bento vendor who supplies offices in the neighborhood.

conversation.ja_sentence: このビルに入っているテナントに顧客がいるらしくて。
conversation.en_sentence: They seem to have customers in this building.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社にも飛び込み営業してきたみたいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: They came in for a sales pitch.

conversation.ja_sentence: 話を聞いたの？
conversation.en_sentence: How was it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 最初は興味なかったから、受付電話で話を終わりにしようかと思っていたんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I wasn't much interested at first and planned on just speaking to him by inter-com.

conversation.ja_sentence: パンフレットだけでも受け取ってくれ、って言われたから対応したの。
conversation.en_sentence: But they insisted that I at least look at their menu pamphlet.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのパンフレットがこれなんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: This is it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 意外と良さそうなメニューだね。
conversation.en_sentence: It looks nice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 毎日、和食、洋食、中華から選べるんだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Every day you get to choose between Japanese, Western, or Chinese options.

conversation.ja_sentence: 受付締め切り時間も当日の朝９時半っていうのも融通が利いていいね。
conversation.en_sentence: They accept orders until nine thirty in the morning on the day which is pretty generous.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなの、それに今はキャンペーン中なんだって。

conversation.ja_sentence: ３日間モニターキャンペーン。

conversation.ja_sentence: １社につき８人まで３日間無料。
conversation.en_sentence: For each company, orders are free for up to 8 people for 3 days.

conversation.ja_sentence: その後は、継続して注文してもしなくてもいいみたい。
conversation.en_sentence: After that you can decide to continue on as a customer.

conversation.ja_sentence: へー、俺、モニターしてみようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, I'd be interested in that!

conversation.ja_sentence: 毎日ランチのことを考えるのも面倒だったし、何より貴重な昼休みを移動で使いたくない。
conversation.en_sentence: It's so boring to think about where to go for lunch everyday and  it's a waste of time to spend your precious lunch hour going to-and-from as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: そういう人、結構いるかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think there are more people like you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 営業さんみたいに、日中外出する人は別として。
conversation.en_sentence: Other than the sales people who are out most of the day...

conversation.ja_sentence: 内勤の人は結構そう思っていると思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think most people who work in the office think similarly.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、このパンフレットを休憩室に張り出そうかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I will put the menu up in the coffee room.

conversation.ja_sentence: 希望者募って、モニター申し込んでみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll ask who might be interested and apply for the promotion.

conversation.ja_sentence: 希望者が殺到するんじゃないの？
conversation.en_sentence: What if more than 8 people express interests?

conversation.ja_sentence: その時は抽選で。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll have to draw for that then.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、当選したいなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope I win!

title: 新人育成の難しさ

conversation.ja_sentence: 新人研修プログラムの問題点と改善可能な点を確認しましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's identify the issues and possible improvements for our new hire training program.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず、一番の問題は、ここ数年の新人離職率の上昇、特に入社３ヶ月以内の社員の率が高くなっている事です。
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, the biggest issue is that our new hire turnover rate has been higher in the last few years, noticeably high for the new employees in the first 3 months.

conversation.ja_sentence: んー、なんだろなぁ、最近の子は見切りつけるのが早いのか、辛抱できないのか...
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, I don't get it, today's young people either waste no time or have no patience....

conversation.ja_sentence: 研修のみが原因ではないでしょうが、改善出来る点は多々あると思われます。
conversation.en_sentence: Our trainings are probably not the only reason, nevertheless, we can improve a lot of things.

conversation.ja_sentence: いずれにしても、最初の研修内容が満足するものであれば、新入社員の保持に繋がりますよね。
conversation.en_sentence: In any case, if the initial training program is satisfiable, it'll lead to retaining newly hired employees, I believe.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当たり前ですが、新人研修は新入社員が基本的な業務知識を身につける事が主目的です。
conversation.en_sentence: Obviously, the main purpose of an onboarding program is to develop within new hires basic job knowledge.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、初めて実社会に出る新社会人の不安払拭も、研修の大切な要素となります。
conversation.en_sentence: However, it is also an essential element of the training to eliminate their anxiety, as young adults entering the real world for the first time.

conversation.ja_sentence: さて皆さん、この２点を踏まえ、何かご提案ありませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Now, everyone, with these two points in mind, could you make any suggestions?

conversation.ja_sentence: 相談窓口を設けるのはどうでしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: How about setting up consultation desks?

conversation.ja_sentence: 研修期間中に配属予定部署の業務内容が合わないと感じる新人もいるはずです。
conversation.en_sentence: During the training period, I'm sure some people would feel that they might be mismatched to the department-to-be-assigned.

conversation.ja_sentence: 相談できれば不安が払拭できるし、部署変更になったとしても再研修が最小限で済みます。
conversation.en_sentence: We can help eliminating their anxiety if they talk to us, and even if they end up changing the department, we'll be able to do that with minimum re-training.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちら側からも面談出来る様にするといいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be better if we can arrange interviews from our side as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 研修期間にトレーナーが適材適所で新人の配置変更する事も少なくはない。
conversation.en_sentence: It is not unusual that trainers decide to assign some trainees to different departments during the training period, to place the right people to the right place.

conversation.ja_sentence: その場合、事前に話し合えれば、配属後の不満が減ると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: In that case, they would feel less frustrated after they were assigned, if we could chat about it beforehand.

conversation.ja_sentence: 研修期間だけではなく、その相談窓口は半年程残しては？
conversation.en_sentence: Not just during the training period, but why don't we keep the consultation desk for half a year or so?

conversation.ja_sentence: 異動願いが言い出せなくて結局退職、なんて事も防げるのではないかしら。
conversation.en_sentence: It might be able to prevent situations like new hires ending up quitting because they didn't dare to request transfer.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは出来そうですね、人事で話を詰めてきます。
conversation.en_sentence: That's sounds do-able, we'll work out details in the HR.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新人の不安は知識不足からくる自信のなさが要因だと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I think that new hires' insecurities arise from lack of self-confidence which is linked to deficient knowledge.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかし現在の研修でも基礎知識はほぼカバーされてますよ？
conversation.en_sentence: But the current training program covers most of the foundational knowledge, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ただ離職率が高いという事は、彼らにとってこのプログラムでは不足なんでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, but I think the high turnover rate tells us that the program is not enough for them.

conversation.ja_sentence: あんまり詰め込みすぎるのは逆効果だと思うなあ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it would have the opposite effect if we cram too much, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新入社員目線で研修内容を検討してみては如何でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about reviewing the training contents from the new hires' perspective.

conversation.ja_sentence: 入社３年前後の社員にアンケートを実施するんです。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll conduct a questionnaire survey with employees who have been with us for about three years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 入社１年目に上手く出来なかった事や、現在でも得意ではないスキルについて聞いてみる。
conversation.en_sentence: Ask about things they couldn't do very well in their first year, and skills they're not good at even now.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでそのデータを研修プログラムに反映させると。
conversation.en_sentence: And the data will be reflected in our training program.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の社員にもいいかも。
conversation.en_sentence: That might be good for some other employees, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、アンケート結果を分析すれば、中間研修プログラムも作成可能です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, if we analyze the survey results, we'll be able to use it to create intermediate trainings as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、早速アンケートのドラフトを作成します。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, we'll draft a questionnaire right away.

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら５年以上の社員からもデータをとってみては？
conversation.en_sentence: Then we should also get data from employees who have been here for over five years.

conversation.ja_sentence: これこれこういった事が出来る新人が欲しいとか、半年でこれが出来る様にベースを作って欲しいとか、具体的に要望をあげてもらう。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll ask them to make specific requests like "we want new hires who can do this and that," or "build their base so that they can do this in half a year," and so on.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはトレーナー経験のある社員に実施した方が効率いいかもしれないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe it would be more efficient if we directed to employees who had trainer experiences.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、でないと、新人に対する不満まで上がってきそうですからね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, otherwise, we would probably end up getting complaints about new hires, too, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、数年前、ウチの部で新人に「電話してる時は上司に役職名付けなくていい」って注意したんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, a few years ago, in our department, I told a new guy "just call your boss without adding a title when you're on the phone."

conversation.ja_sentence: そしたら、その電話を渡す時、その子上司本人に「中山、電話です」って。
conversation.en_sentence: Then, when he handed that phone to the boss himself, the guy said "Nakayama, a call for you."

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、「外部の人と話すとき」って付けないと、今の子ダメですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, you have to add, "when you're talking to people outside of the company" for young people these days.

conversation.ja_sentence: 外国人社員の場合、そういう教え方に気を付けますけどね。
conversation.en_sentence: I keep that kind of things in mind when I train employees from other countries.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本人だったんですけどねぇ、その子。
conversation.en_sentence: He was Japanese, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: ウチでは、風がかなり強い日にね、新人に他の部屋の「窓見てきて」ってお願いしたら、帰ってきて「見てきました」って。
conversation.en_sentence: In my division, on a pretty windy day, I asked a new employee to go to the other room and "check the windows," then he came back and said, "I did!"

conversation.ja_sentence: 後でそこに行くと、窓開けっ放しで部屋中書類散乱状態ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I went there later, the windows were wide open and papers were scattered around, all over the room.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に窓を「見て」きただけ、もう、私失神しそうになりました。
conversation.en_sentence: He literally just "checked" the windows, you know, I almost fainted.

title: Face-to-face conversation: talking about the new employee

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So how has the new guy been?
conversation.ja_sentence: 新人はどう？

conversation.en_sentence: You mean Roy Sasaoka?
conversation.ja_sentence: 佐々岡 ロイのこと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah him.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、彼。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How long has he been with us for?
conversation.ja_sentence: もうどれくらいになる？

conversation.en_sentence: I think just over a year now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一年ちょっとかな。

conversation.en_sentence: He seems to be working hard and learning quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: 頑張ってるし、覚えもよさそうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: His boss seems a bit tough on him though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の上司がちょっと彼にはきついみたいだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope he doesn't burn out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 体調崩さないといいけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The first year is always the toughest.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一年目はいつも一番大変だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's not easy if the job is boring.
conversation.ja_sentence: 退屈な仕事だとなかなか大変だよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or if it isn't your dream job.
conversation.ja_sentence: それか自分の理想の仕事と違うとね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I've learned to just accept the job as just a job.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事はただの仕事だって考えることにしたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Put in the work and get paid.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事をして、給料をもらう。

conversation.en_sentence: Rinse and repeat.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてまた同じことを繰り返す。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I hope he sticks around.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼が長続きするといいな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Changing jobs after just one year of work experience doesn't look too good on a resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一年だけ仕事を経験して転職するのは、履歴書上あまりよくないからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah you want at least one and a half to two years right.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、少なくとも１年半から２年はいたいよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's a tough job market right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 求人市場もなかなか今は難しいしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He should at least try to aim for three years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少なくとも３年は目指したほうがいいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you going to talk to him about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼にその話してみるの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nah.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやぁ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I might talk to his boss though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の上司に話をしてみるかもね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I'll tell him to go easier on Roy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロイに厳しく当たらないように話してみるかも。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be a good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、いい考えだね。

conversation.en_sentence: It would be a bummer to see him go.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼がいなくなったら嫌だからね。

title: サービス案内

conversation.ja_sentence: これよりお食事をご用意致します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will now bring your meal over.

conversation.ja_sentence: 和食は焼き魚、洋食はステーキですが、どちらになさいますか。
conversation.en_sentence: We have grilled fish for the Japanese meal and steak for the Western meal, which would you like?

conversation.ja_sentence: では、洋食にします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will have the Western meal then.

conversation.ja_sentence: かしこまりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Certainly.

conversation.ja_sentence: お食事の前にお飲み物をお持ちしますが、いかがなさいますか。
conversation.en_sentence: I can bring you something to drink before your meal if you'd like.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何がありますか。
conversation.en_sentence: What do you have?

conversation.ja_sentence: ビールやワイン、ソフトドリンクをご用意しております。
conversation.en_sentence: We have beer, wine and soft drinks.

conversation.ja_sentence: ワインにしようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I'll go with wine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本日のワインリストはこちらでございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Here is today's wine list.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何かおすすめはありますか。
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any recommendations?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の前菜はホタテですので、シャンパンと良く合うと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Our appetizer today is scallops so I think it will go well with champagne.

conversation.ja_sentence: ではシャンパンをお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll have the champagne then.

conversation.ja_sentence: ワインがお好きでしたら、メインに合わせて赤ワインもお楽しみください。
conversation.en_sentence: If you like wine, you can enjoy your main dish with red wine as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はフランスの赤ワインを二種類ご用意しております。
conversation.en_sentence: We have two kinds of red wine from France today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 飲み比べもして頂けますので、ご希望でしたらお知らせください。
conversation.en_sentence: You can taste both so please let me know if you'd like that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 楽しみだな。
conversation.en_sentence: I look forward to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: またメインをお持ちする前に伺います。
conversation.en_sentence: I will drop by before I bring your main dish.

title: Meeting: Meet with accounting company to learn about startups

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I'm Josh Burke.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ジョッシュ バークです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I'm Ben Sherman.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ベン シャーマンです。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I'm Sam Lee.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、サム リーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you guys for coming today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はお越しいただきありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please, have a seat.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞ、お座りください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can help yourselves to coffee right behind you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後ろにコーヒーがありますのでご自由にどうぞ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Ben, do you want your coffee black?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベン、コーヒーはブラックで良いですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes please.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、お願い。

conversation.en_sentence: Here you go.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: So maybe I'll start by introducing myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでは私の自己紹介から始めましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm the technology director here at Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はここA社の技術本部長です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Although we are an accounting company, my role here is to facilitate deals with startups.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社は経理会社ではありますが、私の役目はスタートアップ企業との契約促進です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I heard from my colleague that you guys are interested in investing in startups.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで御社が企業投資にご関心があると同僚から聞きました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We recently opened an office in San Jose as we are getting into the whole startup trend.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちはスタートアップ企業のトレンドに乗ろうと最近サンホゼに事務所を開きました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: When did that office open?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It just opened last summer.
conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の夏です。

conversation.en_sentence: That office is planning to create a corporate venture capital to fund new startups.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しいスタートアップ企業に資金提供するベンチャーキャピタルを設立する予定です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: たいへん興味深いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: What type of investment amount are you guys looking at.
conversation.ja_sentence: どの程度の投資額をお考えですか？

conversation.en_sentence: We are looking at under one million dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: 100万ドル以下で考えています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me which industry or field you guys would be interested in?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのような業種や業界にご興味があるか教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We actually brought a list here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はリストを持ってきたんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: どれどれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I can think of a couple startups that you guys might be interested in.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、ご興味を引くような企業２社に心当たりがあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can put you guys in touch with them if you'd like.
conversation.ja_sentence: よろしかったら、ご紹介できますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I can arrange a meet and greet dinner with you and a couple of the startup companies?
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社とスタートアップ企業数社との交流夕食会を企画しましょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, since we have the holidays coming up, how about I get back you in the new year on this.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、もうすぐ年末年始の休暇ですので、この件に関しては来年ご連絡するということでいかがでしょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョッシュ バークさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you guys for coming today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です、今日はお越しいただきありがとうございました。

title: Phone: IT issue

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Ben, has your laptop prompted you to make this update?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、ベン、そっちのラップトップでこの更新指示出てきました？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: どれどれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, I haven't seen this one before.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、見たことないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It looks a bit different from the usual one.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつものとなんか違うような気がするし。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah that's what I thought.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです、僕もそう思いました。

conversation.en_sentence: I wasn't sure if I should do this update or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: 更新していいのかわからなくって。

conversation.en_sentence: I was hoping you've seen it before.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見たことあるかなと思って聞いてみました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe it'd be best if you call the IT department.
conversation.ja_sentence: ITチームに聞いた方がいいと思う。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They should know what to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたらいいか教えくれるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll give them a call now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、電話してみます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Sam from the sales department.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、営業のサムですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Janice, how may I help you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ジャニスです、どうしました？

conversation.en_sentence: My laptop is telling me I need to make an update.
conversation.ja_sentence: ラップトップに更新が必要って指示が出てきたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: But I wasn't sure if I should update or not because I've never seen this one before.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見たことがないようなものなので、更新していいものか迷ってまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.en_sentence: My colleague hasn't seen this before so I thought it would be best to contact you guys.
conversation.ja_sentence: 同じ課の人も見たことがないと言うので、そちらに問い合わせた方がいいと思いまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe it would be quicker if I remotely connect to your laptop and take a look.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらのラップトップをこちらから遠隔操作して、見てみた方が早いかと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can I get you to start the Remote Access program?
conversation.ja_sentence: リモートアクセスプログラムを始めてもらっていいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There should be a shortcut on the desktop.
conversation.ja_sentence: デスクトップにショートカットキーがあるはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you see it?
conversation.ja_sentence: ありました？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I found it.
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、ありました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, so just start that up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった、では、それをちょっと起動してください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Once it's open, there should be an access code.
conversation.ja_sentence: 始まったら、アクセスコードが出てくるはずです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell me what the code is?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのコードを教えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it's XYAH IK28H.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、XYAH IK28Hです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I should be able to access your laptop now.
conversation.ja_sentence: これで、そちらのラップトップにアクセスできるはずです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So the update I'm seeing on your computer isn't a typical update.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、今出ている更新指示はいつものとは違うようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But it is a mandatory one so I'll go ahead and start it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、必須なので更新を始めたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: How long do you think it will take?
conversation.ja_sentence: どれくらいかかりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think this one will take around thirty minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: これですと30分くらいだと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You won't be able to do much while it is updating so, maybe come back in thirty minutes?
conversation.ja_sentence: 更新中はラップトップがあまり使えませんので、30分後に戻ってきてはいかがですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll come back in thirty minutes then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、30分後に戻ってきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャニス グリーンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll give you a call when it's done.
conversation.ja_sentence: 終わったら電話しますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

title: Phone: Checking if everything is alright

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, this is Ben.
conversation.ja_sentence: やあサム、ベンだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben, how is the business trip?
conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れ様です、出張はどうですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The jet lag is killing me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時差ぼけが辛くてね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I slept at 4 o'clock and woke up at 6 o'clock.
conversation.ja_sentence: 4時に寝て、6時に起きたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You're going to have a rough day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は1日大変そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hope you bought your coffee.
conversation.ja_sentence: コーヒーは買われましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm drinking an energy drink right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今栄養ドリンクを飲んでるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have meetings all day today so I need to stay focused.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は1日ミーティングだから集中力がいるんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I'm just calling to make sure if everything is okay at the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、オフィスは大丈夫かと思って電話してるんだが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything I have to sign?
conversation.ja_sentence: 署名がいるものはあるかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Everything is okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: すべて大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: I might need you to sign something for me later today though.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_sentence: 後でファイルを送ってくれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

title: Face-to-face conversation: changing jobs

conversation.ja_sentence: まぁこの会社は結構いいお金くれるし、他に似たような給料をオファーしてくれるとこ見たことないし。

conversation.en_sentence: That's a tough one.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはキツイよな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'm not in a position to make less money right now.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよな、子供二人いたっけ？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん

conversation.en_sentence: Why is that?

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I don't think my skills are transferable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分のスキルが応用が利くと思わないんだよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: My only skills are languages.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会計とか工学とかそういう特別なスキルを持ってないんだよ。

conversation.ja_sentence: でも語学力って大事だと思うけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see languages as a bonus.
conversation.ja_sentence: 語学力はボーナスみたいなもんだと思ってる。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん
conversation.en_sentence: There's no point if you don't have a core skill like accounting or engineering.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会計とか工学とかそういうコアスキルがないとあんまり意味ないんだよね。

conversation.ja_sentence: そこだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ペンスさん

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、だからまだ若いうちに何かコースを受講するのをお勧めするよ。

title: 職場でのハロウィンパーティー

conversation.ja_sentence: 次の議題はハロウィンパーティーです。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's discuss our Halloween party next.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年はどうしましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What are we going to do this year?

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年同様希望者だけ仮装してくるって事でいいんじゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about whoever wants to come in with their costumes on like last year, can?

conversation.ja_sentence: 仮装は仮装でいいんですが、なんか盛り上がりに欠けてたんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Dressing up is fun and all, but it lacked entertainment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 仮装してきてそれで終わりみたいな。
conversation.en_sentence: It was just dressing up and nothing else.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうですよね、イマイチ盛り上がりに欠けていました。
conversation.en_sentence: You are right, it wasn't all that exciting and fun.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年はコンテストをするのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about we have a costume contest this year?

conversation.ja_sentence: コンテストですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Contest?

conversation.ja_sentence: ひとり1票を割り当てて、その日いる社員に誰の仮装が一番か選んでもらいます。
conversation.en_sentence: Everybody gets one vote and chooses whoever is dressed up the best.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで1番になった人には賞品を渡すのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about awarding a prize to the winner?

conversation.ja_sentence: それだと仮装にも気合が入ってもっと盛り上がりそうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: That will motivate people to dress up and make this whole thing fun.

conversation.ja_sentence: 賞品の予算は私が部長に申請しますが多分通ると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I will talk to the manager about the budget for the prize, but I am pretty sure he will be ok with it.

conversation.ja_sentence: それならお菓子の予算もお願いしておいてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Can you include the budget for the candy as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆に配る用のお菓子ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: You mean the candy you are going to hand out?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ、やっぱりハロウィンってそういう印象なので。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I believe Halloween is all about handing out candy.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、お願いしておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I got it, I will talk to him about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年仮装してたのって男性ばっかりでしたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Only the guys who dressed up last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: なにか訳があるんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think there is a reason for that?

conversation.ja_sentence: そういえばさすがに女性は家から着てこれないので遠慮するって意見がありました。
conversation.en_sentence: Somebody mentioned that women are reluctant to commute in costumes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに女性だと通勤時辛いですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see how impractical it is for women to commute that way.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は女性用に更衣室を作るのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about we set up a changing area for women this year?

conversation.ja_sentence: 会議室Aなんかだと、女性社員全員入っても着替えるスペースに余裕がありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Conference room A is spacious enough for all our female employees to be in and change at the same time.

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら男性用の更衣室も準備した方が良いんではないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Then we should designate a changing area for male employee as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: おそらく男性の中にも女性と同じ意見を持ってる人がいると考えられます。
conversation.en_sentence: I am sure there are some guys who feel the same way as the women.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、当日もうひとつ会議室を押さえるようにします。
conversation.en_sentence: I got it, we will try to reserve another conference room.

conversation.ja_sentence: それから賞品の件に戻るんですが、1つではなく複数あった方がいいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Getting back to the prize, we should probably have more than one.

conversation.ja_sentence: 200名近く社員がいるので1つだとなんとなく面白みに欠けます。
conversation.en_sentence: We have close to 200 employees, and one prize doesn't sound too exciting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば最優秀賞、コスプレ賞とかいくつかタイトルを付けた賞があるといいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: We should have different categories such as the best dressed and best cosplay et cetera.

conversation.ja_sentence: 個人もそうですが、部署単位で賞をあげてもいいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: In addition to individual prizes, we can also award departments.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's a great idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他のテナントにも事前に仮装する旨声かけが必要です。
conversation.en_sentence: We also need to let the other tenants know about the costume contest ahead of time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年おかしな人がビル内にいると他テナントから警備員に苦情があったそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: The security received a complaint about a suspicious person coming inside the building last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本の会社ではハロウィンに仮装する方が珍しいですもんね。
conversation.en_sentence: It is rare for Japanese companies to allow their employees to dress up for Halloween.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、私からアナウンスするようにします。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand, I will make an announcement.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日頃の労いも兼ねてその日は会議室に喫茶コーナーを作るのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about setting up a little bar to show appreciation for everybody's hard work.

conversation.ja_sentence: そこで仕事の休憩中に先ほどのお菓子やドリンクを提供するようにします。
conversation.en_sentence: We will have snacks and drinks ready for everybody during their break.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日頃頑張ってもらってるのでそれぐらいは管理部として当然ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: The employees are working very hard, and this the lest we, administration department, can do for them.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、こちらも部長に予算申請をします。
conversation.en_sentence: Gotcha, I will talk to our manager about the budget soon.

conversation.ja_sentence: それではこの感じで進めていきましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, we will go with what we talked about.

title: General Chatting: Discussing business lunch for client

conversation.ja_sentence: 一度クライアントを連れて行ったけど、言ってることがほとんど聞こえなかったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, the ones in the area are mediocre.

title: 機密保持についての新人研修

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、おはようございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning, everyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の新人オリエンテーションへのご参加ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for attending today's new employee orientation.

conversation.ja_sentence: まずは、自己紹介をお願いしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: First, let's ask you to introduce yourselves.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、先月から営業に入った松川です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I am Takashi and I started last month in the sales, nice meeting you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は商品開発の中野です。
conversation.en_sentence: I am Mieko at the product development.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今月入ったばかりです、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I just started this month, nice to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティングの高野です。
conversation.en_sentence: I am Harumi from marketing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月15日の入社です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I started on the 15th of last month, pleasure to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、ありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, everyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: そろそろ当社の雰囲気にも慣れましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it about time that you are used to this company's atmosphere?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まだ一ヶ月ですが、他の部署の皆さんからもよくしていただいています。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it's been only one month, but people from other departments have been nice to me.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は前職と全く違う職種の企業で不安だったのですが、そんな心配は不要でした。
conversation.en_sentence: I was worried since this job is in a completely different field from my last job, but I didn't need to worry at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は留学から帰国後初めての仕事になるのですが、すぐに勘を取り戻すことができました。
conversation.en_sentence: This is my first job after coming home from studying abroad, but I got my work instinct back quickly.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、よかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: Great, good to hear.

conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今日は当社の機密保持規則についてお話させていただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I will talk about the confidentiality protection rules of our company.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょうど先日、うちの部署でその話が出たところでした。
conversation.en_sentence: We just talked about that in our department the other day.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、そうなんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, really?

conversation.ja_sentence: 中野さんと高野さんは、この件について誰かに教えてもらいましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: Have you been taught about it by someone, Mieko and Harumi?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はまだです。
conversation.en_sentence: Not yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は「こういう規則があるよ」と聞いただけで、具体的な内容はまだ存じません。
conversation.en_sentence: I only heard that there were such rules, but I don't know any details yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、ざっと説明しますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, then I will explain it roughly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社には、外部に出してはいけない情報がたくさんあります。
conversation.en_sentence: We have lots of information that cannot be leaked to the outside of our company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、開発中の商品についてなどです。
conversation.en_sentence: For example, information about products being developed.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中野さんの部署は、ほとんどの書類が極秘扱いとなっていると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Mieko's department treat most of all documents as extremely confidential.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はまだそのような書類を扱ってはいないのですが、他の方たちを見ているとそのようです。
conversation.en_sentence: I have not dealt with such documents yet, but when I see other people, it sure looks that way.

conversation.ja_sentence: 営業では、顧客の個人情報を守るという点で、機密保持は非常に重要です。
conversation.en_sentence: At sales, protecting confidentiality is extremely important in terms of protecting personal information of the customers.

conversation.ja_sentence: その点は上司からしっかりと聞かされています。
conversation.en_sentence: My boss has assured me that I knew about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティングは商品開発ほどではないですが、多くの書類が社内使用のみとなっているはずです。
conversation.en_sentence: At marketing, it might not be as much as the product development, but lots of documents are treated as internal only.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、そうなんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: こういった書類には、すべて「社内のみ」など印をつけることになっています。
conversation.en_sentence: All those documents are supposed to be marked such as "internal only".

conversation.ja_sentence: そして、外部の目に触れないように保存することが大切です。
conversation.en_sentence: Then, it is important to keep them so no outsiders can see them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 印をつけるのは、紙の書類についてだけですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it only for paper documents that we need to mark?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、デジタルのみの書類にも印をつけてください。
conversation.en_sentence: No, you need to mark the digital-only documents as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのつけ方は、あとでITのほうから説明してもらいます。
conversation.en_sentence: Someone from IT will explain to you how to mark.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらに書類の機密レベルの判断の仕方が載っているので、皆さん、後で目を通しておいてください。
conversation.en_sentence: This has the instruction on how to judge the confidentiality level of documents, so please read it through later.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分からない部分は後で質問していいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask you questions later if there is something I don't understand?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、次の項目に移りましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Then let's move on to the next item.

title: General Chatting: Can't reach Company A

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben.
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、ベン。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, what's up.
conversation.ja_sentence: おう、サムか、どうした？

conversation.en_sentence: I have a question.
conversation.ja_sentence: お聞きたいことがあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure?
conversation.ja_sentence: いいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you do if you can't get a hold of someone?
conversation.ja_sentence: ある人がつかまらないときって、どうします？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You've tried email and phone I presume?
conversation.ja_sentence: Eメールも電話もしたんだよね？

conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been trying to get a hold of the manager at Company A for two weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の課長さんと連絡とろうとして、もう２週間になるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I've sent an email every week and called twice already.
conversation.ja_sentence: 毎週Eメールを送って、電話はもう2度しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's a fair number of times.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはもう十分だね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I don't think I'm being annoying.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、うるさがられてはいないと思いますが。

conversation.en_sentence: At least not yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: というか、まだ、そう思われてはいないかと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well it's only been two weeks so don't worry too much.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、まだ２週間だから、そう心配するなよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Unless its an emergency.
conversation.ja_sentence: 急ぎでなければ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it's not super urgent.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、超急ぎっていうわけではないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: But I am hoping to get an answer by the end of this month.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、今月末までには返事をもらいたいんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, just send them an email once a week and see how it goes.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、週一回メールを送って、様子をみたら？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If they still don't get back to you then maybe they aren't worth your time.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、返事が来ないようなら、連絡する価値ないってことだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I mean it's basic manner to reply emails or return calls right.
conversation.ja_sentence: というのは、Eメールや電話を返すのは基本的なマナーだからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can't expect a good business relationship if they don't have proper business etiquette.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんとしたビジネスエチケットがないような会社なら、良いビジネス関係は築けないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah that's true.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイスをありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll give them until the end of the month for them to reply me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今月末まで返事を待つことにします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, don't stress yourself out too much.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、あまり気を揉むなよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Just see how it goes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 成り行きに任せるってことで。

title: ツアー企画の手配内容確認の会話

conversation.en_sentence: Nakata-san, can I talk to you now about the arrangements after the awards ceremony?

conversation.ja_sentence: C旅行社さんにお知らせしてもいい頃かと思いまして。

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱり、日程のせいか今年は皆さんの動きも早いですね。

title: Training: Advice on developing new business

conversation.en_sentence: How do you develop new business?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやって新規事業を開発していますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The simple answer to that is find a demand and fill that demand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 簡単に言うと、需要を見つけて、その需要を満たすってことだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But obviously it's not that easy.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし当然、言うほど単純ではないんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will need to find a supply source, and if the price is competitive or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: 供給元や、その価格が競争力が高いかどうかを見極めないといけない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You either have to find a cheaper product, or a brand new product.
conversation.ja_sentence: より安い製品を見つけるか、まったくの新製品を見つけたりしないといけない。

conversation.en_sentence: They both sound hard to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: どちらも大変そうですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'm sure all the big players already have access to good suppliers.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、大手企業はすでに良いサプライヤーを利用しているしね。

conversation.en_sentence: How did you start that recent business of importing from Japan?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近始めた日本からの輸入事業、どうやって始めたのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well funny story.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、面白い話なんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Our customer who buys product from here, started making a new product.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちから製品を買っているお客さんが新製品を作り始めたんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: And I realized that there was a shortage of that product in North America.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、その製品が北米では不足しているってことに気づいた。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So our customer became our supplier.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、そのお客さんがサプライヤーになったんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: So new business can develop from existing relationships that we have?
conversation.ja_sentence: ということは、現行ビジネスから新事業が生まれることもあるってことですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、そのとおり。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It'll be much easier to keep the deal exclusive.
conversation.ja_sentence: 独占取引を維持するのはもっと簡単だろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: Right, because you already have a business relationship in place.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、すでにビジネス関係が構築されているからですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Another advice is to stay up to date on what's happening in the market.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう一つは、市場がどうなっているか常に最新情報を入手しておくことだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Read the industry websites, and just stay updated on current events.
conversation.ja_sentence: 業界のサイトを見たり、時事問題をキャッチしていることだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You never know what might come up.
conversation.ja_sentence: どんなことが起きるか予測できないからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

title: 自動車買い替えについての雑談

conversation.ja_sentence: そういえば、車の買い替えをしたいって言っていませんでしたか？
conversation.en_sentence: By the way, didn't you say that you wanted to buy a new car?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、燃費が気になるしハイブリッド車にしたいなあと思っているんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, I'm worried about fuel consumption and so I'm wondering about getting a hybrid car.

conversation.ja_sentence: それじゃあ買い替えはもう少し待ったほうがいいかもしれませんよ。
conversation.en_sentence: In that case, it might be better to hold off a little longer before replacing it.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてなの？
conversation.en_sentence: Why is that?

conversation.ja_sentence: テレビ番組でやってたんですが、リチウム固体電池が実用化されそうなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I saw it on a TV program, but it seems that solid-state lithium batteries will soon become a viable option.

conversation.ja_sentence: リチウム電池は聞いたことがあるけど、リチウム固体電池とは初めて聞いたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I've heard of lithium batteries, but this is the first I've heard about solid-state lithium batteries.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今のリチウム電池は電子のやり取りに電解液を使っているんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, the current kind of lithium batteries use liquid electrolytes to exchange electrons.

conversation.ja_sentence: 電池は液漏れに注意っていうから、液体が入っているんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, so batteries say beware of leaks because they actually contain liquid.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、液漏れすると大変ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, and it's a big problem if they leak.

conversation.ja_sentence: 固体電池っていうからには、液体じゃないってことなの？
conversation.en_sentence: So, in other words, a solid-state battery is not liquid?

conversation.ja_sentence: 電解質が液体じゃなくて固体なんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the electrolytes are solid rather than liquid.

conversation.ja_sentence: 固体だと何かいいことあるの？
conversation.en_sentence: Is there something better about the fact that they're solid?

conversation.ja_sentence: 液体の電解質は可燃性だから、高温になると発火するし液漏れがまずいんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, liquid electrolytes are flammable, so they can burst into flames if they get hot, and leakage can be really bad.

conversation.ja_sentence: スマホの発火事件について一時期ニュースでやってたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that's right, there was a period when the news was constantly covering cases of smartphones bursting into flames, wasn't there.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも開発が進んでる固体電池だと発火もしないし液漏れもなしなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: But, the solid-state batteries currently under development won't burst into flames, and there's no danger of leaking either.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうなの？
conversation.en_sentence: Huh, is that so?

conversation.ja_sentence: 安全になるね。
conversation.en_sentence: So they will become safer then.

conversation.ja_sentence: 液漏れの心配がないから、液体電池用にあるセパレーターが無くなって小さくなるらしいです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, and apparently, since leaks are not a concern, the separator required for liquid batteries disappears, making the whole thing smaller overall.

conversation.ja_sentence: 良い事尽くしだね。
conversation.en_sentence: There's all kinds of benefits then.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも充電時間とか容量とはどうなの？
conversation.en_sentence: But what about the charging time and capacity?

conversation.ja_sentence: 充電時間は半分くらいになって容量も倍以上になるらしいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Supposedly, the charging time is cut in half and the capacity is more than double.

conversation.ja_sentence: うわあ、本当にいい事尽くしじゃないか。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's really amazing.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: その固体電池の実用化が2020年が目途になっているそうですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: They say that 2020 is the target for implementing solid-state batteries commercially.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあその頃にはハイブリッド自動車にも搭載されるのかな？
conversation.en_sentence: So, around that time they'll be installed in hybrid cars, too?

conversation.ja_sentence: きっとそうですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, without a doubt.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今、開発中だと思いますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: But I think they're still under development at the moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、あと2年くらい待ったら新製品が出るかもしれないね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, so if I wait another 2 years or so, there may be a new product available.

conversation.ja_sentence: きっとそうなるでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: I think that will surely be the case.

conversation.ja_sentence: 買い替えはもう少し待って様子を見てみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, well I think I'll wait a bit longer and observe the situation before buying anything new.

conversation.ja_sentence: それがいいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I think that would be a good idea.

title: 社内改善の動き

conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、珠璃愛、イベントの件、社内掲示板見た？

conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒に営業行けば良かったな、セクハラ気味の課長がいる経理じゃなくて...
