conversation.ja_sentence: え、やだ恋那、それ人事に報告しなきゃ！
conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, you have to report that to the HR, Rena!

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、もう大丈夫なの、っていうか、課長も研修後は気を付けてるみたい。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, not now, well, he's being careful after the training, I guess.

conversation.ja_sentence: 意識しないでやっちゃってたタイプだったし、それに、元々そんな悪い人じゃないのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Masaaki is a kind of guy who was doing it without intention, and he's fundamentally not a bad guy, really.

conversation.ja_sentence: あの研修で自分がちょっとヤバいって分かったみたい。
conversation.en_sentence: I think that training made him realize what he had been doing was not quite right.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、じゃ、無駄じゃなかったって訳だ、海棠部長はあれ行くの嫌々だったけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, then it wasn't that bad, though Kiichi was not happy about attending that one.

conversation.ja_sentence: 数日あったみたいだし、そういうのした事ない人にはホントに時間の無駄だったんだよ、きっと。
conversation.en_sentence: It went on for a few days, so it was waste of time for people who never did these kind of things, probably.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと、ウチの会社なんか頑張ってるかも、社内研修の機会も増えたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it seems like our company is working on something here, we have more training opportunities, too!

conversation.ja_sentence: ねー、セミナーとか資格取得も会社がカバーしてくれるの増えたしねー！
conversation.en_sentence: I know, the company covers the expenses for more seminars and certification courses now!

conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、私もちょっと受けたいなーって思ってるコースあるんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, actually I've found this course that I'm kind of interested in taking.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、仕事の後に別の駅まで3ヶ月くらい通わなきゃだから、時間とれるか微妙なんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: But I'll have to go to the other station after work for a few months, so I'm not sure if I can make time for it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 同じ様なのないかな、ほら、社内研修とかeラーニングとか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can't you take a similar one, you know, like an in-house training or eLearning?

conversation.ja_sentence: 人事サポートシステムの研修リスト見たんだけど、私の受けたいのはなかったの。
conversation.en_sentence: I've looked through available trainings in the HR support system, but I couldn't find the one I wanted to take.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確か研修も社員からの提案OKって書いてなかったっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm quite sure they said training proposals from the employees are accepted, too, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 細かい事わかんないけど、提案書イントラネットに載せて、希望人数集まれば研修リストに追加とかって。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't know the details but, they'll put up your proposal on the intranet and if enough people are interested, it'll be added to the training list, or something.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、その部分ちゃんと見てなかった。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I didn't pay attention to that part.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、あのコース、そんなに希望者いるかなぁ...
conversation.en_sentence: But I'm not sure if there will be so many applicants for that course....

conversation.ja_sentence: わかんないじゃん、他部署にいるかもだし、提案書もイントラネットにあったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You never know, maybe there's some in other departments, and you can make proposal on the intranet, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、出してみようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, maybe I'll do that then.

conversation.ja_sentence: 恋那、本当にウチらの会社良くなってきてる気がするね。
conversation.en_sentence: Rena, I feel our company is really getting better, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: だからぁ、珠璃愛、一緒にイベント提案してウチらも環境改善貢献しようよー。
conversation.en_sentence: So, Julia, why don't we send an event idea, so we can contribute to make the workplace better, too!

conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、ウチらみたく同期の人以外、他部署の人達と話す機会そんな無いもんね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, we don't have much chance to talk to people from other departments, except those who started working in the same year like us.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなのー、だから、みんなで打ち解けられそうなイベント、何かな？
conversation.en_sentence: That's so true, so, what activity do you think is good for everyone to get along?

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、ありきたりだけどボーリングとかなら世代も関係なくない？
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, it's a classic but, something like bowling would be good for any generation, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: マクマラン課長、ほらぁ、CX企画部の、ボーリングイベントって参加するかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Kyle, you know, from the CX promotion, do you think he'll come to a bowling event?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは知らないけど、むかし営業だったみたいで、たまにウチで見るな、海棠部長と一緒に居るの。
conversation.en_sentence: I have no idea, but I've heard he was once in sales, so I sometimes see him around, being with Kiichi.

conversation.ja_sentence: えー、いいなー、見た目から王子だよねー！
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, I'm jealous, he looks like a prince in real life!

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、憧れなんだけど仕事で接点ないからさあ、このイベントならね...
conversation.en_sentence: I'm so into him but don't have any connection at work, so maybe at the event....

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、あの人って外見キラキラだけど...
conversation.en_sentence: Hmmm, that guy looks dazzling, but....

conversation.ja_sentence: なんか、腹黒っぽくない？
conversation.en_sentence: He seems to have something dark inside, you know?

title: ランチのときの同僚同士の会話

conversation.ja_sentence: 若松さん、お弁当自分で作っているの？
conversation.en_sentence: Ms. Wakamatsu, do you make your own lunch?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、自分で作っていますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I do.

conversation.ja_sentence: えらいなー。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, I'm impressed.

conversation.ja_sentence: おいしそうなお弁当だね。
conversation.en_sentence: Your lunch looks so yummy.

conversation.ja_sentence: いちおう、栄養バランスを考えて作ってます。
conversation.en_sentence: I do think about the nutritional balance when I make them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 料理、好きなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I like to cook.

conversation.ja_sentence: かぶ漬けとかも自分で作っちゃう。
conversation.en_sentence: I make my own pickled turnip.

conversation.ja_sentence: えっそのかぶ漬け、自家製なの？
conversation.en_sentence: Really, homemade pickled turnip?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 漬物おいしく作るのって、難しいでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Making pickles must be difficult.

conversation.ja_sentence: おばあちゃんぐらい経験豊富な人じゃなきゃ、おいしく作れないイメージ。
conversation.en_sentence: It feels like unless you are a grandma, you won't have enough experience to make good pickles.

conversation.ja_sentence: ほんとうに上手に作れる人って、なかなかいないよね。
conversation.en_sentence: There aren't many people who can make homemade pickles well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は私も、祖母から作り方教わったんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, my grandmother taught me how to make them.

conversation.ja_sentence: おばあちゃん、お料理上手な方なのね。
conversation.en_sentence: Your grandmother must be a good cook too.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、若松さんは若いのにもう上手に作れるんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: And you're still young and make good pickles already, Ms. Wakamatsu?

conversation.ja_sentence: すごいなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: I am impressed.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私なんか買って食べるしか考えたことない。
conversation.en_sentence: I only ever buy my pickles from the store.

conversation.ja_sentence: 売っているものは、口に合うものを見つけるまでがたいへんじゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't it hard to find what you like from the stores?

conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で作ると、自分の好きな味にできますから。
conversation.en_sentence: If you make them yourself, you can make them how you like.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも微妙な味付けのバランスって、才能とセンスがいるよね。
conversation.en_sentence: But to perfect the taste you need talent and good sense.

conversation.ja_sentence: 若松さんはきっと、お料理上手のおばあさんの血を受け継いでいるんだね。
conversation.en_sentence: You must have your talented grandmother's gene, Ms. Watamatsu.

conversation.ja_sentence: うらやましいな。
conversation.en_sentence: I envy you.

title: 人事関係の話

conversation.ja_sentence: では人事関係のミーティングを始めます。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's begin the meeting about human resources.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の議題はなんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What is the topic for today?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、H事業部の山元さんのことです。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, it's about Yamamoto-san in H department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今月はまだ問題ないんですが先月が結構ひどいんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: He has been doing fine this month, but he did terribly last month.

conversation.ja_sentence: ひどいとはどんな状態なんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you mean by terribly?

conversation.ja_sentence: まず、1日と2日に無断欠勤をしています。
conversation.en_sentence: First off, he had unapproved absences on the first and the second.

conversation.ja_sentence: 山元さんの上長が欠勤に気づき、朝電話をしても出なかったそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: His supervisor noticed and made a phone call in the morning, but he never answered.

conversation.ja_sentence: 2日の夜に連絡があり風邪で寝込んでいたので連絡できなかったとのことです。
conversation.en_sentence: He finally called back on the night of the second and said he had been sick in bed and unable to call.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなにひどい状態だったならありえそうですが。
conversation.en_sentence: If he had been that sick, it's understandable.

conversation.ja_sentence: ところがその割に、3日はかなり元気そうに出勤したそうなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Despite the fact how sick he said he had been, he showed up all perky and lively on the third.

conversation.ja_sentence: 1日の夜に山元さんを居酒屋で見たという情報もあります。
conversation.en_sentence: Somebody told me that Yamamoto-san was spotted at a Izakaya on the night of the first.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに山元さん、たまにすれ違った時にお酒の匂いがする時がありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Come to think of it, I sometime get a whiff of alcohol from Yamamoto-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月はそれだけじゃないんですよ！
conversation.en_sentence: That's not the only thing all he did last month.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今度は15日に3時間ほど遅刻してきたそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: He came in three hours late on the fifteenth.

conversation.ja_sentence: まるで重役出勤ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: As if he was an executive coming to work late.

conversation.ja_sentence: 上長が訳を聞いたところ、歯医者に行ってたそうなんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: He said he had been at the dentist when asked the reason by his supervisor.

conversation.ja_sentence: その真偽は、歯医者の領収証でわかるんじゃないんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can we confirm it with the receipt from the dentist?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです、当然上長もそれを見せてくれと山元さんに言ったそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, of course his supervisor asked Yamamoto-san to provide it too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ところが、知人なのでタダでやってもらったからと見せないそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: But he wouldn't since his friend was the dentist and would not charge him.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと怪しいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds suspicious.

conversation.ja_sentence: 山元さんって実家から通っているんでしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Does Yamamoto-san commute from his parent's house?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、実家はA町で遠いので会社近くで一人暮らしをしています。
conversation.en_sentence: No, he lives by himself nearby since his parent's house is in town A, which is far.

conversation.ja_sentence: 注意する人もいないということですね。
conversation.en_sentence: He doesn't have anybody to get onto him.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一度本人を呼び出して直接話を聞いたほうがいいかもしれないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: We should get him over here and talk to him in person for once.

conversation.ja_sentence: 山元さんの上長は、彼についてどうコメントしてるんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What does his supervisor say about him?

conversation.ja_sentence: 上長の菅井さんは、山元さんをかなり擁護していますね。
conversation.en_sentence: His supervisor, Sugai-san, is defending Yamamoto-san a lot.

conversation.ja_sentence: 風邪の話も歯医者の話も絶対嘘ではないと信じています。
conversation.en_sentence: He believes both his sickness and dentist appointment were not lies.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私もどちらかといえば今のところ菅井さん側の意見ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree with Sugai-san if you ask me now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 絶対に黒だと言えない状況なので、黒が確定できるまでは信じたほうがいいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: We can't definitely say he is lying yet, so we should probably believe him unless his lies are proven.

conversation.ja_sentence: 遠藤さんはどう思いますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Endo-san, what do you think?

conversation.ja_sentence: H事業部全体から見ると沢尻さんはそこそこ部に貢献していると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: From the perspective of H department, he does contribute to the department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 風邪か歯医者かもしかしたらどちらかは嘘かもしれません。
conversation.en_sentence: Either his sickness or the dental appointment might be a lie.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただそうだとしても、一度ぐらいは目をつぶってもいいのでは無いでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Even if it is a lie, can we just let it slip for once?

conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社で一番慌ただしいH事業部なので山元さんもストレスがあるかもしれません。
conversation.en_sentence: H department is the busiest one here, and Yamamoto-san might be stressed out.

conversation.ja_sentence: ここは厳重にすべきでは無いでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Shouldn't we be strict with him here?

conversation.ja_sentence: H事業部の他の社員に示しが付かなくなります。
conversation.en_sentence: He is setting a bad example for the rest of employees in H department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 意見が分かれてしまいましたね。
conversation.en_sentence: We have two different opinions here.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、こうするのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, how about this.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今は保留にして、今月いっぱい様子を見てまたこの会を持つのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: We should put this on hold for now and continue monitoring him the rest of the month and then we can have a meeting about him again.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、そうしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I gotcha, let's do that.

title: 同僚同士のスキー旅行計画の会話

conversation.ja_sentence: 週末のスキーの話、聞いた？
conversation.en_sentence: Did you hear about the ski event on the weekend?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、まだです。
conversation.en_sentence: No, not yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: また行くんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you guys going again?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、伊藤課長が前回相当楽しかったみたいで、また行こうって張り切っちゃってて。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it seems Ito-san had a blast last time and is all pumped up and wants to go again.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: スキーっていうより、ロッジでビール飲んで盛り上がってましたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: He was more pumped up from drinking beer at the lodge than skiing though.

conversation.ja_sentence: これがメインですか、ってかんじ。
conversation.en_sentence: Like this is what I look forward to.

conversation.ja_sentence: スキー滑るのも楽しいけど、合間のあのビールがまたいいんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Skiing is fun too but the beer in between is awesome.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: 夜の飲み会とは全く違うし、すがすがしいかんじですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's refreshing, and is completely different than a drinking party at night.

conversation.ja_sentence: そっちがメインになるのも、分かります。
conversation.en_sentence: I can understand why people will look forward to that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 田沢湖は、天気がいいと景色も最高ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: The view of Lake Tazawa is awesome when the weather is nice.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、湖を見下ろしながら滑れるから、最高だよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, skiing down and looking down at the lake is pretty awesome.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、帰りの温泉ね。
conversation.en_sentence: And the hot spring on the way back.

conversation.ja_sentence: 盛りだくさんですものね。
conversation.en_sentence: Everything is awesome.

conversation.ja_sentence: 石川さんも、行くでしょう？
conversation.en_sentence: You're going to go too right, Ishikawa-san?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ぜひ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, by all means.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は、何人ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How many people do we have this time?

conversation.ja_sentence: 運転手は？
conversation.en_sentence: Who's the driver?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今のところは9人で、三上くんと高橋くんと井上くんが車出すって言ってたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: We have nine people so far, and Mikami-kun, Takahashi-kun and Inoue-kun said they will drive.

conversation.ja_sentence: 集合は、会社ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: We're meeting at the office?

conversation.ja_sentence: また5:30集合ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Will we be meeting at five thirty again?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、多分前回と同じスケジュール。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I think it will be the same schedule as last time.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ私、井上くんに途中で拾ってもらいます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will ask Inoue-kun to pick me up on his way here.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、直接話してみて。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you can talk to him directly.

title: 報道発表についてのインタビュー

conversation.ja_sentence: お忙しい中インタビューに応じていただき、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your time for this interview during your busy schedule.

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、とんでもないです。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem, it's my pleasure.

conversation.ja_sentence: ３０分しか時間が取れませんが、いいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I hope it's ok with you that I only have half an hour.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、充分です。
conversation.en_sentence: That's more than plenty.

conversation.ja_sentence: 電話やメールより実際に会ってインタビューさせていただけるのはとても貴重です。
conversation.en_sentence: It's very important that I can talk to you in person, rather than phones, or emails.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速質問させていただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: May I start my first question?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Certainly.

conversation.ja_sentence: ３日前の報道発表資料についてです。
conversation.en_sentence: It's about the press release distributed three days ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: S社のシステムを御社が大量導入契約しましたね。
conversation.en_sentence: Your company signed the contract with S company to adopt a major number of their system, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的にライセンスの数はどのくらいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How many licenses are you talking about?

conversation.ja_sentence: はっきりした数字は公表できませんが、全世界のオフィスに導入ということです。
conversation.en_sentence: I can't disclose the exact number, but we are going to deploy it in all of our offices globally.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、それは相当な数ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see that's a quite a few.

conversation.ja_sentence: 導入の決め手はなんだったのでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What was the point that made you decide to adopt it?

conversation.ja_sentence: クラウドでの管理と多言語への対応です。
conversation.en_sentence: Cloud management and multi-language availability.

conversation.ja_sentence: 多言語とは、何ヶ国語になりますか？
conversation.en_sentence: How many multiple languages?

conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的には英語ですが、使用者の希望によって１０ヶ国語に対応してます。
conversation.en_sentence: Basic language is English, however, ten languages are available depending on the users' preference.

conversation.ja_sentence: 言語の切り替えがワンクリックで可能なんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Languages can be switched back and forth with one click.

conversation.ja_sentence: アプリケーションをローカライズしたものではなく、自動翻訳機能だそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Application is not localized, but it is due to auto translation feature.

conversation.ja_sentence: 言葉のためのミスコミュニケーションがほぼ皆無になると期待しています。
conversation.en_sentence: We have high hope that miscommunication because of the language will be virtually eliminated.

conversation.ja_sentence: 自動翻訳がかなり完成されているということですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Can we say that auto translation now is pretty perfected?

conversation.ja_sentence: 技術的なことはわかりませんが、その正確さには驚きました。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't know the technology behind it, but I was amazed how accurate they were.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私も３ヶ国語がわかるので実際に確認してみました。
conversation.en_sentence: I speak three languages, so I tried on my own.

conversation.ja_sentence: 対応言語はもっと増えるみたいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I understood that there are more languages coming.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはすごいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's impressive.

conversation.ja_sentence: クラウドでの管理について教えてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Can you talk about the cloud management?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まず一番の懸念だったはセキュリティです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, our most concern was the security.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: ハックされたら社命に関わりますからね。
conversation.en_sentence: Our company's future is at stake if we get hacked.

conversation.ja_sentence: S社とかなり詰めましたが、クラウドのほうがセキュリティ性が高いということに納得しました。
conversation.en_sentence: We had discussion with S Company in details, and fully understood that the cloud had higher security.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何と比べてですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Compared with what?

conversation.ja_sentence: 社内のデータセンターです。
conversation.en_sentence: Compared to our in-house data center.

conversation.ja_sentence: コスト的にはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about the cost?

conversation.ja_sentence: コストも社内データセンターで管理するより効率的です。
conversation.en_sentence: It is more efficient than managing at in-house data center.

conversation.ja_sentence: 社内システムをアップグレードするコストより、クラウドへの移行が理にかなっていました。
conversation.en_sentence: It made sense for us to move to the cloud than upgrading the in-house systems.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の成長に拍車がかかりそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It sounds like your company will grow even faster.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私もそれを期待しています。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope so, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much for today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 追加の質問があったらメールをください。
conversation.en_sentence: If you have more questions, please e-mail me.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうさせていただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 玄関まで送りましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I will walk you out to the front.

title: Training: advice on scheduling business itinierary

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben, I was wondering if you can give me some advice on arranging the business trip for Mr. Takeda from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベン、A社の竹田さんの出張手配についてちょっと教えてくれます？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is Mr. Takeda flying direct from Japan?
conversation.ja_sentence: 竹田さんは日本から直行便で来るの？

conversation.en_sentence: He is actually transferring in Seattle.
conversation.ja_sentence: シアトルで乗り継ぎみたいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should make sure that his connecting flight isn't delayed or running early.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、乗り継ぎ便が遅れたり早まったりしていないかチェックしないとね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We have to make sure we will be at the airport to pick him up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 空港出迎えも準備しておかないと。

conversation.en_sentence: Can't he just take public transit?
conversation.ja_sentence: 公共の電車バスじゃだめなんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He's a senior director.
conversation.ja_sentence: 竹田さんは専務だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Which means.
conversation.ja_sentence: というと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It means we need to make sure his visit is perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 粗相のないようにしないといけないということだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have you arranged his accommodation?
conversation.ja_sentence: ホテルはとったの？

conversation.en_sentence: I called today and we are good to go.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日電話してとりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Did you tell the hotel that the guest will check-in early?
conversation.ja_sentence: チェックインが早くなること、ホテルに伝えたかな？

conversation.en_sentence: No I didn't.
conversation.ja_sentence: 言ってませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: Check-in is at 4 PM.
conversation.ja_sentence: チェックインタイムは午後4時です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If you request early check-in, they may be able to have the room ready earlier.
conversation.ja_sentence: アーリーチェックインの希望を伝えておけば、早めに部屋を用意してくれるときもあるんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's not guaranteed but it's worth a try.
conversation.ja_sentence: 絶対じゃないけど、言っておいて損はないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I will call the hotel later today then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、今日中にホテルに電話しておきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not as simple as it seems right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 意外と面倒だろう？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Should I go get the company car washed too then?
conversation.ja_sentence: 社用車の洗車手配もしておきますかね？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You're catching on.
conversation.ja_sentence: だいぶ分かってきたね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't forget to vacuum it too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 車内の掃除機も忘れずに。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I will get reimbursed for it right?
conversation.ja_sentence: あとで会社に請求できるんですよね？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you get a receipt.
conversation.ja_sentence: 忘れずに領収証をもらってきてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can't process reimbursements without them so be sure to get one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 領収書ないと返金できないから、絶対に忘れないで。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll definitely do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: まかしてください。

title: Face-to-face conversation: arranging catering for meeting

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Elaine, can you help me with catering?
conversation.ja_sentence: エレインさん、こんにちは、ケータリングの手伝いをしてくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I have a meeting from 10 o'clock to 2 o'clock and will need to arrange lunch in the office for the guests.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は10時から2時まで会議が入っているのですが、オフィスでお客様の昼食の準備をしなくてはならないんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How many of you guys will there be?
conversation.ja_sentence: 全員で何人ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: There will be 6 including myself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私を含めて6人です。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, six servings.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、6人前ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What do you guys want for lunch?
conversation.ja_sentence: 昼食は何がいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: The usual will be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつもと同じで大丈夫です。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The usual as in the sandwich place downstairs?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつもと同じとは、サンドイッチ屋さんでよろしかったでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、それです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What kind of sandwiches do you guys want?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんなサンドイッチが良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It'd be great if you can get some smoked salmon and roast beef.
conversation.ja_sentence: スモークサーモンとローストビーフを買ってきて頂けると嬉しいです。

conversation.en_sentence: One of the guest really likes smoked salmon.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様の1人がスモークサーモンがとてもお好きなので。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about soup?
conversation.ja_sentence: スープはどうしましょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: What do they have?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな種類がありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They usually have a vegetable soup or a tomato soup.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつもは野菜スープとトマトスープがあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's get half and half.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、半分ずつにしましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So three vegetable and three tomato?
conversation.ja_sentence: 野菜を3つとトマトを3つで宜しかったでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The guests don't have any allergies right?
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様はアレルギーは無いですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think so.
conversation.ja_sentence: 無いと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, let me double-check and I'll get back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 念の為再度確認してまた伝えます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, just let me know.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、では、後ほど教えてください。

title: Face-to-face conversation: arranging a meeting

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, are you free right now?
conversation.ja_sentence: サムさん、こんにちは、今、お時間よろしいでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: What can I do for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need you to arrange a meeting with Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社との会議を調整して欲しいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, can you tell me what it will be about?
conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました、何についての会議でしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's just going to be a general market update.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ一般的な市場の最新情報についてです。

conversation.en_sentence: Should I just ask if they would be available for a lunch meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、私から彼らに昼食を兼ねた会議をできるかどうか聞いてみましょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: It will be more informal so we can discuss various topics.
conversation.ja_sentence: もっとくだけた会議になると思うので、色々な事について話し合えると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Good thinking.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良い考えですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We should find a restaurant near their office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方のオフィスの近くのレストランを探しましょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: How about the hotel near their office?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、彼らのオフィスの近くにあるホテルはどうでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Did that hotel have a restaurant?
conversation.ja_sentence: あのホテルってレストランがありましたっけ？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it's behind the lobby.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ロビーの裏にあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That works then.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではそれでいきましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also reserve the company car?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社の車も予約できますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: When do you want the meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会議はいつにしましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Next Monday would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の月曜日が良いと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have customers coming in from Japan from Tuesday so it has to be on the Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 火曜日から日本の顧客がこちらにいらっしゃるので月曜日でなければなりません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise it will have to be next month.
conversation.ja_sentence: それがダメなら、来月になってしまいます。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll see if they are available next Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました、先方に月曜日は空いているかどうか聞いてみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please let me know if you can confirm it by the end of this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週末までに確認して、教えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: I will call them Friday if they don't reply my email.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし先方より返信が無ければ、金曜日に電話してみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds like a plan.
conversation.ja_sentence: いい考えですね。

title: 研究室の戸締り当番について

conversation.ja_sentence: 西田さん、今日は研究室の戸締りお願いしていいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Takuya, is it okay if I ask you to close up the lab for me today?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうせ、まだ残って片づけることがあるし。
conversation.en_sentence: I have some things to do anyway.

conversation.ja_sentence: それならお願いしていいですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Then can you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当は僕が当番なんですが、ちょっと急ぎの用が入ってしまって。
conversation.en_sentence: It is actually my turn, but I need to leave soon for an emergency.

conversation.ja_sentence: おうち、大丈夫ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is everything okay at home?

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、家内がオフィスを出られないから、僕が息子を迎えに行かなくちゃならなくなって。
conversation.en_sentence: But my wife can't leave her work, so I need to go get my son instead.

conversation.ja_sentence: 戸締りするのを待っていたら、間に合わないんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: If I wait to close up the lab, I will be late.

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、今すぐ帰ってください。
conversation.en_sentence: Then just leave now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕はあと１時間くらいやることありますから。
conversation.en_sentence: I need to do something for another hour or so.

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、お言葉に甘えて。
conversation.en_sentence: Then, I will leave it to you.

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ、こういうことはお互い様ですから。
conversation.en_sentence: No worries, since this sort of things go both ways.

conversation.ja_sentence: その分、次に西田さんが当番の時に僕が代わりますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will take your next turn instead.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつでしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: When is it?

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと予定表みてみますね。
conversation.en_sentence: I will check the calendar.

conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、来週の火曜日です。
conversation.en_sentence: Uh, it's next Tuesday.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、その日を僕に書き換えておいてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Then put my name on for that day.

conversation.ja_sentence: いいんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it really okay?

conversation.ja_sentence: 月曜も川上さんになってますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Your name is on it for Monday too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 二日連続になっちゃいますけど。
conversation.en_sentence: It will be two days in a row.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫、大丈夫。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の名前にしておいてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please change to my name.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、そうさせていただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll do it then.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、何かあったら言ってくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: If there is something, please let me know though.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は子供がいなくて、融通が利きますから。
conversation.en_sentence: I am more flexible since we have no kids.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、今日、急なお願いですがよろしく頼みます。
conversation.en_sentence: I really appreciate your help today especially with the last minute notice.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご心配なさらずに。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一時間もすれば僕も帰りますから。
conversation.en_sentence: I will leave in an hour or so too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早く出ないと息子さん、間に合いませんよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You should go now, or you'll be late for your son.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、本当だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, right.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.

conversation.ja_sentence: また明日。
conversation.en_sentence: See you tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お疲れさまでした。
conversation.en_sentence: See you tomorrow.

title: Phone: Status update (drive back to office)

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sam, this is Ben.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、サムさん、ベンだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、ベン。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Whereabouts are you right now?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今どこにいるの？

conversation.en_sentence: I am just driving back to the office right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今オフィスに車で向かっているところだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: When do you think you will be able to get back?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ頃戻って来れる？

conversation.en_sentence: I think maybe thirty minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 30分くらいだと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: It will depend on the traffic.
conversation.ja_sentence: 交通状況によるけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Why'd you ask?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何で？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm having a phone conference with the Tokyo office and need you to join as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京オフィスと電話会議をするんだけど、参加して欲しいんだよな。

conversation.en_sentence: When does it start?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ始まるの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: In thirty minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 30分後だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the meeting about?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会議の内容は？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's about a new business idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新事業のアイデアについて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Apparently they want us to be involved.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやら、向こうは私たちに係わって欲しいみたいで。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I will do my best to get back as soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、何とか早く戻れるようにしてみるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's okay if you're a bit late.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少しくらい遅れても構わないから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let them know you're running late so take your time.
conversation.ja_sentence: あちらには遅れる旨を伝えておくから、急ぐことないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。

conversation.en_sentence: See you in a bit then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、後で。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Drive safe.
conversation.ja_sentence: 運転気を付けて。

title: 日本出張について

conversation.ja_sentence: ボブさん、来月の頭に日本のM社へ行ってもらえますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Bob, can you go visit M Company in Japan at the beginning of next month?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、例の装置導入後のフォローですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is to follow up on the installation of that system.

conversation.ja_sentence: 向こうのエンジニアから、「ぜひボブさんを」とリクエストがありまして。
conversation.en_sentence: Their engineers specifically requested "Bob".

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that right?

conversation.ja_sentence: うちで唯一のバイリンガルのエンジニアですからね。
conversation.en_sentence: You are the only bilingual engineer here.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、装置の開発にもかかわっていたとなれば、君以外に適役はいないかと。
conversation.en_sentence: Plus, you were involved in the development of the system, so there is no one better than you for this role.

conversation.ja_sentence: あの会社へは、去年から何度も出張で通っているので、半分社員のようなもんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I have visited that company so many times since last year, so I feel like I am like their employee.

conversation.ja_sentence: ずいぶん良い評価をされていますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I only hear good things about you.

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、よかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: Glad to hear that.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、早速航空券の予約したほうがいいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I should probably book the airline tickets as soon as possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週末までに日にちを決めてくれると助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: If you could pick the dates by next week, that would be great.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、でも、パスポートが実は切れてるんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, my passport has been expired, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: お、それは困りますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, that's not good.

conversation.ja_sentence: ２、３日中に申請しに行けば来月までに間に合うでしょうか？

conversation.ja_sentence: ご提示頂いたレートで問題ございません。
conversation.en_sentence: There's no problem with the rate you provided.

conversation.ja_sentence: お手数ですが頂いたレートでのSOWと見積書の修正版をご用意頂けますでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Would you mind preparing a statement of work and a revised estimate?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知致しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: 追って送付させて頂きます。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send them shortly.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いいたします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll be waiting.

title: チョコレート市場状況のクライアント向けプレゼンテーション（部分）

conversation.ja_sentence: ここまで、2017年度の日本国内におけるチョコレート市場の概況と各社の前年比マーケットシェア推移を見てきました。
conversation.en_sentence: So far, we have looked at the chocolate market overview in 2017 in Japan, followed by the market share growth versus last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: ここまでで、何かご質問はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Any questions so far?

conversation.ja_sentence: よくわかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: It’s quite straightforward.

conversation.ja_sentence: 続けてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please go on.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、次に各社の販売個数の伸び率を見てみましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Now, let's have a look at the growth rate in sales volume by company.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご覧のように、大手各社が今年度、軒並み売り上げを増やしている中、御社は０.５ポイントの減少となっています。
conversation.en_sentence: As you can see, your company lost 0.5 percentage points in year-on-year sales, while leading competitors gained.

conversation.ja_sentence: それには何か原因があるのですかね？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you see any reasons for our loss?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それは、次のスライドでご説明いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me explain that with the next slide.

conversation.ja_sentence: これは各社の配荷率を示していますが、御社の場合、他社に比べ、加重配荷率が低くなっています。
conversation.en_sentence: This is each player’s national distribution, and the data shows that your weighted distribution has been lower than other competitors’ figures.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、どういう意味があるのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What does it mean?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それは大型スーパーへの配荷率が少ない、つまり、小規模店舗には置いてあるが、大型店での扱いが少ないということです。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it means your distribution to the large-sized outlets is weak, in other words, your product is present in smaller supermarkets but fewer large supermarkets sell your product.

conversation.ja_sentence: それと、他社と比較して、コンビニエンスストアへの配荷が少ないようです。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, the data shows that your distribution to convenience stores is low, compared to your competitors.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 店舗展開がウチの今後の課題のようですね。
conversation.en_sentence: So, you suggest the outlet issue seems to be our future challenge.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのようです。
conversation.en_sentence: So it would appear.

conversation.ja_sentence: さらに、こちらは、月別の売上高を示したものですが、2月のバレンタインデー商戦でも御社は苦戦したようです。
conversation.en_sentence: Now, I’d like to draw your attention to the sales by month, in which we can see you struggled even in February, Valentine’s Day month.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宣伝キャンペーンには随分力をいれたのですがね。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, we strongly focused on the promotion campaign that month, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらは地域別・店種別データですが、御社は特に関西のコンビニでのシェアが伸び悩んでいます。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me show you the data by area and by outlet next. Here, your market share, particularly in convenience stores in Kansai area, remained stagnant.

conversation.ja_sentence: やはり、コンビニ戦略が弱いということですかね。
conversation.en_sentence: Again, it seems we need to reconsider our convenience store strategies.

conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、御社の小売店サンプル店数は何店舗でしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: By the way, how many retail store samples are in your study?

conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、最新の正確な数字については、ただ今資料を持ち合わせていないので、社に戻りましたら、折り返しご返事いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, I’m sorry but I don’t have the latest actual numbers with me today, so, I will get back to you as soon as I get back to the office.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

title: Being late for a meeting

conversation.en_sentence: I’m sorry Tim, my meeting is going long and I’ll be there in about five minutes.
conversation.ja_sentence: ティムごめん、今やっている会議が押していて５分遅れます。

conversation.en_sentence: OK.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー。

conversation.en_sentence: Please ping me when you are done.
conversation.ja_sentence: 終わったら声をかけて。

conversation.en_sentence: We just finished and I am heading to the conference room now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今終わって会議室に向かっています。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Tim.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもティム！

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry I’m late.
conversation.ja_sentence: 遅れてごめんなさい。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気？

conversation.en_sentence: I’m good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you?
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらは？

conversation.en_sentence: I’m alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあまあね。

conversation.en_sentence: I have jet lag because I just got back from a business trip to Palo Alto.
conversation.ja_sentence: パロアルトへの出張から戻ったばかりで時差ぼけだけれど。

conversation.en_sentence: Understand completely.
conversation.ja_sentence: よくわかるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then let’s take it easy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではのんびりいきましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you see all the team members in PA?
conversation.ja_sentence: パロアルトではチームメンバーみんなに会えた？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: We had a team dinner one night, and I went to Yosemite with Maria.
conversation.ja_sentence: チームディナーをしましたし、マリアとヨセミテにも行きました。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that sounds amazing!
conversation.ja_sentence: わー、すごいね！

conversation.en_sentence: How’s Maria?
conversation.ja_sentence: マリアは元気だった？

conversation.en_sentence: She just had a grandchild didn’t she?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はお孫さんが生まれたんだよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes she did.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう。

conversation.en_sentence: She showed me a bunch of pictures of her.
conversation.ja_sentence: お孫さんの写真を沢山見せてもらったわ。

conversation.en_sentence: She’s such an adorable baby girl and she just turned 3 months old.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても可愛い女の子で、今は３ヶ月よ。

conversation.en_sentence: That’s cool.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、それは良かったね。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds like she is enjoying being a grandma.
conversation.ja_sentence: おばあちゃん人生をエンジョイしているようだね。

title: Preparing for an expo

conversation.en_sentence: I just hope I didn't forget anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何も忘れていないといいんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you get the table linens?
conversation.ja_sentence: テーブルリネンは持ってきましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, did you call Andy about renting the monitors?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、モニターのレンタルについてアンディーに電話しましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, did you remember the name tags?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ネームタグは忘れてませんよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'm pretty sure we brought everything.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、間違いなく全部持ってきたと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: We should land in about an hour.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと1時間程度で着陸するはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you ever been to Las Vegas?
conversation.ja_sentence: ラスベガスに行ったことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I used to do corporate theater a lot out here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、私はここでコーポレートシアターをよくやっていました。

conversation.en_sentence: What is corporate theater?
conversation.ja_sentence: コーポレートシアターって何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's mostly sets for presentations at conferences.
conversation.ja_sentence: 主に会議でのプレゼンテーション用のセットです。

conversation.en_sentence: We designed the sets ourselves, then we set them up and broke them all down.
conversation.ja_sentence: セットをデザインし、それからそれらを設営し、解体するんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Cool, Have you been to Game Expo before?
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、ゲームエキスポに行ったことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: No, this is my first time.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、これが初めてです。

conversation.en_sentence: You'll like it, it's a lot of fun.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと気にいると思います、とても楽しいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, for our itinerary we will all meet at the booth at 8 am tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、打ち合わせのために明日の午前8時にブースで会いましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Which means you have the rest of the day today free.
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、今日はこの後は自由行動です。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, I know.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、分かっていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: In fact, I've already made plans.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、私はもう予定を立てています。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't be stupid, we do have work tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: あまり羽目を外さないようにね、明日は仕事があるから。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh come on, this is Las Vegas!
conversation.ja_sentence: 堅いこと言わないでくださいよ、ラスベガスですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, don't show up hungover tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、明日は二日酔いで来ないように。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, Lisa and I are going to see a magic show.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、リサと私はマジックショーを見に行くんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh cool, who is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: おお、いいですね、誰のですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's Fat Bob and Cookie.
conversation.ja_sentence: ファットボブとクッキーです。

conversation.en_sentence: That doesn't sound very magical.
conversation.ja_sentence: あまりマジカルには聞こえないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: It sounds like a comedy show.
conversation.ja_sentence: コメディショーのようですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they do magic and comedy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、彼らはマジックとコメディをするんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Fat Bob talks all the time and tells jokes.
conversation.ja_sentence: ファットボブはずっと話していて冗談を言っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Cookie never talks at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: クッキーは決して話しません。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they are stupid, but they're actually really good at magic.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、彼らは面白いけれど、本当にマジックも上手いんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What are you getting into tonight Chris?
conversation.ja_sentence: クリス、あなたは今夜何を予定していますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm taking out some clients from Game Company A out to dinner and a show.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はゲーム A社からの何人かの顧客をディナーとショーに連れ出す予定です。

conversation.en_sentence: We're starting out at Steakhouse B then we're going to the Circus show.
conversation.ja_sentence: ステーキハウスBから始めて、それからサーカスショーに行きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh wow, which show are you going to catch?
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、どのショーを見に行くんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Circus Show A, it's mostly aerial acrobatic stuff.
conversation.ja_sentence: サーカスショーA、ほとんど空中アクロバットなどです。

conversation.en_sentence: You're going to love it.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと気に入りますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I saw Circus Show B, it had acrobats, and there was a live band that played a tribute to Rock Band B.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はサーカスショーBを見たんですが、アクロバットも有り、ロックバンドBのトリビュートを演奏したライブバンドも有りました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm pretty excited, I've never seen any of their shows.
conversation.ja_sentence: かなり楽しみです、私は彼らのショーのどれも見たことがありませんから。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't they have around 15 or so different shows?
conversation.ja_sentence: 確か15かそこらの違うバージョンがあるんですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'd really like to see them all.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、本当に全部見たいです。

title: ホームページのデザインについて

conversation.ja_sentence: トムさん、今、時間ある？
conversation.en_sentence: Tom, can we talk now?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、山田さん、おはよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Hey, Masao, good morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: お客さんを待ってるけど、５分くらいならいいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I have a visitor in 5 minutes, but yes we can.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日、うちのホームページの新デザインを見させてもらったんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I looked at the new design of our website yesterday.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、どう思う？
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, what do you think?

conversation.ja_sentence: 全体的な色合いはいいと思うんだけど、文字が小さすぎるような気がする。
conversation.en_sentence: I like the overall color scheme, but the font size seems too small to me.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Really?

conversation.ja_sentence: 情報をたくさん入れようと思うと、どうしてもあのサイズにしないと無理で。
conversation.en_sentence: To put as much information as possible there, I had to pick that size.

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、それは分かるけど、うちの商品はシニア対象だからなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: Umm, I understand your points, but our target is the elderly.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの親とか見てても思うけど、あの年代の人たちは小さい字を読むのは大変だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: When I think of my parents, people that generation have a hard time reading small letters.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうだな。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: パッと見たときに字が小さかったら、それだけで何も見てくれないかも知れない。
conversation.en_sentence: If they see small fonts first, they might just stop looking at anything else there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 情報をたくさん提供することに囚われていて、それは思いもしなかった。
conversation.en_sentence: All I thought about was to include lots of information, so I didn't even think of that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今までの経験は、若い人向けのウェブデザインが多かったからなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: My experience of the web design was mostly for the young people.

conversation.ja_sentence: シニア向けマーケティングは、また若い子向けとは別もんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Marketing for the elderly is different from that for the younger generation.

conversation.ja_sentence: ほんとだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Seriously.

conversation.ja_sentence: 視覚的にあまり刺激が大きくないほうが好まれる。
conversation.en_sentence: They prefer something not so visually stimulating.

conversation.ja_sentence: そっか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホームページも、シンプルなほうがいい。
conversation.en_sentence: Websites should be simple also.

conversation.ja_sentence: リンクも見つけやすくて、クリックしやすいとか。
conversation.en_sentence: Links have to be easy to find and click.

conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の親世代のことを考えながらデザインする必要があるね。
conversation.en_sentence: I need to think about my parents' generation when I design.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yup.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちはカタログ販売で始まった企業で、今でもオンラインじゃなくてカタログを見て電話しました、って人のほうが多い。
conversation.en_sentence: We started as a company of catalogue sales, and even now, more people say they called us because of the catalogues rather than the website.

conversation.ja_sentence: カタログのデザインもシンプルだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: The design of catalogues is simple too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕にしたら、もうちょっと情報があってもいいんじゃないか、と思えるレベル。
conversation.en_sentence: The level where I would want more info!

conversation.ja_sentence: シンプルなほうが反応大きいからね。
conversation.en_sentence: The simpler it is, the bigger the responses are.

conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、字は大きめに読みやすく、を心がけるのが一番だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Anyhow, you should remember to keep the letters bigger and easy to read.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと文字サイズを変えてみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will try to change the font size.

conversation.ja_sentence: 少しくらい情報量は減ってもいいから。
conversation.en_sentence: You can cut the amount of information.

conversation.ja_sentence: フォントも変えたほうがいいかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Should I change the font itself?

conversation.ja_sentence: フォントは今のままでいいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't think you need to change the font.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただサイズがね。
conversation.en_sentence: Just the size.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 色合いはいいって言ったよね。
conversation.en_sentence: You said the colors were good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は個人的にはいいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I personally think they are good.

conversation.ja_sentence: カタログの雰囲気とマッチしてるし。
conversation.en_sentence: They match our catalogues.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、文字サイズだけ触るよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I'll just work on the font size.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとでまた見てくれる？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you take a look later?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

title: New product presentation

conversation.en_sentence: Good afternoon, everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さまこんにちは。

conversation.en_sentence: My name is Suzuki Yuki.
conversation.ja_sentence: 鈴木 由紀と申します。

conversation.en_sentence: I am the marketing manager of Company L.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はL社のマーケティングマネージャーをしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Today I am here with my coworkers, Millie Craft and Takumi Okuda.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日は同僚のミリー クラフト、奥田 巧と共に参りました。

conversation.en_sentence: We are here to talk about our company and our new product K.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の新商品についてお話をさせて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: We are thrilled to be here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここに来る事ができ光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for having us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: First, I will introduce our company and its history and mission.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは私が我が社の歴史、企業方針についてお話させて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Then our sales representative, Millie Craft, will show you our newly developed product.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてセールス担当のミリー クラフトが新商品の紹介を致します。

conversation.en_sentence: She will be demonstrating how to use the product as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: また商品の使用方法の実演もします。

conversation.en_sentence: After that, our graphic designer, Takumi Okuda, will show you our eye-catching package design and advertising campaign.
conversation.ja_sentence: その後グラフィックデザイナーの奥田 巧が人目を引くパッケージのデザインと、宣伝活動について説明させて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Please do not hesitate to ask any questions at the end.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご質問があれば、遠慮なく最後にお聞きください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Glad to have you guys with us today.
conversation.ja_sentence: ようこそお越し下さいました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Please proceed.
conversation.ja_sentence: では進めて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Our company L was established by Mr. Albert Lawrence in 1965.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社Lはアルバート・ローレンスにより1965年に設立されました。

conversation.en_sentence: It started out as a small pet store in a rural town in Ohio.
conversation.ja_sentence: オハイオ州の田舎町で小さなペットショップとして始まりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Lawrence developed our original product to improve the hygiene of dogs and cats in 1982.
conversation.ja_sentence: ローレンスは1982年に犬猫の衛生事情を改善するために我が社のオリジナル商品を開発しました。

conversation.en_sentence: It has been one of the top selling pet-care products in the States since then.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発売当初から国内で最も売れているペットケア商品の一つです。

conversation.en_sentence: We have expanded our business world wide.
conversation.ja_sentence: 販売を国外にも拡大しました。

conversation.en_sentence: And we have successfully developed 3 more products since the original one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてオリジナル商品のほかにも３つ商品を増やしました。

conversation.en_sentence: This new product is our fourth.
conversation.ja_sentence: この新商品は四品目です。

conversation.en_sentence: Our mission is to provide affordable, quality hygiene products to beloved pets all over the world.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の方針は世界中のペットにお手軽で高性能の衛生用品をお届けする事です。

conversation.en_sentence: Now I will turn over to Ms. Millie Craft.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、ミリー クラフトに代わります。

title: General chatting: Company car

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, are you free this afternoon?
conversation.ja_sentence: サム、今日の午後時間ある？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I should be.
