conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can go get the company car washed?
conversation.ja_sentence: 社用車を洗車に出せる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The president of Company A is coming tomorrow and I need it washed.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の社長が明日来るから、洗車が必要なんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have a phone conference this afternoon and will be a bit occupied.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の午後は電話会議があってちょっと手が空かなくて。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、もちろん。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know where the closest one is?
conversation.ja_sentence: 一番近いのはどこですかね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There's one three blocks from here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここから3ブロック先に一つあるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I can go after lunch.
conversation.ja_sentence: ランチの後に行けます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also add gas if the tank is low?
conversation.ja_sentence: ガソリンが残り少なかったら、給油もしてくれる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm picking up the president first thing in the morning so I won't have time to go add gas.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長を朝一番で迎えに行くから、ガソリン入れてる時間がないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The closest gas station is a bit far away though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一番近いガソリンスタンドはちょっと遠いけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's Gas Station A which is around 15 minutes away right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ガソリンスタンドA、15分くらいですよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、それ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't forget to submit your expense form for the car wash and gas.
conversation.ja_sentence: 洗車とガソリン代の経費請求書を出すの忘れないでね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The car wash place doesn't give you a receipt if you don't ask.
conversation.ja_sentence: 洗車所は頼まないとレシートくれないから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So make sure you ask for one.
conversation.ja_sentence: きちんと頼まないとだめだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、はい。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for the heads up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 警告ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, I got to head out for a lunch meeting now.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、ランチ会合に行かないといけないから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I owe you one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 借りができたな。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題ないですよ。

title: How to use Excel

conversation.en_sentence: I don't understand any of this.
conversation.ja_sentence: これ全然分からないや。

conversation.en_sentence: Rebecca, could you help me for a minute?
conversation.ja_sentence: レベッカ、ちょっと助けてもらえる？

conversation.en_sentence: Are you having problems with your spreadsheet program again John?
conversation.ja_sentence: スプレッドシートプログラムでまた問題があるのジョン？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, embarrisngly I'm pretty bad with computers.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、恥ずかしながら、僕はコンピューターがかなり苦手で。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why I'm in the sales department and not I.T.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕が営業部門にいて、I.T.でないのには訳があるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What are you trying to do exactly?
conversation.ja_sentence: 正確には何をしようとしているの？

conversation.en_sentence: I just want to create a table for this document.
conversation.ja_sentence: この文書用のテーブルを作成したいだけなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: No offense John, but that is so easy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 悪くとらないでねジョン、だけどそれはとても簡単よ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah Yeah Yeah, so how do I do it?
conversation.ja_sentence: うんうんうん、だからどうすればいいの？

conversation.en_sentence: OK, select any of the cells on the source data.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、ソースデータのセルを1つ選択して。

conversation.en_sentence: Then at the top, click where it says insert tab.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから上部で、「タブの挿入」と言うところをクリックして。

conversation.en_sentence: Next, scroll down, and click where it says tables.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次に、下にスクロールして「テーブル」と表示されている場所をクリックするの。

conversation.en_sentence: So far, so good.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここまでは順調だね。

conversation.en_sentence: Then just pick one of the tables that you want to use.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次に、使用したいテーブルを1つ選択して。

conversation.en_sentence: See, pretty simple huh?
conversation.ja_sentence: ほら、とても簡単でしょ？

conversation.en_sentence: Going through the motions is easy, it's just remembering where everything is at that is so hard.
conversation.ja_sentence: 操作をするのは簡単だよ、どこに何があるのか全部覚えているのが難しいんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you always been good with computers?
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はずっとコンピューターが得意なの？

conversation.en_sentence: No, it's just like anything, the more you do it, the better you get at it.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、なんでもそうだけど、やればやるほど上達するのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I could never do what you do John.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私にはあなたがやっていることは絶対できないわジョン。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't have the confidence to call complete strangers on the phone and try to sell them stuff.
conversation.ja_sentence: 赤の他人に電話をして物を売るなんてことをする自信はないわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure you could.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんあなたにもできますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Building rapport with potential clients is all about building relationships.
conversation.ja_sentence: 顧客候補との信頼を結ぶことは、関係を築くというだけのことだから。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't they hate it when you call them?
conversation.ja_sentence: 電話をかけるとき嫌がられない？

conversation.en_sentence: Sometimes, but then again I like to use that as an ice breaker and make a joke about it to lighten the mood.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時にはね、だけど僕はそれをアイスブレーカーとして使って、場を和ますために冗談を言うんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's a really good idea, I've never thought of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは本当に良い考えね、考えもつかなかったわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I get them laughing first to calm them down.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕はまず、彼らを落ち着かせるために笑わせるんだ。

title: misdelivered mails

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Kayla, I got a few of your mails mixed up in mine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ケイラ、君の郵便が幾つか僕のに混ざっていたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have the one from our accountant?
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会計士からの手紙はある？

conversation.en_sentence: You can take a look at them yourself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で見てみる？

conversation.en_sentence: There it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: あった。

conversation.en_sentence: This one that has "urgent" stamped on?
conversation.ja_sentence: この至急のスタンプが押してあるやつ？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is an important mail I was supposed to receive 3 days ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大事な手紙で三日前に受け取る予定だったの。

conversation.en_sentence: I am sorry I didn't bring them to you sooner.
conversation.ja_sentence: 早く持ってこれなくて申し訳ないね。

conversation.en_sentence: I had 3 appointments with my clients back to back two days ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２日前はクライアントとの予約が３件続きで入っていたんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: And I was out of office yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして昨日はオフィスに居なかったんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's not your fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたのせいじゃないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I called my accountant three times to make sure he had mailed it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんと送ったのか確認する為に会計士に３回も電話したのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He dropped it off at the post office Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は月曜日に郵便局に持っていったの。

conversation.en_sentence: Usually it doesn't take this long, so I was starting to worry.
conversation.ja_sentence: 通常はこんなに時間がかからないから、心配になってきた所だったの。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope you aren't in trouble.
conversation.ja_sentence: 迷惑をかけてないといいんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: No, you brought them just in time.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、ぴったりのタイミングで持ってきてくれたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am upset that the mail carrier made a mistake again.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ郵便配達員がまた間違ったのが腹立つわ。

conversation.en_sentence: This is the third time in a month.
conversation.ja_sentence: この一か月で３回目よ。

conversation.en_sentence: Looks like we have a new person delivering mails in this area.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい配達員がこの地域の配達をしているようだね。

conversation.en_sentence: This building has 25 units in this building.
conversation.ja_sentence: このビルには２５テナント入ってるよね。

conversation.en_sentence: And our mailboxes are right next to each other.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと私達の郵便受けは隣同士だし。

conversation.en_sentence: It must have confused him.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと混乱してしまったんだろう。

conversation.en_sentence: But I might say something to him.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも彼に何か言おうと思うの。

conversation.en_sentence: Being new can not be an excuse.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新入社員だからというのは言い訳にはならないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Some of the letters we receive are urgent and confidential.
conversation.ja_sentence: 受け取る手紙の中には、至急、機密のものもあるからね。

conversation.en_sentence: He can not keep messing up our mails.
conversation.ja_sentence: このままうちの郵便物を誤配達されるわけにはいかないの。

conversation.en_sentence: Or anybody's mail.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の会社の郵便物もね。

conversation.en_sentence: Next time my mail gets misdelivered, I will let the postmaster know about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次回誤配達されたら、郵便局長に連絡するわ。

conversation.en_sentence: The mail carrier needs to be more responsible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 配達員はもう少し責任感がないといけない。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's hope it will not happen again.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、この様な事がまた起きない事を願おう。

conversation.en_sentence: Meanwhile we should probably label our mailbox better.
conversation.ja_sentence: その間、郵便受けにもっと見やすいラベルを張った方がいいね。

conversation.en_sentence: The mail carrier is always pressed for time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 配達員はいつも時間に追われているから。

conversation.en_sentence: Better labeling might help him find the right mailboxes better.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見やすいラベルがあれば配達員も正しい郵便受けを見つけやすいだろうから。

conversation.en_sentence: That's a good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはいい考えだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am pretty sure Mr. Henry will not mind it at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: ヘンリーさんも気にしないと思うわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me get back to my office.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではオフィスに戻るね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you again for bringing my mails, Ryoji.
conversation.ja_sentence: 亮二、手紙を持ってきてくれて有難う。

conversation.en_sentence: No problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

title: Training: Dealing with international clients

conversation.en_sentence: When should I call Mr. Kinoshita from Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の木下さんに何時に電話したらいいでしょう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: As soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけ早く。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But don't forget about the time difference.
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、だけど、時差に気をつけて。

conversation.en_sentence: Right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be 9 o'clock in the morning in Japan when it is 5 o'clock in the afternoon here.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらが午後5時のときに日本は午前9時ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you don't want to call them when they are still sleeping.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、向こうがまだ寝てる時間に電話しないほうがいいからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will call them around 5 o'clock then.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、では、こちらの午後5時くらいに電話します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What are you planning to talk about with him?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何を話すの？

conversation.en_sentence: I need to tell him that a shipment will be delayed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出荷が遅れることを伝えたいのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure to tell him the reason for the delay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 遅れる理由もちゃんと伝えないとだめだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well the logistic company only told me that it will be delayed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 物流会社からは遅れるとしか聞いてないです。

conversation.en_sentence: Nothing more.
conversation.ja_sentence: それ以上のことはわかりません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Kinoshita will definitely ask for the reason.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木下さんは、絶対に理由をきいてくるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you imagine what he will say if you say I don't know?
conversation.ja_sentence: 理由はわかりませんと言ったら、木下さんが何と言うか想像できるだろう？

conversation.en_sentence: Good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: そりゃそうだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I will call the logistic company right now to find out the reason.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、物流会社に電話して理由を問いただします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't forget to ask if there are other alternatives.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の手段がないかも忘れずに聞いて。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will want to be able to offer various options to Mr. Kinoshita.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木下さんが代替案をいろいろ選べるように。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、アドバイスをどうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Good thing I asked you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞いてよかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise I would have been yelled at by Mr. Kinoshita.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木下さんに怒鳴られるところだった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You're still in your first year on the job so keep asking questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだ、一年目だから、いろいろ聞いていいんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If you were in your fifth year or something then I'd be the one yelling at you.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし、5年目で、まだ、そんなことをやっていたら、怒鳴るけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll keep note of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 心しておきます。

title: 面倒くさい会食の手配

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週申し上げたとおり、急遽社長が海外出張となりました。
conversation.en_sentence: As I mentioned last week, Yoji is going on an urgent business trip.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は私、社長室長平良も同行します。
conversation.en_sentence: I am also going with him this time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 平良不在中に関する申し送りは昨日メールにて送っています。
conversation.en_sentence: I have sent emails regarding tasks that should be covered during my absence.

conversation.ja_sentence: 梨本さん、F株式会社20周年パーティーの件はOKですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Saki, is everything okay for the F Corporation's 20th anniversary party?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、吉岡専務と私梨本が社長の代理として出席します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Noboru, the Senior Managing Director, and I will attend the party on the CEO's behalf.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先方へはその旨お伝えしております。
conversation.en_sentence: I have let them know about it already.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解、梨元さん、パーティー後のフォローもお願いしますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, Saki, please cover for me after the party as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、創立記念用の手土産なんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, I'd like to ask you about gifts for the anniversary of our foundation.

conversation.ja_sentence: その件はまだ先なので、来週帰国してから手配します。
conversation.en_sentence: I can take care of them after I come back to Japan next week, since it's still a long way off.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ただ昨日営業部からXX製菓会社さんのお菓子について提案が来ていまして。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, but the Sales Department has made a recommendation about XX Confectionery Corporation's sweets yesterday.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先日ウチのシステムを入れていただいたお店ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's the confectionary which installed our system the other day, isn't it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の業者さんとの兼ね合いもあるので、藤堂さんで営業と詳細確認しておいてもらえますか？
conversation.en_sentence: We have to take the other traders into consideration, so can you confirm the details with the Sales?

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Certainly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他は通常業務なので特にないかと思いますが.......
conversation.en_sentence: I don't think there is any concern regarding other regular duties, though......

conversation.ja_sentence: 平良室長、一つ宜しいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Kazuyo, I have one thing I'd like to ask you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、氏家さん。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Rinka.

conversation.ja_sentence: あら、少し疲れている様子ですが、大丈夫ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, you look a little tired, are you okay?

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、再来週の社長の会食の手配が上手くできなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, I haven't been doing well on arranging a business dinner for the CEO the week after next.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、K社から視察に来られる方達との会食ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, a business dinner with people visiting from K Corporation, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、室長のメールで先様の情報をいただいたんですが、制約が多くてお店を探すのに随分時間がかかっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I have received your email with information about them, but there're too many restrictions that it's been taking me forever looking for a restaurant.

conversation.ja_sentence: あの方達のお店選びは少し難しいけれど、あなたみたいな新人さんにはいい機会かと思ったの。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought it would be a good opportunity for a newly-assigned person like you, though it might be a little difficult to find a place for them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 金曜日なので予約は早い方が良いと思って、昨日ずっと探してたんですが......
conversation.en_sentence: I thought it should be reserved early since it would be on Friday, so I was searching the whole day yesterday, but.........

conversation.ja_sentence: コーエン専務はお肉全般召し上がらないし、トス部長はお魚が苦手な上に高血圧でカロリーと塩分制限があるし...
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Cohen doesn't eat any meat, and Mr. Toth does not like fish and he is on a calorie and sodium restricted diet as well...

conversation.ja_sentence: 氏家さん、必要以上に時間がかかってしまう時は周りに聞いてくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Rinka, you should ask people around you for help if you take unnecessarily long time, alright?

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません、平良室長、今後その様にいたします。
conversation.en_sentence: My apologies, Kazuyo, I will do so next time.

conversation.ja_sentence: その条件だけなら「割烹XX」はどうかしら？
conversation.en_sentence: If those are the only conditions, how about "Japanese Cuisine XX" ?

conversation.ja_sentence: でもあそこは魚介を使ったお料理が多くない？
conversation.en_sentence: They serve dishes mostly using seafood, though, don't they?

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月から入ったご亭主の息子さんが精進料理の修行をしてきたとかで、お料理の評判がいいのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I heard the son of the chef-owner who trained in Buddhist vegetarian cooking started working there last month, and his dishes have gotten good reputations.

conversation.ja_sentence: 事前に好みを伝えておけば、減塩対応もしてくれると思うわ。
conversation.en_sentence: If you tell the restaurant their preferences beforehand, they would probably do low-sodium dishes as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、精進料理ならお肉もお魚も避けられるし、召し上がりたければそれぞれに別途ご用意する事もできるわね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, you can avoid meat and fish with vegetarian cuisine, and if they'd like to have some, it would be possible to prepare these dishes separately for each of them, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: でも金曜日の夜はちょっと予約が取りづらいかも。
conversation.en_sentence: It might be a little difficult to make a reservation on Friday night, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: 「割烹XX」ならご亭主と懇意にさせていただいているので、後で私から連絡してみましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: If it's "Japanese Cuisine XX," I can call the place later, because I know the chef-owner pretty well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 予約がとれたら、詳細は氏家さんから伝えてくれるかしら。
conversation.en_sentence: Can you tell the restaurant about the details yourself if I manage a reservation?

conversation.ja_sentence: 勿論です、皆さん、ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: By all means, thank you ladies!

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それから、コーエン専務は日本びいきでお箸をお使いになりたがるの。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, one more thing, Mr. Cohen likes Japan very much and he is fond of using chopsticks.

conversation.ja_sentence: でもあまりお上手じゃないから、事前にナイフとフォークもお出しするように、手配しておいてね。
conversation.en_sentence: However, he is not very good at using them, so you should ask the restaurant to prepare a knife and a fork in advance.

conversation.ja_sentence: 氏家さん、コーエン専務とトス部長はお好みにうるさくないから、まだ他のお客様より楽なほうよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Rinka, Mr. Cohen and Mr. Toth are still better than other clients, because they're not very particular about food.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最近はビーガンの方やハラル対応が必要な方もお客様に多いから事前に召し上がれる物を確認ね。
conversation.en_sentence: You should confirm our clients' diet in advance, since we have more people who are vegans or need halal food recently.

conversation.ja_sentence: アレルギーは勿論、持病が色々おありで、病気のデパートみたいな方もいらっしゃるから。
conversation.en_sentence: Not to mention allergies, there are some people with various chronic diseases, almost like a department store of symptoms.

conversation.ja_sentence: う、皆さん、これからもご教示お願いいたします...
conversation.en_sentence: Um, I'd appreciate your continued guidance, ladies....

title: 全社共通データベース導入について

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆、集まったか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is everyone here?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、揃ってます。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we all are.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、始めようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Then let's start.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、全社共通の顧客管理データベースについて話したいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I would like to discuss the corporate-wide client management database today.

conversation.ja_sentence: では早速、社内各部署の現状調査報告から。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me begin with the report on the current status of each department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 手元の資料をご覧ください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please take a look at the document in front of you.

conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、どの部署も違ったデータベースを使ってますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, each department is using a different type of database.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです、データベース導入は各部署が任意で始めたため、全社で統一されたデータベースを導入する機会がなかったんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, since each department started using the database on its own, we never had a chance to introduce a corporate-wide database.

conversation.ja_sentence: 営業部はかなり昔から使っていたのですが、研究開発部ではほんの最近導入されたばかりです。
conversation.en_sentence: The sales has been using it for years, but R-and-D started using it only recently.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、研究開発が導入したデータベースは新しいもので、営業部の古いものよりも使いやすいようです。
conversation.en_sentence: The database R-and-D is using is newer than the one the sales is using and seems easier to use.

conversation.ja_sentence: 長く使っている営業部よりも最近導入した部署のほうが効率よく管理出来てるということか。
conversation.en_sentence: So you mean those who started using it more recently are managing the data more efficiently than the sales department who has been using it for a long time.

conversation.ja_sentence: そういうことですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、各部署ごとに違ったデータ管理をしているということは、情報シェアが難しいということになりますよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Also sharing information might be difficult if everyone is managing the data differently.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです、そこが一番の課題ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: True, and that's the biggest issue.

conversation.ja_sentence: 部署間でのデータシェアの方法は無いこともないんですが、手間とお金がかかります。
conversation.en_sentence: There are ways to share the information among departments, but it is time-consuming and costs money.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、全社共通のデータベースを導入したいというわけだな。
conversation.en_sentence: That's why we need to implement a corporate-wide database.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、僕とエミリーで各部署に色々ヒアリングしてきました。
conversation.en_sentence: So Emily and I went to different departments to talk about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全社共通データベースにはどのような情報を入力すべきか、などについて聞いてきました。
conversation.en_sentence: We asked something like what sort of information is needed in the corporate-wide database.

conversation.ja_sentence: 各部署で、きっと顧客に関して欲しい情報は違うでしょうからね。
conversation.en_sentence: I bet each department has different needs when it comes to the client information.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに、営業部と研究開発部では仕事の中味に合わせて顧客のタイプも違うからな。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure the types of clients are different between sales and R-and-D because of what they do.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、営業部では顧客がどんな製品やサービスを求めているかが大切です。
conversation.en_sentence: For example, sales wants to know what types of products and services their clients want.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、研究開発部では、顧客の専門技術分野が重要視される。
conversation.en_sentence: But R-and-D needs to know the technology expertise of their clients.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、各部署ほんとうに様々ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: So true, every department is unique.

conversation.ja_sentence: ここに人事部やマーケティングなんかが絡んでくると、さらに複雑になりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Adding HR and marketing in the mix, things can be even more complicated.

conversation.ja_sentence: とりあえず、どの部署でも顧客に関して必要な情報というのは何だろう。
conversation.en_sentence: For now, what are the essential items that everyone needs to know about their clients?

conversation.ja_sentence: 企業名、住所、連絡先になりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Those would be company names, addresses and their contact information.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは、弊社のどの部署と取引しているか、弊社との窓口担当者は誰か、という情報でしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, which of our department they work with, or who is their main contact person.

conversation.ja_sentence: 企業名だけじゃ何をやっている会社か分からないこともあるよな。
conversation.en_sentence: Sometimes you can't tell what they do by looking at the company name.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、企業名の下に、業務内容や業務分野のカテゴリーが必要ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, that means we need to have the category of the business types and areas.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大まかでもいいから、例えば「メーカー」「小売」「研究開発」といった感じのものがあったほうがいい。
conversation.en_sentence: It doesn't have to be too specific, but it's better to have something like "manufacturing", "retail" and "R-and-D".

conversation.ja_sentence: それは絶対必要な情報ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That is definitely important.

conversation.ja_sentence: 顧客のホームページなどもリンクしたほうが良さそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: I think we should link the clients' websites too.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、ヒアリングしたときに皆言ってたね。
conversation.en_sentence: Everyone said that when we talked to them.

conversation.ja_sentence: データベースから直接、顧客の詳しい情報へ飛べると効率がいいから、という皆さんのお話でした。
conversation.en_sentence: They were saying that it is efficient if you could get more information of the client directly from the database.

conversation.ja_sentence: 細かいところは、データベースソフトのプログラマーと打ち合わせの時に詰めましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's discuss more details at a meeting with the programmer of the database.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは、情報シェアについて、少し話したほうがいいですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Now we should talk about sharing the information a little bit.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだな、せっかく皆揃っているから、今の間に話しておこう。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right, since we are all here, we should talk about that now.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、では、そちらについての各部署からの意見があります。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, then I have some feedback on that from each department.

conversation.ja_sentence: お手元の資料の５ページ目になります。
conversation.en_sentence: It is on page 5 of the document you have.

title: 訪問依頼

conversation.ja_sentence: お電話ありがとうございます、株式会社Cです。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, thank you for calling C Corporation.

conversation.ja_sentence: A株式会社の佐藤と申しますが、田中さんはいらっしゃいますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Sato from A Corporation, is Tanaka-san there?

conversation.ja_sentence: 田中ですね、少々お待ちください。
conversation.en_sentence: Tanaka? Okay, please wait a moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: お電話代わりました、田中です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, you're through to Tanaka.

conversation.ja_sentence: A株式会社の佐藤です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, It's Sato of A Corporation.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつもお世話になっております。
conversation.en_sentence: It's always a pleasure to speak to you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 佐藤部長、いつもお世話になっております。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, Director Sato, it's always a pleasure to speak to you.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうされましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: How can I help you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は先日ご提出いただいた見積の件で、近々弊社に来ていただくことは可能でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: The thing is, I was wondering if you would be able to come to our office soon in connection with the quote you submitted the other day?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一番直近ですと、明日の14時以降か、明後日の午前中でしたら大丈夫ですが、ご都合はいかがですか？
conversation.en_sentence: The earliest I could do is after 2 o'clock tomorrow, or in the morning the day after, would that be convenient?

conversation.ja_sentence: では、明日の15時でお願いできますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Well then, could I ask you to come in at 3 o'clock tomorrow?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Certainly.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、明日の15時に訪問させていただきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Right then, I will visit you at three o'clock tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみませんが、宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

title: 展示会出展に関するキックオフミーティング

conversation.ja_sentence: 全員そろったようなので、これからミーティングを行います。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems that everyone is here, so let's begin the meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先だって発信した通り、この度当社製品をより広く紹介するため、３か月後の展示会に出展することになりました。
conversation.en_sentence: As previously mentioned, in order to introduce our products to a wider audience, we will be appearing at an exhibition in three months' time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本件は全社案件として、各部署より担当者を立てて進めていきたいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: As this will be a company-wide endeavor, I would like to proceed by selecting a person to be in charge from each department.

conversation.ja_sentence: なお、本件の統括部署は広報部とし、出展までのスケジュール管理を担当します。
conversation.en_sentence: The department supervising the project will be the PR department, and we will be in charge of managing the schedule up until the exhibition.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、各部署より役割分担の確認をかねて自己紹介をお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: So, without further ado, I would like to confirm who has been assigned the role in each department, together with a self introduction.

conversation.ja_sentence: 営業部の阿川です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Agawa from the sales department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 配布資料の作成および新規見込顧客への個別案内を担当します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will be responsible for creating pamphlets and providing individual guidance for potential new customers.

conversation.ja_sentence: カスタマーサポート部の水口です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Mizuguchi from the customer support department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 既存顧客の招待及び当日のご案内を担当します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will be in charge of inviting existing customers and showing them around on the day.

conversation.ja_sentence: 開発部の佐島です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Sajima from the development department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新製品の詳細資料の作成と、当日は操作方法のデモンストレーションを担当します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will be in charge of the creation of detailed documents about our new products, as well as the demonstration of how to operate them on the day.

conversation.ja_sentence: 技術サポート部の吉村です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Yoshimura from the technical support department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 筐体の調達及び当日のブースにおけるインフラを担当します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will be responsible for providing the casing and handling the infrastructure at the booth on the day.

conversation.ja_sentence: 広報部の高田です。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Takada from the PR department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先ほど申し上げたスケジュール管理の他、当日のマスコミや銀行及び株主対応を含めた当日の運営を担当します。
conversation.en_sentence: In addition to the schedule management I mentioned earlier, I will be in charge of operations on the day, including dealing with the media, banks and shareholders.

conversation.ja_sentence: 各部署の担当骨子は以上です。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, so those are the main responsibilities of each department.

conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングでは、部署を越えて忌憚のない意見を交わし、是非展示会を成功させたいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: At this meeting, I would like to have a frank exchange of opinions between departments to make the exhibition successful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今後様々なタスクを各部署に持ち帰って調整していただくことになりますので、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Since we will be taking various tasks back to each department and refining them, I would appreciate your cooperation.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、早速当日までのスケジュールについて確認します。
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore, let's get straight into confirming the schedule up until the day of the exhibition.

conversation.ja_sentence: 事前にご案内したファイル内にあるスケジュールの叩き台を開いてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please open the draft schedule in the file that I shared beforehand.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は来月から販売する新製品をメインに打ち出したいと考えています。
conversation.en_sentence: This time, I would like to set forth with the new products going on sale from next month as the main focus.

conversation.ja_sentence: 既に概要のみを記載するパンフレットの作成は進めていますが、この展示会では詳細な資料を作成して配布したいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Although we are already making progress creating pamphlets that describe just the outline, I would like to create and distribute detailed handouts at this exhibition.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、詳細をつめるのにあと２週間程度ほしいのですが、それからの資料作成で印刷や製本は間に合いますか？
conversation.en_sentence: However, I'd like about 2 more weeks to iron out the details, but will we still be in time for printing and binding if we create the handout after that?

conversation.ja_sentence: 資料のボリュームにもよりますが、校了から１ヶ月あれば用意できます。
conversation.en_sentence: It depends on the volume, but we can prepare them if we have a month after the completion of the proofreading.

conversation.ja_sentence: 詳細資料はオールカラーで２４ページ程度のもの、１０００部を想定しています。
conversation.en_sentence: The detailed handout will be around 24 full-color pages, and I'm working on the assumption of 1,000 copies.

conversation.ja_sentence: 詳細を詰めるまでに２週間、資料の作成完了まで２週間として、１ヶ月後に印刷依頼するというスケジュール感でいけますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you able to follow a schedule along the lines of 2 weeks to iron out the details, 2 weeks to complete the handout, then request printing a month later?

conversation.ja_sentence: それくらい余裕があれば助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be helpful if that amount of time was available.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、新製品の資料作成についてはそのスケジュールで進めてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, then please proceed with that schedule to create handouts about the new products.

title: Extending the delivery date

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is John McManus from K trade.
conversation.ja_sentence: Kトレードのジョン マクマナスと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: Hi John, how are you doing?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンさん、お元気でいらっしゃいますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: I am calling about your order that is supposed to be delivered next Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週配達予定のオーダーの件でお電話させてもらっています。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: Is there an issue?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か問題でも？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: I regret to inform you that we have to extend the delivery date.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大変申し訳ないのですが、配達日を延長させて頂きたいんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Our warehouse was flooded during the recent tropical storm.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先日のトロピカルストームで我が社の倉庫が浸水被害を受けまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Some of the inventory wasn't affected.
conversation.ja_sentence: 被害がなかった品もあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: But a lot of the items have water damage.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、大半の品は水浸しになってしまいました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, yours are also in unsellable condition.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、御社の品も販売できる状態ではありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑をお掛けして、本当に申し訳ありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it's not your fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、でもそちらの非ではありませんからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: You could have not prevented it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 防ぐ事は無理でしたよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: Is everybody at your office alright?
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスの皆さんは大丈夫ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Luckily, our office was spared.
conversation.ja_sentence: 幸いにも、我が社のオフィスは被害を免れました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: None of our employees had any damage to their houses.
conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員も誰も家に被害がありませんでした。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: That's good to hear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かったですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: Do you happen to know when you get new inventory items, by the way?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、いつ新しい商品が届くかわかりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: Our factory in China is shipping them out tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 中国の工場から明日送られてくる予定です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: So we should receive them in 2 weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、2週間ほどで到着する程です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: We will do our best to get your items delivered as fast as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけ早くお届けできますように全力を尽くします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン マクマナス
conversation.en_sentence: As soon as it is shipped from our warehouse, we will send you a confirmation e-mail with a tracking number as usual.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも通り、商品発送の際に追跡番号を含めた確認メールをお送り致します。

conversation.ja_speaker: キャシー サントス
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for letting me know.
conversation.ja_sentence: わざわざ知らせて下さり、有難うございます。

title: 滞在先に関する雑談

conversation.ja_sentence: いつも滞在先で何をしているの？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you usually do when you stay over?

conversation.ja_sentence: いつもは部屋にいて、あまり外には出ません。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm just in the room and don't really go out.

conversation.ja_sentence: 鈴木さんはどうされているんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you usually do Suzuki-san?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私もいつもは出ないの。
conversation.en_sentence: I never go out too.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも明日は天気が良さそうなので、近くの公園に行ってみようと思っています。
conversation.en_sentence: But the weather seems to be nice tomorrow so I'm thinking of going to the nearby park.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒に行きませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you want to go together?

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 是非一緒に行きたいわ。
conversation.en_sentence: I would love to go together.

conversation.ja_sentence: 嬉しいです。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm glad to hear that.

conversation.en_sentence: Then, let's meet up at the hotel lobby tomorrow at 12 o'clock.

conversation.ja_sentence: ランチも一緒に食べませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you want to eat lunch together too?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 近くのレストランを調べておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll look up restaurants nearby.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かるわ。
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.

title: ツアー企画のフライト選択の相談の会話

conversation.ja_sentence: 部長、授賞式に向かうときの飛行機のスケジュールのことなんですけれど。
conversation.en_sentence: Yasui-san, I wanted to talk about the flight schedule when going to the awards ceremony.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、いろいろやってくれてありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, thank you very much for arranging everything.

conversation.ja_sentence: C旅行社の佐藤さんに、こちらの希望を出そうと思って調べてみたんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking of letting Mr. Sato from Travel Agency C know our requests and was doing some research.

conversation.ja_sentence: 部長、以前に授賞式の前日の昼に現地に着くのが希望だって、おっしゃってましたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I recall you saying that we want to get there at noon the day before the awards ceremony right?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、本当はもっとゆっくりの日程にできればいいんだけれど、みんな休暇なわけではない、ビジネス・トリップだからギリギリにするしかないんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I ideally wanted to have a looser schedule but not everyone can come as if on vacation so we have to squeeze the schedule like a business trip.

conversation.ja_sentence: 前日の昼に着ける便って、あった？
conversation.en_sentence: Was there a flight where we arrive at noon the day before?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ありました、A航空のパリ乗り継ぎです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, there was, and it's a transfer at Paris with Airline A.

conversation.ja_sentence: 1便だけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Just one flight?

conversation.ja_sentence: 最短時間で着けるのが、それでした。
conversation.en_sentence: That was the only one that will get there the quickest.

conversation.ja_sentence: 乗り継ぎ回数を増やしても、時間がかかって日程が長くなるだけです。
conversation.en_sentence: The travel will just get longer if we increase the transfers.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、それはそうだ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: それと、成田発着ではいい時間に乗り継げなくて、羽田発着です。
conversation.en_sentence: And there weren't any suitable times to transfer if we depart from Narita so it will be from Haneda.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、羽田発でも別にいいと思うけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I think leaving from Haneda is fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 国内線に乗って来るお客さんもいるし。
conversation.en_sentence: There are a lot of customers flying domestically too.

conversation.ja_sentence: パリ以外だとドイツで乗り継ぐB航空とかC航空も一応あるんですけど、それだと現地には夜の10時以降に着く便になっちゃいます。
conversation.en_sentence: Aside from Paris, there are also Airline B and Airline C that transfers in Germany but we would end up getting there past 10 o'clock at night over there.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホテルに移動すると夜中になるか。
conversation.en_sentence: It'll be midnight by the time we get to the hotel.

conversation.ja_sentence: ろくに休めないね、翌日に式典はつらいよね。
conversation.en_sentence: We won't get much rest and the awards ceremony the next day will be tough.

conversation.ja_sentence: 時差もあるし。
conversation.en_sentence: And there will be jet lag.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.

conversation.ja_sentence: もう、A航空のこの便、って佐藤さんにお願いしてしまっていいでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Can I just ask Mr. Sato to proceed with the flight with Airline A?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、そうしよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, let's do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホテルは取れたんだっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Were you able to book the hotel?

conversation.ja_sentence: 金額の見積を出してもらって、お客様にだいたいの旅費をお知らせできるといいけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I want to get a quote and let the customers know the approximate travel expense.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホテルは、宿泊者名をお知らせしないと確保ができないそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: We will need to let him know the names of the guests staying at the hotel to secure the hotel bookings.

conversation.ja_sentence: だから、希望価格帯と予定人数をお知らせしてあるだけです。
conversation.en_sentence: So I've only told him our budget range and the number of people so far.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、だいたいの旅費は出せると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: But I think we can come up with the approximate travel expense.

conversation.ja_sentence: 結局金額は、例年通りぐらいで済みそうかな。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems the amount will end up being similar to the years before.

title: Can't find an email

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Ben, do you remember the meeting with Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベン、A社との会議のこと覚えてる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it was back in April right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、4月にあった会議のこと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Why do you ask?
conversation.ja_sentence: なんで？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking for the meeting minutes for it but I can't seem to find it.
conversation.ja_sentence: その会議の議事録を探してるんだけど見つからなくてさ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Didn't you write that one?
conversation.ja_sentence: 書いた本人だよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I did.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、俺。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't seem to find it.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも見つからないんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Did you check your sent mail?
conversation.ja_sentence: 送信済みメールは確認した？

conversation.en_sentence: I did.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認した。

conversation.en_sentence: But my email was acting odd a couple months ago and deleted a lot of my emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２ヶ月前にメールの調子が悪くて、メールがたくさん消えちゃったんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe that's why I can't find it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多分それで見つからないんだと思う。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check my email.
conversation.ja_sentence: 俺のメール確認してみるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I might have a copy of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしかしたらあるかも。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Found it.
conversation.ja_sentence: あったよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll forward it to you now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今転送するね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう！

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But shouldn't you have a copy saved in your computer?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも自分のパソコンにコピーを保存しておくべきじゃないの？

conversation.en_sentence: I got a new company laptop recently.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近、会社の新しいラップトップを手に入れてさ。

conversation.en_sentence: I must have forgot to move the folders in the shared drive.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと共有ドライブにフォルダを移動するのを忘れたんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Be careful next time!
conversation.ja_sentence: 次は気をつけなよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry about that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ごめんな。

title: Kitchen situation

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Someone took my food form the fridge...
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰かが冷蔵庫から僕の食べ物をとったな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリア カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: What happened?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I put my sandwich I brought for lunch in the fridge but it's not there...
conversation.ja_sentence: 持ってきたランチのサンドイッチを冷蔵庫に入れてたんだけど、ないんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリア カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey, I brought back leftover pizza from lunch the other day and that disappeared too...
conversation.ja_sentence: おお、こないだ残り物のピザをランチに持ってきたんだけど、それも消えてたよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Who is taking our food from the fridge?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰が冷蔵庫から食べ物を盗んでるんだろう？

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi guys...
conversation.ja_sentence: やあ、みんな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have something in the fridge?
conversation.ja_sentence: 冷蔵庫に何か入れてる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Because you better be careful or some food bandit is stealing our food!
conversation.ja_sentence: 食べ物泥棒が僕らの食べ物を盗んでるみたいだから、気を付けたほうがいいぞ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: No, I'm just getting coffee.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、コーヒーを取りに来ただけだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: What happened?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かあったの？

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: ...And my almond milk is gone from the fridge!
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕のアーモンドミルクが冷蔵庫から消えてる！

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Has anyone seen it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰か見た？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: OK, we have to go talk to someone about the fridge situation.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだな、これは誰かと冷蔵庫の状況について話さないといけないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: This is getting out of hand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分たちで何とかできる範囲じゃない。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to talk to Nancy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ナンシーさんに話してみるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nancy, do you have a moment?
conversation.ja_sentence: ナンシーさん、ちょっとお時間ありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, what can I do for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、どんなご用ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: There has been some food items missing from the fridge in the kitchen...
conversation.ja_sentence: キッチンの冷蔵庫から食べ物がなくなるんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have you noticed anything?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かお気づきになりましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have you spoken to Claudia?
conversation.ja_sentence: クローディアさんに話してみましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ナンシー ウィルソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: She is in charge of the cleaners and supplier for the kitchen.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女が、キッチンのクリーナーや用品の責任者ですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh yes, why didn't I think of that...
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうですね、何で思いつかなかったんだろう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ウィリアムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will go speak to Claudia.
conversation.ja_sentence: クローディアさんと話してみます。

title: 欠席したミーティングの報告

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れ様です、佐藤さん。
conversation.en_sentence: How are you Sato-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れ様、玉岡さん。
conversation.en_sentence: How are you Tamaoka-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先日ミーティング欠席されていたので、今ご報告させて頂ければと思うのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: You weren't at the meeting the other day so I wanted to ask if I can explain it to you now.

conversation.ja_sentence: お時間ありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have time?

conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、大丈夫だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'm good.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず、これが今年のテレビゲーム市場の占有率の内訳です。
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, this is the breakdown of the market share for the video game industry this year.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちは、まだ上位４位のゲーム会社の中にいますが、A社の急成長に注目する必要があります。
conversation.en_sentence: We are still among the top 4 companies but we need to keep an eye on the rapid growth of Company A.

conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らはちょうど我々を上回りました。
conversation.en_sentence: They just surpassed us.

conversation.ja_sentence: どれくらいの差がある？
conversation.en_sentence: What is the difference like?

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社が１７パーセントで、A社が２０パーセントとなっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Our company is 17 percent and Company A is 20 percent.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなに大きな差ではないけど、追いついていく必要があるね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's not that big of a difference but we need to catch up.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: そこで、当社の市場専門家は、A社の発展に着目しました。
conversation.en_sentence: So our company's market specialist was analyzing Company A's growth.

conversation.ja_sentence: すると、A社はA社のゲームを無料で提供し、消費者がゲーム中にアイテムを追加購入できる新しいビジネスシステムを導入していることに気づきました。
conversation.en_sentence: What we learned was that Company A was providing their games for free and noticed that they implemented a new business model where consumers can purchase items in-game.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社は、そのビジネス手法は、私たちが新規ユーザーを引き付けるのにも役立ち得ると考えています。
conversation.en_sentence: We believe this business model can help our company attract new users as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに、それはいい戦法だな。
conversation.en_sentence: That is indeed a good strategy.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: つきましては、当社の１７パーセントの市場占有率を超えて成長できるかを見るため、次の四半期で我々の既存のゲームの一部でそれを試してみることになりました。
conversation.en_sentence: And to see if we can surpass our company's 17 percent market share, we will try this out for some our existing games in the next quarter.

conversation.ja_sentence: 以上が、先日のミーティングについての概要となっております。
conversation.en_sentence: That will be it for the summary of the meeting the other day.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、わかった。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 報告ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your report.

title: インターネット接続不良について

conversation.ja_sentence: 松村さん、今、インターネットに繋がってる？
conversation.en_sentence: Takako, are you connected to Internet now?

conversation.ja_sentence: オンライン検索しようと思ったら出来ないんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I can't seem to search online.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、本当だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, no.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全然つながってないね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's not connected at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱりITに連絡したほうがいいかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I should probably tell IT, shouldn't I?

conversation.ja_sentence: 何時ごろから繋がってなかったの？
conversation.en_sentence: Since what time has it been disconnected?

conversation.ja_sentence: 10時半くらいかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Around ten thirty.

conversation.ja_sentence: 朝来たときは大丈夫だったから。
conversation.en_sentence: It was fine when I came in this morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は午前中ずっと会議に出てたから気づかなかったわ。
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't notice since I was in a meeting all morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: お昼までに直ってくれないと困るんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I am in trouble if it doesn't get fixed until lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、確か、レポートの締め切りが今日の2時だったよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, didn't you have a report due at 2 today?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなの。
conversation.en_sentence: Yup.

conversation.ja_sentence: もう終わってるんだけど、提出前に再確認したいことがあって。
conversation.en_sentence: It is done but there are some things that I want to double check before submitting it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今、ITの誰かに電話したほうがいいんじゃない？
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't it better to call someone at IT now?

conversation.ja_sentence: あそこの人たち、12時になったらすぐランチに行くよ。
conversation.en_sentence: People there will leave for lunch right at noon.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、そうだった！
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, right!

conversation.ja_sentence: 今、電話してみるわ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will call them now.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、何て言ってた？
conversation.en_sentence: So, what did they say?

conversation.ja_sentence: ケーブル会社の人が外で工事をしていて、そのせいで数時間繋がらなくなってるらしい。
conversation.en_sentence: The cable company is working outside, and it has not been connected for several hours because of it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 2時までには直りそう？
conversation.en_sentence: Would it get fixed by 2?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、あと15分したら繋がるって。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, they said it will be connected in 15 minutes.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、締め切りに間に合いそうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then you can make it to the deadline.

conversation.ja_sentence: よかった。
conversation.en_sentence: Great.

conversation.ja_sentence: このまま繋がらないなら、外の無料ワイファイのある場所探さなきゃと思ってたとこだった。
conversation.en_sentence: If it doesn't get connected, I was thinking I should go find somewhere outside with free Wi-Fi.

conversation.ja_sentence: そういえば、角のお店、無料ワイファイだったような気がする。
conversation.en_sentence: Speaking of that, I think the place around the corner had free Wi-Fi.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつも混んでるあそこね。
conversation.en_sentence: The place that is always crowded.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、あ、インターネット繋がったみたいだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, oh, the internet is connected now.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、本当だ。
conversation.en_sentence: You're right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かったー。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank goodness.

title: Copyright infringement

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Yoshida, may I talk to you for a second?
conversation.ja_sentence: 吉田さん、ちょっといいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, is something wrong?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、何か問題でも？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We just received an e-mail from Company M accusing us of copyright infringement.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先ほどM社からメールがきたのですが、我が社が著作権侵害をしているとの事です。

conversation.en_sentence: What product are we talking about?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの商品の事ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's the product L sold on the e-commerce website Z.
conversation.ja_sentence: オンラインショッピングサイトZに出品しているL商品です。

conversation.en_sentence: They are claiming the copyright.
conversation.ja_sentence: M社が著作権所持を主張しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, this should not be an issue.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題になるはずがないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We are authorized to sell this product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社は認定販売しているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: The e-mail says that they will take a legal action if we don't pull this particular item off the website within 48 hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールによると、48時間以内にウェブサイトから商品削除をしなければ法的処置を取るとの事です。

conversation.en_sentence: I am going to pull out our authorized distributor certificate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 公認卸売業者証明書を出しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Would you please scan it and send it to my e-mail address?
conversation.ja_sentence: それをスキャンして私のメールに送ってもらってもいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I will do that right away.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに取り掛かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me handle the rest.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとは私に任せて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: When I show them the certificate, they should not have any problem with us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 証明書を見せたら、問題にはならないはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: I know many companies sell this very same product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 同じ商品を販売している会社が多数あります。

conversation.en_sentence: Company M might have confused us with a different company.
conversation.ja_sentence: M社は他の会社と勘違いしたのかもしれませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Not all of them are authorized distributors like us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 販売している会社全てが認定販売しているわけではないですからね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's just an honest mistake on their part.
conversation.ja_sentence: 相手側のうっかりミスですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We have been selling this product for a few years and have never had any dispute with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社は何年もこの商品を販売してますが、一度も問題になった事はないです。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope they will resolve this issue immediately.
conversation.ja_sentence: 早く問題解決するといいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I promise they will.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと解決しますよ。

title: 株主総会に関する役員向け説明（１）

conversation.ja_sentence: 全員お揃いのようなので、これから株主総会に関する役員ミーティングを始めます。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems everyone is here so let's start the executive meeting in regards to the general meeting of shareholders now.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、高田、進めてもらえるかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, can you proceed with this Takada?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それではこれより私が進めさせていただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will be proceeding this.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず始めに、M信託銀行の能勢さんより、今期の各社の総会における傾向等についてお話いただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, we will have Nose-san from Trust Company M to talk about the trends of the general meetings of each company this quarter.

conversation.ja_sentence: 能勢さん、よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Nose, please go ahead.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆様、おはようございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning everyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年も御社の総会のお手伝いをさせていただきます、M信託銀行の能勢です。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Nose from Trust Company M and I will be helping out with your company's general meeting this year again.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞ、よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: I look forward to working with you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今、高田さんからお話がありました通り、まずは最近の総会運営に関する動向などをお話します。
conversation.en_sentence: As Takada-san mentioned earlier, I will be talking about the trend and such in regards to running the general meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: また、特に御社の状況を鑑みた上でのポイント等もお話できればと思いますので、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, I am especially hoping to talk about the situation from your company's perspective so I look forward to working with you.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、最初に今期の他社様における総会の現状についてお話します。
conversation.en_sentence: So I will first talk about the situation of general meetings at other companies this quarter.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の印象としましては、今期は全体的におとなしい総会が多かったなと。
conversation.en_sentence: My impression is that there were a lot of meek general meetings overall this quarter.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今期は業績が良い安定していた企業が多かったから、というのが大きな理由でしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: There were a lot of companies whose performance were good and stable this quarter so that's is probably the big reason.

conversation.ja_sentence: 時間も１時間程度で終了する企業様が多く、質疑応答も非常にスムーズでした。
conversation.en_sentence: There were many companies who finished in around 1 hour and the questions and answers went very smoothly.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、一部、特に業績の下方修正など、ネガティブな発表をしている企業においては、かなり突っ込んだ株主質問がありました。
conversation.en_sentence: However, in regards to some companies that made negative announcements like decreasing performance faced very detailed questions from shareholders.

conversation.ja_sentence: それらは事前にある程度の予測ができますので、質疑応答の対策をたてておけば、さほど心配はないと思われます。
conversation.en_sentence: I think those can be somewhat predicted beforehand so as long as we prepare for the questions and answers then I don't think we need to worry about it that much.

conversation.ja_sentence: さて、次に御社についてです。
conversation.en_sentence: Now, next is in regards to your company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 株主数については安定しております。
conversation.en_sentence: Your company's number of shareholders are stable.

conversation.ja_sentence: また、株主名簿を確認しましたが、要注意人物や企業名もないようですので、ひと安心しています。
conversation.en_sentence: And I checked the register of shareholders and there were no people or company that are suspicious so I'm relieved for now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 心配事としては、期中に業績の下方修正をしていますので、業績関係の質疑が多いかなと。
conversation.en_sentence: The thing I am worried about is that the performance has dropped this quarter so there will probably be a lot of questions in relation to the performance.

conversation.ja_sentence: また、新任となる取締役の方への質問も予測されます。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, I anticipate there will be questions for the newly appointed director.

conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、業績周りと新任取締役に関する質疑応答はしっかりご準備された方がよろしいかと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: So I think we should thoroughly prepare for the questions and answers in regards to performance and the newly appointed director.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回の総会で特に気にしておくことは、このくらいかなと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I think this is about it for things we should keep note of for this general meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次に、具体的に総会当日までのスケジュールを私からご説明します。
conversation.en_sentence: Next, I will be explaining the the exact schedule up until the day of the general meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、事前にメールに添付した資料をご覧ください。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, please look at the material attached in the email I sent earlier.

title: 年末の会話

conversation.ja_sentence: 年末で仕事がほとんど残ってないね。
conversation.en_sentence: We don't have much work left to do for the end of the year.

conversation.ja_sentence: たいていのクライアントは既に冬休みに入っているし。
conversation.en_sentence: Most of our clients are already on winter break.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのようですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I've noticed that too.

conversation.ja_sentence: オフィス周りの掃除をするくらいしかないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: All that's left is to clean up around here.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日私は古い書類をシュレッダーにかけています。
conversation.en_sentence: Today I'm shredding all of this old paperwork.

conversation.ja_sentence: この箱は90年代のものなんですよ、伝票の保管期間はたった3年のはずなのに。
conversation.en_sentence: These boxes are from the nineties, even though we're only supposed to keep invoices for 3 years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 時間があるようなら、どなたか手伝ってもらえませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Could either of you help me if you have time?

conversation.ja_sentence: 喜んで手伝うよ！
conversation.en_sentence: Of course!

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕はまずキーボードの掃除をしなくちゃ。
conversation.en_sentence: I was just going to clean my keyboard first.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最後に掃除したのはいつだったかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I can't remember the last time I cleaned it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一年分の埃がたまってなければいいけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Hopefully there's not a year's worth of dust in there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 帰る前に僕もキーボードをきれいにしたほうが良さそうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: I should probably clean mine before I leave too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 加藤さんは休み中になにか楽しい予定はあるの？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any exciting plans for the holidays, Kato?

conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事が終わったら九州行きの新幹線に乗る予定です。
conversation.en_sentence: Once I'm done working, I'm planning on catching a bullet train to Kyushu.

conversation.ja_sentence: お正月は両親と一緒に過ごします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to be with my parents for New Year's.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは楽しそうだし、リラックスできそうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: That should be fun and relaxing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 木村君はどうなの？
conversation.en_sentence: What about you, Kimura?

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は東京に残りますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm just going to stay in Tokyo.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今週友達が遊びに来ているのでお互い積もる話でもします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll probably catch up with my friend who is visiting this week.

conversation.ja_sentence: 映画も観に行こうかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I think we might go to the movies.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今なにか良い映画やってます？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know any good ones showing right now?

conversation.ja_sentence: 最近は映画に行く暇もなかったな。
conversation.en_sentence: I haven't really had time to go to the movies recently.

conversation.ja_sentence: 休み中に行けたらいいけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Hopefully I can during my break.

conversation.ja_sentence: なにか大きな計画はあるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have anything big planned?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は仕事帰りに毎年恒例の年越しそばを食べる予定だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to get my annual end-of-the-year soba noodles on the way home today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 長野にスキー旅行に行こうかとも思うけど、どうなることやら。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm thinking of taking a ski trip in Nagano, but I'm not sure yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: さて、書類をシュレッダーにかけるのを手伝おうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, I can help you shred those papers now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります！
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great!

conversation.ja_sentence: 木村さん、来年お会いしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll guess see you next year, Kimura.

conversation.ja_sentence: 良いお年を！
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good new year!

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!

conversation.ja_sentence: 良いお年を！
conversation.en_sentence: Have a happy new year！

title: Business meeting with booth vendor

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Sara, thank you for stopping by for this meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、サラさん、こちらの会議に来てくださってありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: No problem, I appreciate the opportunity to speak face-to-face about this.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、このように対面でお話できる機会に感謝しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, so what's the status on our booth design for this year's conference?
conversation.ja_sentence: よかったです、で、今年のカンファレンスのブースデザインの状況はどうなってますか？

conversation.en_sentence: After you approved the rough design two weeks ago, we've been working on a couple of detailed mock ups and I'd like to hear what you think.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２週間前にデザインの下案を承認してくださった後、私たちのほうでサンプルの細かいところを詰めたので、ご意見をお聞きしたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: All right, let me see them.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、じゃ見させてください。

conversation.en_sentence: So there are three versions and one is a standard design, true to your traditional stall designs, and the other two are more daring.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、３バージョンあるのですが、一つは従来のストールデザインに準じた標準的デザインで、あとの二つがもう少し斬新なものとなっています。

conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, we did conclude at our branding meeting the other day that we need to spice up our visuals at exhibitions.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、先日のブランディング会議で、展示会でのビジュアルをもう少し派手にする必要があるなという結論を出したんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So maybe design one is not so appropriate for this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、今年は１つ目のデザインはあまり適していないかも知れないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: No, maybe not.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、多分違いますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, so narrowing it down to designs two and three, the main difference between them is the use of space and transparent acrylic walls.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、デザイン２と３に絞られることになりますが、これらの主な違いは、空間と透明アクリルウォールの利用です。

conversation.en_sentence: Design three is a more open feel, meaning anyone walking by could read all the contents of the booth.
conversation.ja_sentence: デザイン３は、よりオープンな雰囲気なので、通り過ぎる人々がブースの中を全て見ることが出来ます。

conversation.en_sentence: It certainly has good visibility and I could imagine people casually walking through our area.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに見え方がいいので、人々がふらっと私たちのエリアに立ち寄ってくれることが想像できますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but on the other hand, competitors will be able to take pictures of your displays easily and visitors will be able to read the panels without having to actually enter the booth.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ただし一方で、競合者が展示の写真を簡単にとることが出来るのと、ビジターがブース内に実際に入らずにパネルを読むことが出来てしまいます。

conversation.en_sentence: That could be a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは問題かも知れないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: How do you feel about design two, which has more opaque materials around the entrances to the booth?
conversation.ja_sentence: ブースの入口にもう少し不透明な材質を使ったデザイン２についてはどう思われますか？

conversation.en_sentence: We can make adjustments to the details of the design, so even if you don't like this initial mock up, don't feel that you have to reject it entirely.
conversation.ja_sentence: デザインの細かい部分は調整可能ですから、このサンプルにご不満があっても、全部却下する必要があるとはお思いにならないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: I do have the feeling that we need to attract more people towards the sales people manning the booth rather than just making a big impression on passersby.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ通りすがりの人たちにいい印象を与えるだけでなく、ブースに待機している営業マンに人々を引き付ける必要があるように感じるんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So design two is the direction we should move in?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、デザイン２の方向で行きますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's what I'm feeling but I need to make final confirmation with my superior.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、私はそう感じていますが、上司からの最終確認が必要になります。

conversation.en_sentence: That is totally fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは全く構いませんよ。

conversation.en_sentence: As I emailed, initial design selection can be done next Friday, so you should have plenty of time.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールさせていただいたように、当初のデザインの選択は来週の金曜なので、お時間はたっぷりあるはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I can bring it up with her in next week's marketing meeting, so I will be able to get back to you on Thursday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女には来週のマーケティング会議で話せると思うので、木曜にはお返事できると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでいいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else I need to address?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に話し合うべきことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we are still waiting for your decision about the merchandise, which I emailed you about last week.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、先週メールでお話した商品についての結論を待っているんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Right, right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、そうでした。

conversation.en_sentence: That I will also be able to confirm in the marketing meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: それもマーケティング会議で確認できますので。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will expect to hear back from you then.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、じゃ、ご返事をお待ちしております。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, that's all from me, thank you for your time today.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、私のほうはこれで全てです、今日はお時間ありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for coming down.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご足労いただきありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you next Thursday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の木曜にご連絡いたします。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good, good bye.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、では失礼いたします。

title: Improving work performance

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for coming, Mr. Olsen.
conversation.ja_sentence: オルセンさん、来てくれてありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I am here anytime you need me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要な時はいつでも来ます。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to ask you a question regarding your work today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はあなたの仕事ぶりについて質問があります。

conversation.en_sentence: You have been with us for the last 6 years.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで６年働いてますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
conversation.ja_sentence: ５年後は何をしているか想像できますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I would like to think I will be moving up the corporate ladder.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昇格しているといいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Managing the whole department will be something I would love to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: 部署を管理するマネージメントの仕事に就きたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: I want you to achieve the goal too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのゴールに是非到達して欲しいです。

conversation.en_sentence: I have been satisfied with your work so far.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今のあなたの仕事ぶりには満足しています。

conversation.en_sentence: You are very thorough and pay attention to details.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事は徹底されているし、細かい所にもちゃんと目を向けていますね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am doing my best to contribute to the company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社に貢献できる様に全力を尽くしています。

conversation.en_sentence: You certainly are a great asset here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで貴重な人材である事は確かです。

conversation.en_sentence: But you might want to learn to become a better leader.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、良いリーダーになる為にもう少し学んだ方が良いかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: I may sound a little bit harsh, but please don't take it personally.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少し厳しく聞こえるかもしれませんが、個人的に受け取らないでくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: I can take constructive criticism, Ms. Simmons.
conversation.ja_sentence: シモンズさん、建設的な批判はちゃんと受け取れますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It will help me improve my work performance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事の上達に繋がりますから。

conversation.en_sentence: You always get your assignments submitted on time.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも締め切り日までにアサイメントを提出してくれますね。

conversation.en_sentence: But your team tends to lag behind.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもあなたのチームは遅れを取る傾向にあります。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why I am usually working overtime to compensate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから私はそれを補う為に残業しています。

conversation.en_sentence: That is the problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが問題なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: You are not delegating enough responsibilities to people who work under you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの元で働く従業員に責任を委ねてないんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am pretty positive I do that just fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんとしていると思っていたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Then you need to start managing them better.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではこれからちゃんと管理して下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure none of them procrastinate his or her work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰一人仕事を先延ばしにすることがないようにしてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Try to motivate them to do their best.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんなが全力を尽くす様にやる気も出させてくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: You also need to give them pointers or criticism when necessary.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要な時は助言や批判もして下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: I will try harder.
conversation.ja_sentence: 頑張ります。

conversation.en_sentence: The people are probably used to getting their slack covered by you.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんな怠けてもあなたがカバーする事に慣れているはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: They might resist a change at first.
conversation.ja_sentence: 初めは変化に抵抗するかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: But they should soon realize that you are doing them a favor.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもすぐにあなたがやっている事は彼らにとっても良い事だと気付くはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: They need to learn to become more productive members of this company too, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼ら自身もこの会社の有意義なメンバーになる事を学ばないといけないですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: Great leaders help others become efficient workers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしいリーダーは従業員に手際良く仕事をさせます。

conversation.en_sentence: If you could do that, you will get closer to your goal.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしあなたもそれができるのならば、ゴールに一歩近づきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイス有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Keep up with the good work.
conversation.ja_sentence: このまま頑張って下さいね。

title: セキュリティゲートのカードについて

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の緊急ミーティングはセキュリティカードについてです。
conversation.en_sentence: The emergency meeting today is about security cards.

conversation.ja_sentence: 山本さん、皆に説明してください。
conversation.en_sentence: Yamamoto san, please explain the situation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日当該カードの紛失事件が発生しました。
conversation.en_sentence: There was an incident where one of the cards was lost yesterday.

conversation.ja_sentence: 事件を起こしたのは、J事業部の社員です。
conversation.en_sentence: The person in question is from division J.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昨夜高校時代からの友人と退勤後飲みに出かけたそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: He was out drinking with his high school friends after work.

conversation.ja_sentence: 飲み会は2次会まで続き、タクシーで帰宅しました。
conversation.en_sentence: He was out at a second venue and then went home in a taxi.

conversation.ja_sentence: 翌朝になってセキュリティカードが入っていた鞄ごと無いことに気付いたそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: It wasn't until the next morning that he realized that his bag and security card were missing!

conversation.ja_sentence: 規則では飲み会などがあるときは一旦鞄を自宅に置いて出かけることになっているのに。
conversation.en_sentence: But isn't it in the rules that if you're going out you should leave your belongings at home first?

conversation.ja_sentence: 立ち寄った居酒屋とバー、それにタクシー会社には問い合わせ中だそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: The person in question says that he had contacted the izakaya, the bar and the taxi company about the lost bag and is waiting to hear back from them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月もJ事業部が同じように紛失事件を起こしていましたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: There was another loss-incident in division J last month...

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、その時も会社退勤後飲み会に行った道中で起こっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that was also when staff had gone out drinking after work.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月の事件後、あれだけ全社員にカードの重要性を周知徹底したんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: After that we had just reinforced how important security is here.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先月は結局カードは見つかったんでしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, did that card ever show up again?

conversation.ja_sentence: 落とし物として警察に届けられそこから社に連絡がありました。
conversation.en_sentence: The police notified us that someone had handed it in as lost and found.

conversation.ja_sentence: 見つかったからよかったものの、誰かがこれで社に忍び込んだりしてたら。
conversation.en_sentence: That was good that it was found and no one tried to break into the office.

conversation.ja_sentence: もっとカードの重要性について全社員に知ってもらうべきでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Should we remind everyone the importance of keeping the card safe?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、どれだけ重要か知ってたとしても多分またやるでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I think it'll happen again even if they know how important it is.

conversation.ja_sentence: 落としたら罰金というようにしてはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about fining employees who lose their cards?

conversation.ja_sentence: その罰則を社員規則に定めるのには時間を要します。
conversation.en_sentence: It will take time to establish that penalty though.

conversation.ja_sentence: もう少し早く対策できるものをやっていきたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: We need a more immediate plan.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の事業部は紛失していないので強化対象をJ事業部だけに絞るのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: The other divisions have not had any problem with this, so how about re enforcing the rules to just the people in division J?

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全社員対象にやると、他の事業部からクレームが来る可能性もあります。
conversation.en_sentence: If we were to reinforce this with the whole company again, other divisions might complain.

conversation.ja_sentence: それではJ事業部だけにやるとして、何か案はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: OK, then let's come up with a plan just for division J.

conversation.ja_sentence: 出勤の時にカードを渡し、退勤時に預かるというのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What about collecting the cards before they leave and give them back in the morning?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなると自宅には持って帰らないのでカードの紛失が防げると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: That way, they can't take them home and lose them.
