conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的なやり方として、出勤時に社の受付でカードを渡す。
conversation.en_sentence: To be precise, let's give them back the cards at reception.

conversation.ja_sentence: 退勤時に同じように社の受付でカードを回収する、こんな感じでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: And collect them before they leave at the reception as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、それがいいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds like a good plan.

conversation.ja_sentence: J事業部は現在社員200名ほどの大事業部ですが、できそうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: At the moment, there are about 200 staff in division J, is this feasible?

conversation.ja_sentence: 朝早めにJ事業部のリーダー数名に出勤してもらってやりましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: We need to tell the division J leaders that they need to come in earlier so that they can begin this process.

conversation.ja_sentence: それだと明日からでも始められそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: We can start that from tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昼休憩時に外出する際はどうしましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: What about during the day when they leave for lunch?

conversation.ja_sentence: そこはこれまで同様に、自分で管理でいいのでは無いでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't we keep the system as it is and let them keep the cards on them for that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 過去に昼にカードが紛失されたことは一度もないのでそれでいいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: There hasn't been a problem with people losing security cards during lunch in the past, so it should be fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: この措置はどれくらい続けましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How long should we have this procedure in place?

conversation.ja_sentence: あまり長くやると朝早くくるリーダーの負担も大きくなります。
conversation.en_sentence: It might be a lot to ask for the leaders to come in early if we have to do it for too long.

conversation.ja_sentence: ひとまず2ヶ月ほど様子を見てみるのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Let's try it out for 2 months, for now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 賛成です、それで進めましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds great, let's go with that plan.

conversation.ja_sentence: では私はJ事業部の責任者に伝えてきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will inform the managers in division J.

title: 休暇中の対応について

conversation.ja_sentence: 松本さん、明日から一週間お休みを取らせていただいてるので、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Takashi, I will start my one week vacation tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、娘さんのところへいらっしゃるんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, you're going to your daughter's place, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、明日の朝いちの新幹線で東京まで。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'll leave for Tokyo with the first shinkansen bullet train tomorrow morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: 就職で東京に出てから、まだ会ってないもので。
conversation.en_sentence: I hadn't seen here since she left to Tokyo for work.

conversation.ja_sentence: 楽しみですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You must be excited.

conversation.ja_sentence: ゆっくりしてきてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please enjoy your time there.

conversation.ja_sentence: いない間、ご迷惑をおかけするかも知れませんが、すみません。
conversation.en_sentence: You might have a lot to do while I am gone, so let me thank you in advance.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらは大丈夫ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry about us.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新しく入った中山君も頼りになりますし。
conversation.en_sentence: Our new addition Kazuo is someone you can rely on too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ね、中山君。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, Kazuo?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、任せてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please count on me.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私のいない間に、ひょっとすると経理部のほうから例の件で問い合わせがあるかも知れませんが。
conversation.en_sentence: The Accounting might ask you about that issue while I am gone.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、それは承知してます。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I am aware of that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 武藤さんのほうからご説明いただいてるので、私と中山君でちゃんと対処しておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Since you have explained it to us, Kazuo and I can deal with it no problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご心配なさらずに。
conversation.en_sentence: Please don't worry.

conversation.ja_sentence: ここにちゃんと資料が揃ってますから。
conversation.en_sentence: We have all the documents we need here.

conversation.ja_sentence: お願いするよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: この件はずっと気になっていたから、ちょっと心配でね。
conversation.en_sentence: This has been bothering me for a long time, so I can't help worrying.

conversation.ja_sentence: 武藤さん、大丈夫ですって。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry, Shizuo.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一週間、ちゃんと娘さんと楽しく過ごしてきてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please make sure you enjoy one week with your daughter.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよ、せっかくのご家族の時間を、仕事のことばかり考えて無駄になさらないようにしてください。
conversation.en_sentence: So true, please do not waste the precious family time by obsessing about work.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当だね。
conversation.en_sentence: You're right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事メールもなるべくチェックしないでくださいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you don't check work email if you don't have to.

conversation.ja_sentence: 武藤さん、終業後もいつも夜遅くまでメール対応されてますもんね。
conversation.en_sentence: You're always checking and responding to email until late at night even after the business hours.

conversation.ja_sentence: 根っからの仕事人で、休み方が分からないんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I am such a workaholic that I don't know how to rest.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回の休みは、頑張ってきちんと休んできます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will try to enjoy my vacation this time.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You should.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの部署も人数が増えたことだし、安心してください。
conversation.en_sentence: We have more people in our department now, so you don't need to worry much.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです、一週間くらい任せてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we can handle one week without you.

conversation.ja_sentence: それだけ言ってくれるなら安心です。
conversation.en_sentence: If you say so, I shouldn't worry.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、私が戻って来たら、もう一人うちの部署で採用をする予定になっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, we are supposed to hire one more person after I come back.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、それは初耳です。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I didn't know about that.

conversation.ja_sentence: いない間に面接希望者から連絡があるかも知れませんが、それについては私が戻ってから連絡すると言っておいてください。
conversation.en_sentence: You might hear from people who want to set up interviews while I am gone, but just tell them I will contact them when I return.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中山君もそういうことでよろしく。
conversation.en_sentence: Did you get that, Kazuo?

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I did.

conversation.ja_sentence: 言っておくことはこれくらいかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I think that's all I need to tell you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大丈夫ですから、ゆっくり休んでください。
conversation.en_sentence: Good, we're fine, so please enjoy your vacation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 娘さんも楽しみにされてるでしょうし。
conversation.en_sentence: Your daughter must be excited too.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, thank you.

title: going out for drinks?

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリア クレーマーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Angela, Chris, do you want to go out for a quick drink after work tonight?
conversation.ja_sentence: アンジェラさん、クリスさん、今日仕事の後でちょっと飲みに行きませんか？

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have dinner plans but I can go for a little bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: ディナーの予定があるんですが、ちょっとなら行けますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I don't have any plans tonight, so sure!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は今夜は予定がないから、ぜひ！

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I hope I can get all my work done in time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時間内に仕事を全部片づけられたらいいんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリア クレーマーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, what are you working on Chris?
conversation.ja_sentence: よかった、クリスさん、今何をやっているの？

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need to finish some data input for Tom.
conversation.ja_sentence: トムさんのためにデータ入力を終える必要があるんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have to go back for the past five years and having a bit of problem getting the numbers from business development.
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去五年間遡る必要があるんですが、事業開発から数字をもらうのにちょっと苦労していて。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Their data is pretty poorly organized.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らのデータがあまり整理されていなくて。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I know Andy from the group.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのグループのアンディさんを知ってますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: He's been there awhile and I'm sure he can help you out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼、そこにしばらくいるから、助けてくれると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Really, that would be wonderful!
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですか、それはとっても助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: What's his extension?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼の内線は何番ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me see, it's 5079.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、5079ね。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Would you like me to give him a heads up?
conversation.ja_sentence: 先に私のほうから彼に話をしておきましょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks, that would be perfect!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、本当に助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have been working with Ed down there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はそこのエドさんと仕事してるんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: アンジェラ カミングスさん
conversation.en_sentence: OK, I'll let Andy know.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、アンディに言っておきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス ショウさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much, Angela!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、アンジェラさん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリア クレーマーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Seems like it's all happening.
conversation.ja_sentence: すべてうまくいきそうね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジュリア クレーマーさん
conversation.en_sentence: See you both around five o'clock!
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、二人とも５時に！

title: Face-to-face conversation: Looking for a document

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ben, do you have the data sheet for this product?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベン、この製品のデータシートはありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which product is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの製品？

conversation.en_sentence: It's this one here.
conversation.ja_sentence: これです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, I don't recall having this one.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、これはなかったんじゃないかなあ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check my inbox.
conversation.ja_sentence: 受信トレイをチェックしてみる。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Nope, don't have it.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、ないや。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I'll ask the supplier for it again.
conversation.ja_sentence: サプライヤーにもう一度聞いてみようかな。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a bit embarrassing to ask again though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、また聞くのはちょっと恥ずかしいなあ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe Elaine has it.
conversation.ja_sentence: エレインが持ってるかもよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Elaine.
conversation.ja_sentence: エレイン、ちょっと。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何でしょう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Would you happen to have this data sheet for this product?
conversation.ja_sentence: この製品のデータシート持ってたりします？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which one is this one?
conversation.ja_sentence: この製品ってどれですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's the one from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の製品。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me think.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll check my inbox.
conversation.ja_sentence: 受信トレイを見てみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll check my inbox one more time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も、もう一度見てみるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can't seem to find it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見当たらないです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I do recall seeing it before though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、前に見た覚えがあるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I know it's out there somewhere.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、どこかにあるはずなんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I might've saved a hardcopy in the filing cabinet.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、ファイルキャビネットにハードコピーをしまったかも。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me go check.
conversation.ja_sentence: チェックしてみるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll go too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒に行きますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Voila.
conversation.ja_sentence: あった。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here we are.
conversation.ja_sentence: はいどうぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much!
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かった！

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should scan it and make a copy of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: スキャンしてコピーしてね。

conversation.en_sentence: I will do that right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、今すぐやります。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as usual!
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも、ありがとうございます。

title: talking about how to approach leads

conversation.en_sentence: John and Yumi, what can I do for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンさん、由美さん、どんなご用件ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I called G Trading and they said a deal was already made.
conversation.ja_sentence: G貿易に電話をしたら、もうすでに取引が決まっていると言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I talked them into letting us formulate their materials.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、うちが彼らの材料を考案するということについて話をしましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It took me 2 rounds of golf though, haha!
conversation.ja_sentence: ゴルフ２ラウンド分かかりましたけどね、ははは！

conversation.en_sentence: Why wasn't I informed of this?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして教えていただけなかったんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: This is a high level business deal.
conversation.ja_sentence: これはハイレベルの事業取引だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You're not part of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は関係ないだろう。

conversation.en_sentence: You don't get informed on everything, Yumi.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何でも教えてもらえるわけじゃないんだよ、由美さん。

conversation.en_sentence: You told me to contact G Trading.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私にG貿易に連絡をとるようにとおっしゃいましたよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I did so, and they thought I was calling in regards to the contract which I knew nothing about.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうしたら、私が全く知らない契約についての連絡だと思われていたようです。

conversation.en_sentence: I looked quite foolish.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が馬鹿に見えてしまいましたが。

conversation.en_sentence: This isn't about you, Yumi.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは君のことじゃないんだよ、由美さん。

conversation.en_sentence: You are just starting out here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで仕事を始めたばかりだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think worrying about how you look to others should be your priority.
conversation.ja_sentence: 周りにどう見えるかを心配するのが優先事項じゃないでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: I understand you are of the "social network" generation, but you shouldn't bring in the "me, me, me" attitude to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 「ソーシャルネットワーク」世代なのは分かるけれど、「私が一番大切」という態度を仕事に持ち込むのはどうかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, this is not about me, it's about how this company is perceived by others.
conversation.ja_sentence: あのすいません、これは私がどうのこうのではなく、会社が周りにどう見られてるかについてなんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: This company has a great reputation.
conversation.ja_sentence: この会社の評判はいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am not worried about how it's perceived.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやって見られているかは心配していない。

conversation.en_sentence: With me calling them cluelessly, I am pretty sure G Trading got the impression that we are not as organized as they thought we would be.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何も分からず私が電話をしたことで、G貿易は、うちの会社が思ったほどきちんとしていないという印象を受けたと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Well it's on you not to give that sort of impression.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、そういう印象を与えないようにするのは君次第だね。

conversation.en_sentence: If you shared information with me, this would not have happened.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし情報を共有してくだされば、こんなことにはならなかったのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Yumi, I am disappointed in how you blame others for your mistake.
conversation.ja_sentence: 由美さん、そうやって自分のミスの責任を人に押し付けるなんてがっかりですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Ko, it's hard for Yumi to make calls with limited information on hand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高さん、手元にある限られた情報だけで電話をするなんて、由美さんには大変ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It would have helped if she knew about the deal so she could talk with them professionally.
conversation.ja_sentence: 取引について知らされていれば、それが助けになって彼女ももっとプロらしく話せたと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well then you should remember to clue her in on that next time.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、次は君が彼女にヒントを与えるように覚えておいてください。

conversation.en_sentence: That really went around in circles, didn't it?
conversation.ja_sentence: あれは本当に堂々巡りだったね。

conversation.en_sentence: I wonder what made him think I knew about the G Trading deal when he is so secretive about everything?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、何でも隠しておくくせに、どうして僕がG貿易との取引について知ってると思ったんだろう。

conversation.en_sentence: How can he be so tone deaf and patronizing at the same time?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやったら、あれだけ空気が読めないと同時に人を見下せるんでしょうね。

conversation.en_sentence: Does he even hear himself?
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で自分の言ってることが聞こえてるんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: This is the reason no one really talks to him.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、誰も彼と話さないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It goes around in circles, and we never reach a conclusion.
conversation.ja_sentence: 堂々巡りで、全然結論が出ないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry you had to go through this, but you just have to let it roll off your back.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんなことを経験しなくちゃいけなくて悪いね、でも、スルーしたほうがいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Otherwise, you'll end up being angry all the time.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうじゃないと、いつも怒っていないといけない。

conversation.en_sentence: Is this what you went through as well?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンさんもこういう経験をされてきたのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, my first year here was a mess, but Mari helped me out.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、最初の一年はむちゃくちゃだったけど、真理さんに助けてもらった。

conversation.en_sentence: You got great colleagues, so you are in good company.
conversation.ja_sentence: いい同僚たちがいるし、いい仲間がいる。

conversation.en_sentence: But what if we need some sort of executive decision?
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、何か執行部の決断が必要な時はどうするんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: We all go directly to Dr. Toshinaga.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆、利永さんのところに直接行くんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: At the end of the day she's the CEO so she has the final say.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結局のところ、彼女がCEOで、最終的な決定権を持つからね。

title: Face-to-face conversation: Data request

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Hey Sam, where do you find import data?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、サム、輸入データはどこで見つかるかな？

conversation.en_sentence: You can find them in the government database.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府のデータベースで探せますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: They have all the import and export data.
conversation.ja_sentence: 輸入も輸出データもあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you find the data I'm looking for?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕が欲しいデータを探せる？

conversation.en_sentence: I guess.
conversation.ja_sentence: できると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: What are you looking for?
conversation.ja_sentence: 探しているのは何です？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking for the import data of this product for the past five years.
conversation.ja_sentence: この製品の過去５年間の輸入データを見たいんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: From which country?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの国からの？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I just need the data from China, Japan, and Korea.
conversation.ja_sentence: 中国、日本、韓国からの輸入データだけ。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you want it in a pivot table format?
conversation.ja_sentence: ピボット式の表で出しますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それがいい。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: How long will it take for you to finish it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 終わるのにどれくらいかかりそう？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm a bit busy this week with meetings and other tasks.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週はミーティングとその他の仕事でちょっと忙しいんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I was actually hoping you can finish it by the end of today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は今日の帰りまでにやってもらいたかったんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll work on it now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、やってみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I owe you one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 借りができたね。

title: 海外出張のメンバーを決める会議

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年もサンフランシスコでセミコンがあるので日本からも応援出張に行こうと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: There is Semi Con show in San Francisco and we are sending some some of you to support our American branch.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年もまたセミコンの季節がやってきましたね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's Semi Con season again, isn't it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は何人くらいでお考えですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How many of us are you planning to send this year?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、今年はアメリカ支社から参加人数が少ないみたいだから、こちらから少し多めの人数で参加しようと思っているよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see, sounds like they will have fewer members going from the American branch, so I'm thinking sending a couple more people than usual.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、中国語のできる人も送り込みたいな。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm also thinking about sending some Mandarin speakers.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはいいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's a good idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中国語をしゃべっている方が多かったですからね。
conversation.en_sentence: I noticed there are many people speaking Mandarin.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱりそうか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 三木さんは去年行ったから何かほかに参考になる意見があれば教えてくれないかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Miss Miki, it would be great if you have any other opinion because you were there last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね...。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日頃アメリカ支社とやり取りをしている社員を送り込むのはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about sending some of us who are dealing with our American branch?

conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ支社の社員と顔見知りとなり今後のコミュニケーションにも好影響が出るんじゃないかと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: So that they will meet in person and it would make the communication smoother in the future.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは私も賛成です。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree with you.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、それはもっともだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course, that's a good point.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとこれは私の意見ですが。
conversation.en_sentence: And if I may say something...

conversation.ja_sentence: 営業部だけではなく、技術部や開発部も参加してもいいんじゃないでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: We should send not only the sales team but also Tech team and Product Development team.

conversation.ja_sentence: そういう人もセミコンに来ていますから。
conversation.en_sentence: Those people come to Semi Con, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: クライアントの生の声が聞けて彼らにもきっといいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be a great opportunity for them to hear what the client has to say in person.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほどね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、各チームから2人ずつではどうだろうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Then, how about 2 members from each team?

conversation.ja_sentence: 6人もいればアメリカ支社も心強いでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: If we can send 6 from here, that would be a huge support for the American branch.

conversation.ja_sentence: せっかく技術・開発がアメリカに行くのでしたら、是非セミコンの前後にクライアントともミーティングしてはどうでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: And, since Tech and PD team are going to America, how about arranging some meetings with our clients before or after Semi Con?

conversation.ja_sentence: クライアントと顔見知りになれるいいチャンスだと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be a great to chance to get to know some of our clients.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはとてもいい考えだね。
conversation.en_sentence: That is a great idea!

conversation.ja_sentence: では早速アメリカ支社に連絡していくつかのクライアントにアポをとってもらってくれないか？
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't you contact the American branch and ask them to make some appointments with their clients.

conversation.ja_sentence: かしこまりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日中にメールしておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will email them before they close today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 明日までには返事があると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: We should hear from them by tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: では私は今から技術と開発に連絡します。
conversation.en_sentence: I will go talk to Tech and PD teams now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 2人ずつメンバーを決定してもらうよう伝え、月末に打ち合わせする予定にします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will tell them to choose 2 members and we will have a meeting at the end of the month.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしく頼むよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Great.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は総務に人数と大体の日程を連絡しておくよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will go talk to the general affairs office and tell them our rough dates.

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算の関係があるだろうからね。
conversation.en_sentence: They will need to think about the budget.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

title: Recommending a friend for a job

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Kellar, do you have a moment?
conversation.ja_sentence: ケラーさん、ちょっといいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what's going on?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、どうしましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Do you happen to know if the sales manager position has been filled?
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業部マネージャーのポジションはもう決まったか知ってますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: No, not yet.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: The application deadline is next Thursday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の火曜日が願書提出の締め切りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: We actually have received quite a few already.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はもう結構な数の申し込みがあるんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: A friend of mine is also interested in applying.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の友人も応募したいらしいんです。

conversation.en_sentence: She is currently working at company L.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今L社に勤務しています。

conversation.en_sentence: And her sales records are second to none.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の売上記録は素晴らしいものです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds like she is going to be a great candidate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有望な候補者になりそうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: She has a great work ethic and she is very personable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はしっかりした労働観を持っているし、とても人当たりも良いです。

conversation.en_sentence: You would love her instantly.
conversation.ja_sentence: 直ぐに彼女の事を気に入ると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: Well, the decision isn't all up to me.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも私だけで決断できませんから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: You know new employees are recruited through the Human Resources.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新入社員は人事部を通して雇われるのは知っていますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I am aware of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、知っています。

conversation.en_sentence: I just wanted to put a bug in your ear about her.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ彼女の事を伝えておきたくて。

conversation.en_sentence: She would be a great asset to this company.
conversation.ja_sentence: この会社で貴重な存在になると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: I will keep it in mind.
conversation.ja_sentence: 覚えておきますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: But I can't have any preference.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもひいきはできません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: I need to keep my mind open for other candidates too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の応募者にもしっかり目を向けないといけませんからね。

conversation.en_sentence: I completely understand that.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかっています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: But I would love to interview her.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも面接はしてみたいですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure she turns her application in on time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女がちゃんと締め切り前に願書を提出する様にして下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Can she mail her resume and cover letter?
conversation.ja_sentence: 履歴書とカバーレターを送付して大丈夫ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: We only accept online applications.
conversation.ja_sentence: オンライン提出の願書のみ受け付けます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: Everything should be turned in strictly online.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要書類全てはオンラインで提出するように。

conversation.en_sentence: Things have obviously changed since I applied here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が応募した時から随分変わりましたね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: Many companies have gone paperless nowadays.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今は多くの会社がペーパーレスになりましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can my name be put down as one of her references?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の名前を紹介者として載せても良いですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: I don't see why not.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェームス ケラー
conversation.en_sentence: I am sure you could give a great recommendation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君なら素晴らしい推薦書を出してあげられるでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for all the information.
conversation.ja_sentence: 色々教えて下さって有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I will relay this message to her.
conversation.ja_sentence: この事を彼女に伝えておきますね。

title: Discussing how to reduce order mix-ups

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, let's get started.
conversation.ja_sentence: では始めましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: It has come to my attention that our customer satisfactory rate has gone down a bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の顧客満足度が下がっている事に気づきました。

conversation.en_sentence: I have noticed it too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も気づいていました。

conversation.en_sentence: It looks like our shipping department has had quite a few order mix-ups in the last few months.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやらここ数か月、配送部がオーダー間違いをよくしている様です。

conversation.en_sentence: I am sincerely sorry about that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything different that happened in the last few months?
conversation.ja_sentence: ここ数か月の間に何か変化があったのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes there are a couple of things I can think of.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、思い当たる事が幾つかあります。

conversation.en_sentence: First of all, we are so short-handed.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず、人手不足です。

conversation.en_sentence: Our sales has gone up by 65 percent thanks to the popular vlogger introduced our online store in one of her videos.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、もうフルタイムのスタッフは4人いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: 4 staff were enough before our sales suddenly went up two months ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2か月前に突然販売数が増える前までは4人で充分でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Our sales has gone up by 65% thanks to the popular vlogger introduced our online store in one of her videos.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもあの有名なブロガーがビデオでうちの会社を紹介して以来、６５%も販売数が増えましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We are so thankful for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に有難い事ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: But order mix-ups will bring down our sales eventually.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、オーダー間違いをしていると結局販売数は落ちる事になります。

conversation.en_sentence: I am not asking for another full-time staff.
conversation.ja_sentence: フルタイム従業員を一人増やしてと頼んでいる訳ではないです。

conversation.en_sentence: One part-time staff will take some of the burden off our existing staff.
conversation.ja_sentence: パートを一人増やすだけで、今いるスタッフの負担が少し減ります。

conversation.en_sentence: We are always pressured to handle and ship orders as fast as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 早急にオーダー対応し発送しないとというプレッシャーが常にあります。

conversation.en_sentence: We double check everything upon shipping.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発送の際には全てを二度チェックしています。

conversation.en_sentence: But handling a large amount of orders can be a bit overwhelming at time.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、大量のオーダー対応する事に圧倒されることもあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Considering the fact we are dealing with much more orders, it's natural we need more staff working in the shipping department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 販売数が大幅に増えたことを考えると、配送部にスタッフを増やす事は当然の事ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's understandable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 理解できますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, we need labeling stickers that are more durable.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、もっと頑丈なラベルが必要です。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you mean?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういう事ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: The ones we currently use are so flimsy and they rip easily.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在使用中の物は薄っぺらで、すぐに破れてしまうんです。

conversation.en_sentence: When that happens, we have to recreate and print labels all over.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなると、また最初からラベル作成をし印刷しないといけないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: That sure is a waste of time.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは時間の無駄ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: And a waste of labels if we constantly keep recreating labels.
conversation.ja_sentence: ラベルを印刷し続けるのももったいないですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I know we are on a budget here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 予算があるのは知っています。

conversation.en_sentence: But it will save us so much time and money if we use better labels that will not rip so easily.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、すぐに破れないラベルを使う事で時間もお金も節約できるはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I can certainly work something out.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、どうにか対処してみましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: If you have any suggestions for new labels, let me know.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新しいラベルの提案があれば教えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for being understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解いただきありがとうございます。

title: 故障したテレビ製品について

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れ様、西川さん。
conversation.en_sentence: How are you, Nishikawa-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れ様です、後藤さん。
conversation.en_sentence: How are you, Goto-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ、西川さんX社のテレビ購入したって言ってたよね？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, Nishikawa-san, you said that you bought a TV by Company X, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ちょうど1年前くらいですかね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it was around 1 year ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私のは、この間保証期限が切れた1ヵ月後に欠陥が生じたんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Mine had an issue one month after the warranty expired the other day.

conversation.ja_sentence: 音量が小さくなって、何も聞こえなくなったんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: The volume is really low and I can't hear anything anymore.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、それならカスタマーサービスに連絡してみてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, if that's the case you can try calling their customer service.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私のときは、他にもそのような問題について苦情が入ってると教えてもらいました。
conversation.en_sentence: In my case, I learned that there were several complaints in regards to that issue.

conversation.ja_sentence: その後、直近で修理の予定を案内してくれましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Afterwards, they directed me to have it fixed nearby.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、保証が切れていても大丈夫なの？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, it's okay even if it's past the warranty?

conversation.ja_sentence: 恐らく、その製品に関しては柔軟な対応をしてくださるはずです。
conversation.en_sentence: I think they are flexible with their service in regards to that product.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実際、修理当日は技術者も1時間ほどで解決し、修理代も請求されませんでした。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually it only took around 1 hour for the technician to resolve it on the day of the repair and they didn't even invoice me for the repair cost.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはすばらしいね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's amazing.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: なので、是非連絡してみてください。
conversation.en_sentence: So, please try giving them a call.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、今日してみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I will do that today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 良い情報を有難う。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the good information.

title: Phone: Asking for a quote again

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Tom speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、トムですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Tom, this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: トムさん、こちらA社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you today.
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気ですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm doing okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、何とか。

conversation.en_sentence: So, I'm calling today as I wanted to follow up on the insurance quote.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今日は、保険の見積についてのフォローとしてお電話差し上げたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you sent me a draft quote but I had some questions I wanted to ask.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見積のドラフトを送ってくださっているのですが、少し質問したいことがありまして。

conversation.en_sentence: I actually sent the questions via email two weeks ago and just wanted to know if you had a look at it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は２週間前に質問をメールさせていただいたんですが、見ていただけましたでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, sorry I must have missed it.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、すっかり見落としていてすみません。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: What was the question you had?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんなご質問でしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: The draft quote included our export operations but I couldn't find anything on our import operations.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見積のドラフトには、弊社の輸出活動は入っていたのですが、輸入活動に関することが見つけられませんでした。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: What was the sales amount for your import operations?
conversation.ja_sentence: 輸入活動での売上額はいくらでしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: I sent that information when you first made the draft quote in the form you asked me to fill out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初にトムさんが見積のドラフトを作った際に私が記入しないといけなかったフォームに、その情報は書いてあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is that right.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、そうでしたね。

conversation.en_sentence: How about I send you the information again through email and you can take a look at it.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールで再度情報を送りますので、見ていただけないでしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それは助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, thank you for your time today.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、今日はお時間ありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、失礼します。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ジャレッドさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: よい一日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Was that Tom from Company B?
conversation.ja_sentence: さっきのはB社のトムさんでしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it was.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't believe he is asking me what the sales amount for our import operations is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 輸入活動の売上額はいくらだと聞いてくるなんて、信じられないですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I sent him that information a long time ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: かなり前に情報は送っていたんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think he read the file he asked me to fill out for him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼のほうが記入するように頼んできたのにファイルを見ていないと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean, if you want my business, you should at least try a bit harder.
conversation.ja_sentence: まったく持って、もし一緒に仕事がしたいなら、もう少し努力してもいいんじゃないでしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He was trying to get us to switch to his insurance company right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、私たちに保険会社を変えさせようとしていたんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, but he's not doing a good job at it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、でも、全然ちゃんとしてないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He takes forever to reply and doesn't even read the information I give him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 返事はなかなか来ないし、こちらからの情報は見もしません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well then, maybe it's a good idea to just turn him down.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、彼の話を断るのがいいと思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I mean, our current insurance provider just gave us a decent rate reduction too.
conversation.ja_sentence: だって、今の保険会社の割引料金も理にかなってますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I saw that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そう思いました。

conversation.en_sentence: Tom's draft rate was higher than what we have too.
conversation.ja_sentence: トムさんのドラフト額は今手元にある額より高いですし。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I just turn Tom down then?
conversation.ja_sentence: 断ってしまっていいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that should be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、いいですよ。

title: Refund for an undelivered product

conversation.en_sentence: Company K, this is Lizzie speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: K会社リジーでございます。

conversation.en_sentence: How can I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういったご用件でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: My name is Takada Ryota.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高田良太という者です。

conversation.en_sentence: I am calling about the package that was supposed to be delivered last week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週配達予定の品についてお電話しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Here is my order number, L345123678.
conversation.ja_sentence: オーダー番号はL345123678です。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me find your order information.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様のオーダー詳細を調べますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Our record shows you purchased a folding umbrella on July 24th.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらのオーダー歴では7月24日に折り畳み傘を購入したと記載されています。

conversation.en_sentence: That is correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、あっています。

conversation.en_sentence: It also shows your package was delivered on July 27th.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして商品は7月27日に配達されたと記載されています。

conversation.en_sentence: The problem is that I never received this item.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際受け取っていない事が問題なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Today is already August 2nd.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はもう8月2日ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am sorry you have yet to receive your item.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだ受け取っておられないとの事、大変申し訳ございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you had a chance to call your local post office regarding this issue?
conversation.ja_sentence: 近くの郵便局にこの事について連絡なさりましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Of course, I have.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんしましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I was told the mail carrier left the package at my door since it did not require my signature.
conversation.ja_sentence: パッケージ受け取りに署名が必要ないので、配達員がドアの前に置いて行ったそうです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, do you think your package got stolen?
conversation.ja_sentence: まさか、盗難に遭った可能性はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I assume so.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もそう思うんです。

conversation.en_sentence: My neighbor recently got his package stolen too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は最近隣人の配達物も盗難に遭っているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは大変でしたね。

conversation.en_sentence: The local post office said they can not be held accountable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 郵便局からは責任は取れないと言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: We are more than happy to send you a replacement immediately.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、こちらから直ぐに代替品を送らせて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: I just want to get my money back.
conversation.ja_sentence: 返金してもらいたいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I am at work during the day and will not be home to receive my package.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昼間は仕事で不在なのでパッケージを受け取る事ができないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am afraid it will get stolen again.
conversation.ja_sentence: また盗まれるのは嫌なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I totally understand that.
conversation.ja_sentence: お気持ち察します。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I go ahead and request my refund over the phone?
conversation.ja_sentence: この電話口で返金リクエストしても良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am issuing a full refund to your account as we speak.
conversation.ja_sentence: 只今お客様のアカウントに全額返金をしている最中です。

conversation.en_sentence: It may take a few days for the refund to be processed depending on your bank.
conversation.ja_sentence: 銀行によっては返金が処理されるのに数日かかる事もあります。

conversation.en_sentence: If you do not see your refund in your bank account within 5 days, please contact us.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし5日経っても返金されていない場合はまた連絡して下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: Again we apologize for the disappointment.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑おかけして申し訳ありません。

conversation.en_sentence: It is not your fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらの非ではないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It is just frustrating to have your stuff stolen.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ盗難に遭う事は腹立たしいですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I work hard for my money.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一生懸命働いて稼いだお金ですからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else I can assist you with?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か他にお力になれる事はありますでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: No, you have been a great help.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、助かりましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有難うございました。

conversation.en_sentence: We currently have five containers for that shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在、その出荷分にはコンテナ５台を確保してます。

conversation.ja_sentence: 問題ないとは思いますが、念のため。

conversation.en_sentence: Please let me know when you can confirm it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確認できたら知らせてください。

conversation.en_sentence: I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll get back to you as soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: できるだけ早くご連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Hope you have a nice day.

conversation.en_sentence: Then, you'll want to fill in all of the information here, like who the appointment is with, what it's about, and where it is.

conversation.ja_sentence: 移動やお昼休みなどのために時間を空けておくのですが、それは実際にスケジュールを組む時に詳しく説明します。
conversation.en_sentence: We also leave room for things such as transportation time and lunch breaks, but I'll talk more about that when we start scheduling appointments.

conversation.ja_sentence: ここまでで質問は？

conversation.ja_sentence: ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: No.

conversation.ja_sentence: ここまではごく簡単だったと思いますが、明日実際に私と一緒に小島さんのスケジュールを組んでみましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: This part is pretty straightforward, but I'll probably have you help me with creating Ms.Kojima's schedule tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: これから小島さんからお話があるみたいですが、一緒にお仕事ができることを楽しみにしていますね！
conversation.en_sentence: I think Ms. Kojima wants to talk to you now, but I look forward to working with you!

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

title: Presentation: learning about government funding program

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for coming today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はお越し頂いてありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: とんでもないです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your interest in our new funding program.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私どもの新規の資金提供プログラムへのご興味、誠にありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Perhaps I can do a quick overview of it?
conversation.ja_sentence: よろしければこちらの概要説明を致しましょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes please.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: So the program was set up by the federal government three months ago, and is basically a grant.
conversation.ja_sentence: プログラムは三か月前に連邦政府によって設けられまして、要するに助成金です。

conversation.en_sentence: But the grant can only be used for research purposes.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし助成金は研究目的にしか使用できません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: So for research and development?
conversation.ja_sentence: では研究と開発に、ということですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.en_sentence: The funds cannot be used for commercialized technology.
conversation.ja_sentence: 資金は商品化された技術には使用できません。

conversation.en_sentence: The intended use can be to pay wages for researchers or for equipment used in the testing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 対象とされる使い道は研究者への賃金の支払い、もしくは試験に使われる機器です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: What's the maximum funding amount?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最大の助成金額はいくらですか？

conversation.en_sentence: The limit is set to two hundred thousand dollars a year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 上限は年間20万ドルに設定されています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: So just to confirm, it's a grant right?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと確認ですが、給付ですよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Not a loan.
conversation.ja_sentence: 貸し付けではなく。

conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仰る通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: You do not have to pay it back.
conversation.ja_sentence: 返済する必要はありません。

conversation.en_sentence: However, you will have to submit a bi-monthly report on your research progress.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかしながら、研究の進捗についての隔月レポートはご提出頂かなければなりません。

conversation.en_sentence: Failure to do so can result in the funds not being disbursed.
conversation.ja_sentence: それがなされない場合は助成金が支払われないことになります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Does this report have to be extensive?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのレポートは詳細でなければなりませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: No it doesn't.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、その必要はありません。

conversation.en_sentence: You just have to provide a brief summary of your progress and provide an estimated expense for the development.
conversation.ja_sentence: 進捗についての大まかな概要と、開発経費の概算をご提供頂ければ結構です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: How do you verify the expense?
conversation.ja_sentence: 経費の確認はどのようにされるのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: We will come in for an audit in the beginning to decide what your estimated expense would be.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要経費の概算がどのくらいかを決めるのに、我々も始めは監査に参加します。

conversation.en_sentence: So you don't have to worry too much about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですのでそんなにご心配なさらないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: However, if there is an unexpected cost, then you should report it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、もし予想外の経費がある場合は、ご報告頂きます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Like if we suddenly hired more researchers or need extra equipment?
conversation.ja_sentence: もし突発でさらに研究者を雇ったり、追加設備が必要な場合とかですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仰る通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: I can send you an information package later today for you to review.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご検討いただくために、資料パックを本日この後お送りできますが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I am sure I will have more questions after reading it.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、それを読めばきっともっと質問が出ると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジャッキー マレン
conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, thank you very much for your time today.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、今日はお時間ありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ。

conversation.en_sentence: Feel free to give me a call or send me an email anytime.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつでもお気軽にお電話かメールを下さいね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll look forward to working with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご一緒できるのを楽しみにしております。

title: Phone call: changing product delivery schedule

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Ken Pierce from Company A.

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス デメンスさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス デメンスさん

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス デメンスさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん

conversation.ja_speaker: クリス デメンスさん

title: 海外からの取引先家族への接待について

conversation.ja_sentence: 今度取引先の社長家族の接待をすることになったんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I have to entertain the president of a company that I deal with and his family next time.

conversation.ja_sentence: おお、頑張ってね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, good luck.

conversation.ja_sentence: 英語は大丈夫なの？
conversation.en_sentence: Is your English okay?

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、日常会話くらいなら何とかなるんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I should be okay if it's just daily conversation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 接待が大変そうな人なの？
conversation.en_sentence: Is the person going to be difficult to entertain?

conversation.ja_sentence: 物腰柔らかでいい人なんですが、やりたいことがあるらしいんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: He's not arrogant and is a nice person but it seems there are a lot of things he wants to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、無理難題言われたの？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh did he ask for something over the top?

conversation.ja_sentence: それが、日本の遺跡を発掘したいって。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, he said he wants to excavate Japanese ruins.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、何それ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, what's that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 歴史マニアみたいで、イギリスでは発掘ツアーによく行かれてるらしいんです。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems he loves history and he often goes on excavation tours in England.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、是非とも日本の遺跡を発掘したいという希望なんです。
conversation.en_sentence: And he wants to by all means excavate a Japanese ruin.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本ではあまり発掘ツアーなんて聞かないよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I haven't really heard of excavation tours in Japan.

conversation.ja_sentence: 化石の発掘ツアーならちらほら見かけるんですが、遺跡の発掘は見当たらなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: I see excavation tours for fossils here and there but nothing for ruins.

conversation.ja_sentence: 普通にお城を見学とかではダメなの？
conversation.en_sentence: Can't you just take him to see something like a castle or something?

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、出来たら希望通りに発掘させてあげたいんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, I want to let him excavate as requested if possible though.

conversation.ja_sentence: 2・3箇所の遺跡の発掘事務に当たってみたんですけどいい返事が返ってこないんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I tried contacting two or three excavation offices for ruins but didn't get a positive reply.

conversation.ja_sentence: こういうのは発掘責任者と個人的に知り合いとかだと話は早いんだけどなあ。
conversation.en_sentence: These things would be easy to setup if we knew people in charge of excavations on a personal note.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は文系だからよくわからなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: I've studied liberal arts so I don't really know.

conversation.ja_sentence: 発掘って、土木系じゃないですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Excavation isn't civil engineering right?

conversation.ja_sentence: いやあ、土木はちょっと違うでしょ。
conversation.en_sentence: No, I don't think it's civil engineering.

conversation.ja_sentence: 歴史学とか、考古学でしょ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's like history or anthropology.

conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、そりゃそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 後は地理学とか、人類文化学とかが関係しそうだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Or it could be geography or related to something like cultural anthropology.

conversation.ja_sentence: ほかにも関連しそうなキーワードどんどん言ってみてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Can you keep saying related keywords?

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、文化財保存とか？
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, like protection of cultural properties?

conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、サークルの後輩が文化財保存の実習とか言ってましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I know a junior in my club who did a practicum on protection of cultural properties.

conversation.ja_sentence: 凄く面倒で大変だけど楽しいって。
conversation.en_sentence: He said it's a real hassle and tough but fun.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、じゃあその後輩にダメもとで聞いてみたらどう？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, can you try asking him?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは、いっそのこと全社メールで聞いてみたら？
conversation.en_sentence: And maybe you should just send an email out to the entire company.

conversation.ja_sentence: 紹介出来そうな人がいたら紹介してくださいって。
conversation.en_sentence: Ask people to introduce those people to you if they know someone.

conversation.ja_sentence: いやー、全社メールは厳しいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Umm, sending it company-wide is a bit tough.

conversation.ja_sentence: まずは、大学の後輩とかゼミの先生に口を聞いて貰えるか聞いてみますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll try the club members from university of teachers from seminars to see if they know anyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、頑張ってね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, good luck.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回の取引の成功は君の肩にかかってるといっても過言じゃないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's not an understatement that the success of the coming transaction rests on your shoulders.

conversation.ja_sentence: うっ、プレッシャーかけてきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, thanks for the pressure.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも頑張ります。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll do my best.

conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイスありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the advice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の方も、関係してそうな人に声をかけてみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll talk to people who might be involved in that on my side too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですか、お願いしますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Really, thank you.

title: General chatting: Opinion of industry during lunch

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Early lunch?
conversation.ja_sentence: 早めの昼食？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I didn't eat breakfast.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、朝ごはん食べなかったんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: So did you see that email from the Tokyo office?
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京支社からのEメール見たかい？

conversation.en_sentence: The one about the labor shortage in the United States?
conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカの労働力不足について？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、それそれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think that will affect the housing starts in the United States?
conversation.ja_sentence: 国の住宅着工件数に影響すると思うかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Well I think it will to a degree.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、多かれ少なかれね。

conversation.en_sentence: But it all comes down to if employers are willing to pay more.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも結局は、雇用側が給料を上げる意思があるかどうかだと思う。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I guess money is important.
conversation.ja_sentence: お金は大事だよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course!
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん！

conversation.en_sentence: You wouldn't work here if you're making minimum wage right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最低賃金だったら、ここでは働かないだろう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはそうだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I think there are other factors involved when it comes to housing starts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 住宅着工件数に関しては、他の要因もあると思うな。

conversation.en_sentence: Labor obviously plays a role, but also the material cost and the mindset of this generation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 労働力はもちろんだけど、原料コストや今の世代の考え方なんかもね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can understand the material cost, but what do you mean by mindset?
conversation.ja_sentence: 原料コストは理解できるけど、考え方というと？

conversation.en_sentence: Well I've read reports that the younger generation are holding off on starting a family.
conversation.ja_sentence: 若い世代が家庭を持つことを躊躇しているっていう報告書を読んだんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which means?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり？

conversation.en_sentence: Which means they aren't inclined to get married and buy a house.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結婚して家を買おうと考えないわけだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically, housing starts won't grow as fast because people aren't buying a house.
conversation.ja_sentence: 住宅着工件数が思った速度で伸びないのは結局、家を買う人がいないからさ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I guess all the young people all like to travel these days.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近の若者は皆旅が好きだしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: They don't want to stay in one place.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一か所に留まりたがらない。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り。

conversation.en_sentence: They want to see the world.
conversation.ja_sentence: 世界を見てみたいんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wish I can do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕もできたらなあ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン スミスさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wonder where they get the money to do that?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのお金はどうやって稼いでるんだろう？

conversation.en_sentence: I wonder too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 気になるね。

conversation.en_sentence: If you plan to install it on a large number of computers, I would recommend the server option where you can install and manage the settings on a server.

conversation.en_sentence: There are various settings configuration so you can manage certain computers to have certain settings.

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have a price list?

conversation.ja_sentence: 定価のものでしたら、あります。
conversation.en_sentence: We have one for the retail price.

conversation.ja_sentence: お送りしましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Should I send that over?

conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、はい、お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, yes please.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社はパートナー様ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Your company is a partner company, correct?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's correct.

conversation.ja_sentence: パートナー様向け価格は若干お安くなりますので。
conversation.en_sentence: The pricing for partner companies will be a bit cheaper.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、お見積書は御社のお名前でお作りしますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will make a quotation under you company's name.

conversation.ja_sentence: インストールCDと、100ライセンスと、サーバーオプションですね。
conversation.en_sentence: So it will be the installation CD, 100 licenses and the server option.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: Eメールでお送りしますので、ご連絡先をお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will send it to you by email so please tell me your email address.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、申しあげます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

title: 資料提出

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me.

conversation.ja_sentence: 少しお時間良いでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have a moment?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、大丈夫だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, I'm okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうした。
conversation.en_sentence: What's wrong?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今朝任せて頂いていた資料なんですが、完成しましたので、確認をお願いできますか。
conversation.en_sentence: It's about the document you asked me to do this morning, and I just finished it so can you take a look?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、見てみよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, let's see.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何かございましたら今後の改善のため、ご指示いただきたく存じます。
conversation.en_sentence: It would be great if you can point things out so I can make sure I improve on it for next time.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 目を通したらまた呼ぶから。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let you know once I finish reading it.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll head back now.

title: Helping a colleague

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, are you alright?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、大丈夫ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You look a little bit agitated.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっとイライラしているみたいですけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I am running out of time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 間に合わないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: What's wrong?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I have to turn in this proposal in two hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと二時間以内にこの提案書を提出しないといけないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: This is taking much longer than I expected.
conversation.ja_sentence: 思ったより随分時間がかかってるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I am happy to help you with it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 是非手伝わせて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, I know you are busy with your work.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、あなたも自分の仕事で忙しいでしょうから。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I just got done with the monthly report.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は月次レポートはもう終了してるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't have anything else due any time soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 提出期限が迫っている物は他に何もありません。

conversation.en_sentence: But I do not want to get us in trouble.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもトラブルを起こしたくないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Why?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういう意味ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I do not want my boss to think I am incompetent.
conversation.ja_sentence: 上司に私が’仕事ができないと思われたくないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't say such a silly thing.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな風に思わないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: He always encourages us to help one another.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はいつもお互いの手助けをする事を推奨してますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Teamwork is very important.
conversation.ja_sentence: チームワークは大切です。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I guess I can use your help.
conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、手伝ってもらいましょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: I appreciate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Please tell me what I need to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、何をすればいいか教えて下さい。

title: 新人への当番の引継ぎ

conversation.ja_sentence: 工藤さん、社内サーバーのバックアップ当番の引継ぎをしたいんだけれど今時間あるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Kudo-san, I'd like to hand over the duty of backing up the company's internal servers to you, but is now a good time?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今研修中なのですが、何分くらいかかりますか？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm in the middle of training right now, how long will it take?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、30分くらいで終わる予定だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, it shouldn't take longer than 30 minutes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 菊池先輩、沢村先輩から当番の引継ぎがあるそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Kikuchi-san, Sawamura-san has a job he'd like me to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: 30分ほど時間がかかるそうですが、今から行ってきてもよろしいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: He says it will only take around 30 minutes, is it okay to go and do that now?

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった、それじゃあ研修の続きはその後にしよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, we can leave the rest of the training until later.

conversation.ja_sentence: 沢村さん、次からは事前にメールで時間を伝えておいてくれると助かるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sawamura-san, next time it would be helpful if you let me know the time in advance via email.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、急なお願いになってしまってすみません。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, I apologize for the sudden request.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ工藤さん、向こうのサーバーラックのところに来て。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay then, Kudo-san, come over to the server rack over there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、筆記用具以外に何か持っていくものはありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, do I need to bring anything other than a pen?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、作業手順書があるから特に必要は無いかな。
conversation.en_sentence: No, there's a procedure manual, so you don't really need anything else.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、手順書に沿って作業をするところを実際に見てほしい。
conversation.en_sentence: Today, I'd just like you to observe the work actually being done, in line with the procedure manual.

conversation.ja_sentence: その途中、気になるところがあればメモしてくれるくらいでいいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it'll be fine if you just take notes of anything that you think is important as we go along.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ実際に作業してみるから、作業手順書と見比べていてね。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, I will do the actual work, and you compare it with the procedure manual.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、確認する項目はかなり多いんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, there are quite a few things that need to be checked, aren't there?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、ただ、基本的にはこの手順書に従って作業をすれば問題はないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right, but, basically, if you just work following along with the procedure manual, it's easy.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、たまにここに書いてないようなエラーが出ることがある。
conversation.en_sentence: However, sometimes there will be an error that is not written in here.

conversation.ja_sentence: その時は、僕か菊池さんに確認してね。
conversation.en_sentence: When that happens, check with me or Kikuchi-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: 毎日バックアップの確認とテープの交換作業をするんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: And, you check the backup and change the tapes every day?

conversation.ja_sentence: 実際にかかる作業時間はどれくらいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How long does it actually take to do?

conversation.ja_sentence: 朝のバックアップの確認で30分と、夕方のテープ交換で15分くらいかかるかな。
conversation.en_sentence: It takes 30 minutes to check the backup in the morning and about 15 minutes to change the tapes in the evening.

conversation.ja_sentence: 慣れてくれば半分の時間で終われるようになると思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think you should be able to do it in half the time when you get used to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、その時間を頭に入れて一日の業務予定を考えないといけないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, so I have to bear that time in mind when planning my daily schedule.

conversation.ja_sentence: 沢村さんは一年間毎日この作業をしていらっしゃったんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: And so, you carried out this work every day for a year?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、昨年はこの部署に新人が入ってこなかったから二年間やっていたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: No, last year, we didn't have anyone new join the department, so I've been doing it for the past 2 years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は工藤さんが入ってくれて助かったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's such a help that you joined this year.

conversation.ja_sentence: サーバーのバックアップ当番の引継ぎは以上だね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, that's it for the handing over of the server backup duty.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何か質問はあるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any questions?

conversation.ja_sentence: 特にありません、何か思いついたらまた聞きます。
conversation.en_sentence: Not particularly, I'll ask you if I think of anything.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、ゴミ出しの当番と給湯室の掃除当番の引継ぎの時間はまたメールするね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will email you with the times for taking over the duties of cleaning the break room and taking out the trash.

conversation.ja_sentence: え？
conversation.en_sentence: Huh?

conversation.ja_sentence: 他にも当番があるんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: There are other duties as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、まだまだ他にもあるから、またその時に連絡するよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, there are plenty of others as well, but I will contact you at that time.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、はい、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, okay, thank you.

title: 忘年会の準備

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年の忘年会の参加者は全部で何人でしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: How many people were going to participate in the year-end party this year in all?

conversation.ja_sentence: 全部で30名くらいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's about thirty in total.

conversation.ja_sentence: 食材の手配はもう全部終わっているんだっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Were all the arrangements for the food finished?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お米とマグロはすでに手配済みです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we've already arranged for rice and tuna.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのほか、お酒とお惣菜はケータリングでお願いする予定です。
conversation.en_sentence: Other than that, we're planning to arrange catering for alcohol and some side dishes.

conversation.ja_sentence: そしたら、必要な準備はほとんど終わっているね。
conversation.en_sentence: So that means most of the necessary preparations are done.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは紙皿とか、紙コップとかを買いに行く予定です。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, I'm planning to go buy paper plates and paper cups.

conversation.ja_sentence: 忘年会は、何時からスタートするんだっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: What time was the year-end party scheduled to start?

conversation.ja_sentence: 19時から開始予定なので、みなさんはそれぐらいの時間から集まると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: It's supposed to start at 7pm, so I think everyone should get together around then.

title: planning a investor meeting

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: "We all make mistakes and learn from them"?
conversation.ja_sentence: 「誰でも失敗をしてそこから学ぶ」だって？

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Who is she kidding?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰に冗談言ってるんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: What did she learn?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何を学んだんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: That was a 15 million yen mistake!
conversation.ja_sentence: 1500万円の失敗だぞ！

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: On a whim to boot!
conversation.ja_sentence: 思い付きで大失敗！

conversation.en_sentence: And it's not the first time they made these mistakes.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、こういう失敗をしたのはこれが最初じゃないぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: But I'm glad you came to the board meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、君が役員会に来てくれてよかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I really understand what you were saying now.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、今ならお前が言ってたことがよく分かる。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: That is not how you run a company.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれは会社を経営するやり方じゃないだろう。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Something has to be done about management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣を何とかしないと。

conversation.en_sentence: Then would C Fund be on board with our proposal?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、Cファンドは、僕らの提案には賛成なの？

conversation.en_sentence: This is ultimately for the benefit of Company R, its research and its employees.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは最終的にはR社とその研究、従業員の利益になるんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: If we let Keiko and Sylvester stay any longer those 2 are going to bulldoze their way to destruction.
conversation.ja_sentence: 利永さんと高さんがこれ以上長くいたら、二人で破滅に向けてまっしぐらだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will discuss your proposal with Wang Feihong, but I am certain we will join you.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよな、ワン フェイホンと提案について話してみる、でも、きっと君に賛同するな。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Who else is on board?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他には誰が乗り気だ？

conversation.en_sentence: I am talking to all of the investors right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、全ての投資家と話しているところだ。

conversation.en_sentence: They are all considering joining.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らも皆、参加を考えてる。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you would want everyone on board.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、皆に参加して欲しいからな。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: But then I can't imagine anyone being on their side except themselves.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、そうしたら彼ら以外に彼らの側に立つ人がいるとは思えないけどな。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, some don't want confrontation but I think it's unavoidable.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、対立するのを嫌がる人もいるけど、それは避けられないと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: I do plan to tread on this lightly, though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、これは慎重に進めようと計画しているよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want to drag this into a lawsuit or anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: これを訴訟なんかに持ち込むのは嫌だから。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: No, no, that's bad publicity.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、それは悪評につながるから。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Let's keep it under wraps.
conversation.ja_sentence: 表沙汰にしないようにしよう。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Our ultimate goal is IPO, so I don't want any negative press about Company R.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕らの最終目標は株式公開だから、R社についての否定的な報道は望ましくない。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: So, I understand you have tapped someone for management?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、誰かを役員に指名したっていうことだけど？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, well, I've mentioned it in a roundabout way but haven't really discussed it until I know all the investors are on board.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、えっと、遠回しに話したんだけど、投資家たちが乗り気かどうか分かるまではと思ってちゃんとは議論していないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Once I talk to L Company and get confirmation from your fund, I will set up a meeting for all of us to talk about how we are going to proceed.
conversation.ja_sentence: L社と話して、君のファンドから確認をもらったら、我々全員のミーティングを設定して、どうやって進めていくか話し合うことにするよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, keep me in the loop.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった、僕も連絡網に入れておいてくれ。

conversation.ja_speaker: サイラー コルトン
conversation.en_sentence: I will get back to you on our decision but there is nothing to worry about, we got your back.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの決定についてまた返事するけど、心配するなよ、応援してるから。

title: General chatting: casual chat about recent business in the lunchroom.

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Early lunch?
conversation.ja_sentence: ランチ早くない？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I have to go out for a meeting soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ、すぐに会議にいかなくちゃいけないんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: How have you been?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてた？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: It feels like I haven't seen you in a while.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近会ってなかったような気がするよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well you're the one that's always out of the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、いつも君はオフィスにいないもんね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Right.
conversation.ja_sentence: ほんとだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I've been okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあまあだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Business is a bit slow with the holiday season coming up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連休のシーズンが始まるので、仕事はちょっとゆっくりになってきてるけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Same here.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらも同じく。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's so much harder to reach people these days by phone and email.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近電話やEメールでみんなとなかなか連絡がとれないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it's been pretty dead.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、かなり活気がなくなってるね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: How did that last transaction end up last month?
conversation.ja_sentence: 先月の取引はどうなった？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: The shipment to China?
conversation.ja_sentence: 中国への出荷のこと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that one.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well the customer in China wanted to advance the shipment by one week.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、中国の顧客が１週間出荷を早めてほしいとのことだったんだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's reasonable.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは合理的だよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: But he told me at the very last minute.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、ぎりぎりで言ってきたんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I had to scramble around to find a vessel and arrange the shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: あちこち駆けずり回って出荷してくれる便を探さなきゃならなかったんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's really nerve wrecking.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく大変だったよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョン ジョーンズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Were you able to sort everything out?
conversation.ja_sentence: すべて出荷することができたの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ライアン リーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, thankfully.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、おかげさまで。
