conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that would be wonderful.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの得意分野ですしね。
conversation.en_sentence: It is an area we're good at.

conversation.ja_sentence: そう思って、今日ご相談を。
conversation.en_sentence: That's what I thought and I called you.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的なことをお聞きして、スケジュールや予算が合うようであれば、ぜひお請けしたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: If the schedule and the budget work out after learning more about the details, I would love to take it.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、それは助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that would be good.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、近いうちに詳細の打ち合わせにお伺いしたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Then can I visit you to talk about details sometime soon?

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速ですが、来週なら時間がありますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It might be too soon, but I have time next week.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私もいけます。
conversation.en_sentence: I do, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、水曜日はどうでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Then how about Wednesday?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ、一日中空いてます。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good, I am free all day.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、水曜日の９時にお伺いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will come by at 9 on Wednesday then.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: デバイス本体もお持ちいただけますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you bring the device?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ、手に取って触ってみてください。
conversation.en_sentence: I would love you to actually touch it yourself.

conversation.ja_sentence: 資料で見てから、使ってみたいなと思っていたので楽しみです。
conversation.en_sentence: I was hoping to use it after seeing the information, so I am excited.

conversation.ja_sentence: 色違いもあるので、全色持って行きますね。
conversation.en_sentence: We have different colors, so I will bring all the colors.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、色々と見たほうがマーケティング戦略的にもいいですから、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, it is better to see more in terms of the marketing strategies, so please do.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、来週の水曜に。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, see you next Wednesday.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お待ちしております。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'll be waiting for you.

title: Product development

conversation.en_sentence: Ryan can you spare a moment?
conversation.ja_sentence: ライアンさん、お時間少しありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes Jenny, what's up?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ジェニーさん、何でしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: I just have some questions about the new material being developed by our affiliate, Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの関連会社のB社が開発中の新材料について質問があるんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh okay, go ahead.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、どうぞ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, am I correct in thinking that their development will be complete by the autumn?
conversation.ja_sentence: あのー、開発は秋までに終わると考えていいんでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, assuming they stay on schedule, and they seem to be on track.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、予定通りなら、今のところ順調に進んでいるようですし。

conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking I'd like to investigate using their material as a waterproof coating for our autumn line-up of products.
conversation.ja_sentence: 秋の商品ラインアップの防水コーティング加工に彼らの材料を使うことを検討したいと思っているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Would it be ready in time for me to be able to do that?
conversation.ja_sentence: それが出来るようなタイミングに完成するでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: In theory, yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 理屈ではそうですが。

conversation.en_sentence: The final version for mass production should be ready by the end of July, but then you would need to conduct additional tests to check its suitability, which may cause delays.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大量生産用の最終バージョンは７月末までに完了するはずですが、適性検査を数回重ねる必要があるのでそれで遅れる可能性はあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Well we can't delay getting the autumn products to market, is there another material I could use?
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、秋商品を市場に出すのを遅らせることはできないので、他に使える材料はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we work with some similar materials from other manufacturers, but they might be cost prohibitive for use as a coating.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちでは他のメーカーの似た材料を使っているので、あるにはありますけど、コーティング用として使うにはコストがかかり過ぎるかも知れません。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you think would be the best alternative if I can't use Company B's material?
conversation.ja_sentence: B社の材料が使えないとなれば、他にいい選択肢はあると思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Um, I don't have the information to hand, but I could email you some potential options when I get back to my computer.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、今手元にはないけれど、後で自分のコンピュータに戻ってから幾つか考えられる選択肢についてメールしますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks, that would be really helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、助かります。

title: Face-to-face Conversation: Meeting people at a trade show 1

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi there I'm Bruce Nakajima.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもこんにちは、私は、ブルース 中島です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi I'm Jason Geller.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、私は、ジェーソン ゲラーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: How are you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm good thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here's my business card.
conversation.ja_sentence: これ、私の名刺です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, here's mine.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、これが私のです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So Mr. Nakajima, what does your company do?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、中島さんの会社はどのような事をなさっているのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: We are a Japanese trading company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちは、日本の商社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: So an easy definition I'd like to give is a company that does commodity trading and project investments in various industries.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、簡単に言いますと、様々な業界で商品取引や、プロジェクトに投資をする会社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, what kind of industries are you guys in?
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、あなた方はどのような事業を行なっているんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, anything from machinery, mining, textiles, chemicals, and more.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、機械から鉱業、織物、化学薬品まで色々です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: You name it, and we are probably involved in it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か名前を挙げていただければ、それに我々が関わっているかと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはすごいですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So where are you based out of?
conversation.ja_sentence: それであなたはどこを拠点にしているのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I am from the Seattle office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はシアトルオフィスにいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: But I am originally from our Tokyo office.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、元は東京オフィスにいました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I am currently on assignment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今はここで仕事をしているんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: How long do you get to stay?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらい滞在する事になるんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Typically five years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 通常、5年です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm in my second year now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、私の2年目です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: What does your office do?
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの支社では何をしているんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Given that we are in Seattle, we work with aircraft manufacturers and software companies.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちがシアトルにいることもあり航空機メーカーとソフトウェア会社と仕事をしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: We also export commodities like wood products.
conversation.ja_sentence: また木製品等の商品を輸出したりもしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: But now we are looking at investing in startup companies.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが現在、現在スタートアップ企業への投資を検討しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても興味深いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, maybe I should explain what my company does.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、私の会社の事業についてもご説明すべきですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: We're an engineering company that helps startups commercialize their technology.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社はスタートアップ企業が技術を商業化するのを助ける技術設計会社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: A lot of startups have great ideas but don't have the technical capability to actually bring their ideas to life.
conversation.ja_sentence: 沢山のスタートアップの会社はとても良いアイデアは持っていますが、実際にそのアイデアを実現するための技術的な能力を持っていません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So they can outsource their engineering and manufacturing to us.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、彼らは弊社に技術設計と製造を外注することができます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh that's very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、とても面白いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe we can work together in the future or something.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしかしたら一緒に働ける時が来るかもしれないですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you never know right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、分からないものですよね！

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll let you know if any opportunity comes up!
conversation.ja_sentence: 機会があればご連絡いたしますね！

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, same here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it's a pleasure meeting you.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、お会いできて光栄でした。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: It was nice meeting you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ、お会いできて良かったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hope you enjoy the rest of the trade show.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残りのトレードショーでの時間を、楽しんでくださいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: You too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらこそ。

title: 新入社員の部署選択理由

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、じゃあ、ここで休憩をしましょう！
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, well, we'll take a break here!

conversation.ja_sentence: え、まだ全部終わってないですけど...
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, we haven't finished everything yet, though.

conversation.ja_sentence: たまにリフレッシュしないと頭パンクしちゃうから。
conversation.en_sentence: Your head's going to explode if you don't refresh once in a while.

conversation.ja_sentence: まだ配属１週間目で、新しい事ばかりやると結構疲れるでしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: It's only your first week here, and doing a bunch of new stuff makes you pretty tired, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、そんな事...
conversation.en_sentence: No, that's....

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、休憩とるのも効率良く働くコツなんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, taking a break is a tip for working smart, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、効率悪くて、すみません！
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I'm sorry, I work inefficiently!

conversation.ja_sentence: 佐々さん、そうじゃなくて、えっと、ちょっとコーヒー買いに自販機行くけど一緒に行く？
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't mean that, Megumu, umm, I'm going to go get coffee at the vending machine, want to join me?

conversation.ja_sentence: え、あの...
conversation.en_sentence: Well, um....

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、強制とかじゃないから、10分休憩にしよう、ね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I'm not forcing you or anything, let's take a 10-minute break, alright?

conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、ご一緒させていただきます！
conversation.en_sentence: Um, I'm coming with you!

conversation.ja_sentence: 何がいい？
conversation.en_sentence: What would you like to have?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、自分で。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I'll get one myself.

conversation.ja_sentence: なら、ちょこっと就職祝いって事でどう？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, let's say it's a little gift to celebrate your new job, how's that?

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、ありがとうございます、一番右のココアでお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, thank you, I'll have that hot chocolate on the far right, please.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、なんか甘いの頭に必要だよねー、はいどうぞ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you need something sweet for your brain, here you go.

conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、佐々さんは英語話すんでしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: By the way, you speak English, right, Megumu?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、15で日本に来るまで海外で育ったので。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I grew up abroad until I came to Japan when I was 15.

conversation.ja_sentence: おお、じゃあ結構ペラペラじゃない？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, then you can speak quite fluently, can't you?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、まあ、一般的な会話なら。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I guess, if it's general conversation.

conversation.ja_sentence: あのさ、なんで人事選んだか聞いてもいいかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Hey, can I ask you why you've chosen HR?

conversation.ja_sentence: ウチ内勤翻訳とか海外知財扱う部署もあるし、営業部も海外力入れてるよね？
conversation.en_sentence: We have in-house translators, a department that deals with international IP, and the Sales department is focusing on overseas markets as well, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: えーっとですね、実は初め営業枠で採用されたんですよ、私。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, actually I was hired to be assigned to Sales first.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと面接の時、翻訳か知財についても興味ないか聞かれました。
conversation.en_sentence: And at the interview, I was also asked if I was interested in translation or intellectual property.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも人と関わるのが好きなんで、知財の申請とかするのはちょっとつまらなそうだったし。
conversation.en_sentence: But I like dealing with people, so making applications for intellectual property sounded kind of boring.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、翻訳に関しては、AI翻訳が進化してるから近い将来無くなるかもって。
conversation.en_sentence: As for translation, I thought it might go out of use in the near future because of evolving AI translation.

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、それ絶対ウチの部の外で言わない方がいいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmmm, you shouldn't say that outside of our division, alright?

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、それじゃやっぱり営業の方が良かったんじゃない？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, then it still sounds like you'd be better off if you worked at Sales, though?

conversation.ja_sentence: 実はこの会社の製品、海外に居た頃から好きで。
conversation.en_sentence: I actually liked the product of this company even when I lived abroad.

conversation.ja_sentence: こんなにいい物、もっとみんなに知ってもらえればいいのにって。
conversation.en_sentence: I've been thinking that these products are so nice and they should be known more widely.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、どうして人事に来ちゃったの？
conversation.en_sentence: Why did you end up coming to HR, then?

conversation.ja_sentence: 合同研修で最高にかっこいい人事トレーナーに出会って、すぐ人事へ配属してもらえるようお願いしたんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I've met a super cool trainer at the joint training, and I asked right away to be assigned to HR!

conversation.ja_sentence: その人の本物のプロって感じに憧れて、私もこういう風になりたいって強い気持ちが！
conversation.en_sentence: I admire the way the person being really professional, and I got this strong feeling that I want to become just like her!

conversation.ja_sentence: 研修ん時の人事トレーナーって、確か...
conversation.en_sentence: I believe that a trainer from the HR for that training was....

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の人生設計１日で変える程、人事ってそんなに人に関る仕事なんだって知らなくて！
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't know that HR was such a people job that could change my life plan in one day!

conversation.ja_sentence: 津村真冬課長の下で働くと決心したんですっ！
conversation.en_sentence: I've made up my mind to work for Ms. Mafuyu Tsumura!

conversation.ja_sentence: ああー、かっこいいし美人だけど、厳しい人よー。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, she's cool and good looking, but quite strict, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: 容姿に関するコメントはセクハラですよ、戸倉さん！
conversation.en_sentence: Commenting on a coworker's appearance is sexual harassment, Tadashi!

conversation.ja_sentence: 研修で津村課長に教えていただきましたっ！
conversation.en_sentence: Mafuyu taught us so at the training!

conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、現場研修でも課長が君の教育係やれば、みんなハッピーだったのにってマジで思うわ...
conversation.en_sentence: Whoa, I seriously think everyone was happier if she was your on-the-job trainer, too....

title: 産学コラボ研究について

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はこちらまでわざわざありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for coming here today.

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、研究室の様子を実際に見られてよかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: My pleasure, it was good to actually see the lab.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今まで、ホームページやビデオで見るだけでしたから。
conversation.en_sentence: I have only seen it on the website or videos.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: やはり実際に私たちのやっている研究を見ていただくのが一番です。
conversation.en_sentence: After all, nothing is better than you actually seeing what we do in person.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree.

conversation.ja_sentence: どれだけ素晴らしいプレゼンや資料でも、細かいところまで見せるのは難しいですもんね。
conversation.en_sentence: No matter how great a presentation or document is, it is impossible to show absolutely everything.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I know.

conversation.ja_sentence: 研究者たちの性格や働き方も実際に見ていただきたかったんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I really wanted you to see our researchers' personalities and how they work.

conversation.ja_sentence: そういうのは、なかなか文書にはできなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: We can't really put that in writing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに、研究室は機材や装置だけで価値が決まるわけじゃないですから。
conversation.en_sentence: As you know, it is not just machines and systems that increase the value of a laboratory.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実際、私たちがそちらの研究室に興味を持ったのも、大学全体が、新しいものに対して積極的な姿勢があったからなんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: To be honest, we were interested in your lab becasue your university as a whole was very open to try out new things.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の大学でも同じようなレベルの施設が整った研究室はあったんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: There were other university labs with the facilities that were the similar level as yours.

conversation.ja_sentence: そう言っていただけると光栄です。
conversation.en_sentence: Glad to hear that.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちは、装置や機材に誇りがあるのはもちろんですが、人材に大きな誇りを持っていますからね。
conversation.en_sentence: Not only are we proud of our machines and systems but also we are proud of our people.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんの結束も高いですね。
conversation.en_sentence: The bond among members seems strong.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、仲は良いほうじゃないでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, they all seem to get along.

conversation.ja_sentence: コミュニケーションは重視してますから。
conversation.en_sentence: We take communication very seriously.

conversation.ja_sentence: たとえ、一人での作業が多いプロジェクトにおいても、全員で集まる機会をなるべく作るようにしています。
conversation.en_sentence: We try to make time for everyone to get together as much as possible even on a project where people mostly work individually.

conversation.ja_sentence: 特に、この分野での研究となると、意見交換は大切ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Exchanging ideas is particularly important for researchers in this field.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's so true.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一つのことだけに囚われていると、周りの進歩に遅れてしまいますから。
conversation.en_sentence: If you focus on one thing too much, you will be left behind from the progress around you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 思い込みで研究を進めないようにしてありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: You are making sure that your research won't go to a wrong direction.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Trying.

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算も限られており、無駄な作業はなるべく減らしたいので。
conversation.en_sentence: Our budget is limited, so we'd like to reduce any work that could be a waste.

conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社のほうで、承認プロセスに時間がかかってしまい、研究室訪問が今日になってしまいましたけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Our company's approval process took really long, so I couldn't have come here until today.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、ここまで時間がかかった分、今後は承認までの時間も短くなりますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It took such a long time up to this point, but we will be able to get approvals in a much shorter time from now on.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは研究をする側としては助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: It will be helpful for us as researchers.

conversation.ja_sentence: M社さんのほうからエンジニアさんも数人いらっしゃるんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: A couple of engineers from M Company will be coming here too, correct?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、3名です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, three engineers.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、大きなプロジェクト締め切りを抱えていて来れなかったのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: They couldn't be here because of the deadline for a large project.

conversation.ja_sentence: エンジニアの皆さんにもぜひ研究室を見ていただきたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: I would love the engineers to see our lab as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、来週以降にでもぜひ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will have them visit after next week.

conversation.ja_sentence: お待ちしています。
conversation.en_sentence: Looking forward to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらの研究者たちとも、踏み込んでお話いただけるでしょうから。
conversation.en_sentence: They can have deep conversations with our researchers.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、3人とも楽しみにしていますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, they are all excited about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: いよいよコラボ研究が始まりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Our research collaboration will finally start!

conversation.ja_sentence: 時間はかかりましたが、頑張った甲斐がありました。
conversation.en_sentence: It took a long time to prep, but it was worth it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 色々と楽しみですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It'll be exciting.

title: Face-to-face conversation: Research request

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sam, can you come over for a second?
conversation.ja_sentence: サムさん、ちょっと来てもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm trying to find out the trade data for this product and what the tariff rate is.
conversation.ja_sentence: この商品に関する貿易データと関税率を探しているところなんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can give me a hand?
conversation.ja_sentence: 手伝ってもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I can do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、出来ますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: For the trade data, can you tell me which country you're looking for?
conversation.ja_sentence: 貿易データですが、どの国について検索しているか教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm looking for the export data from the US to the top ten export destination.
conversation.ja_sentence: 米国から輸出先上位10か国への輸出データを探しています。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, that shouldn't be too hard.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、そんなに難しくないと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can pull that data from the government database.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府データベースからデータを見つけられます。

conversation.en_sentence: I just need to reformat the data in Excel and make it into a pivot table.
conversation.ja_sentence: データをExcel用に再フォーマットし、ピボットテーブルにしないといけないだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: How far back should I go?
conversation.ja_sentence: どれくらい前まで遡りますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Past five years?
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去5年間ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Ten years would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 10年間分がいいですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But let me know if you can't find it.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、見つけられないなら言ってください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Worst case scenario, five years should suffice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最悪でも5年間あれば十分なはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: As for the tariff rate, I think it was tariff-free.
conversation.ja_sentence: 関税率については、無税だったと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll double check the tariff schedule online.
conversation.ja_sentence: オンラインの関税表で再確認します。

conversation.en_sentence: I can find out pretty quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに見つけられますから。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you need this by today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日中にいりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes I do.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can hold off on your other tasks and focus on this one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の業務は後回しにして、これに集中してもらえばいいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll get started right away.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今すぐ始めますね。

title: Meeting: Ask for an introduction to another company

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサムと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you doing today Mr. King.
conversation.ja_sentence: キングさん、お元気でいらっしゃいますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm doing pretty good.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まあまあ。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: How's business?
conversation.ja_sentence: お仕事のほうはいかがですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's been a bit busy in the last couple weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: この２、３週間、ちょっとバタバタしていました。

conversation.en_sentence: But it's finally slowed down.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、やっと落ち着いたところです。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: So what can I help you with?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、ご用件は何でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I actually wanted to ask you if you can introduce me to a company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は私をある会社にご紹介いただきたいのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh?
conversation.ja_sentence: ほお。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which one?
conversation.ja_sentence: どちらでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: It's Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: B社になります。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、B社ですか。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can introduce me to them?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らにご紹介いただけますでしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I actually know the owner.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、実際オーナーと知り合いですからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: We play golf together every now and then.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時々一緒にゴルフをするんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I'm playing golf with him this weekend.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実を言うと、この週末も彼とゴルフの予定です。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about I talk to him and I'll introduce you guys through email.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私から彼に話して、メールを介して互いを引き合わせるというのはどうでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll look forward to hearing from you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご連絡お待ちしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、失礼します。

conversation.ja_speaker: カイル キングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: またお話しましょう。

title: 旅客情報共有

conversation.ja_sentence: 伊藤様と山田様はお連れ様みたい。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems Mr. Ito and Mr. Yamada are colleagues.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは気が付きませんでした。
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't notice that.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、伊藤様の方が役職が上みたい。
conversation.en_sentence: And it seems Mr. Ito is the higher ranked executive.

conversation.ja_sentence: サービスをする時は伊藤様を優先した方がいいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: We should probably prioritize serving Mr. Ito then.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: その事を皆で共有した方がいいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Should I share this with everyone else too?

conversation.ja_sentence: 念の為伝えておきましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes we should share this with them just in case.

conversation.ja_sentence: では後ほど伝えておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will let them know later.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

title: 秘書が伝言を受ける

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大谷のオフィスでございます。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Otani's office, how can I help?

conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はT社の松本と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Matsumoto from company T.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大谷さまはいらっしゃいますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I speak to Ms.Otani?

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ございませんが、大谷はただいま外出しております。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry, Otani is out of the office right now.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご伝言を承ってもよろしいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I take a message for her?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、よろしくお願いいたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be great.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ、大谷さまのご予定を確認してもいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, can I ask you about her schedule?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の会議の日程を確認したいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to confirm the date for our meeting next week.

conversation.ja_sentence: 26日で確定でよろしいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is the 26th still ok?

conversation.ja_sentence: スケジュールを確認いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check her schedule.

conversation.ja_sentence: 少々お待ちくださいませ。
conversation.en_sentence: One moment please.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、26日午前11時から、2番の会議室をお取りしております。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we have booked our conference room number 2 on the 26th, 11 a.m.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Perfect.

conversation.ja_sentence: その日程で伺います。
conversation.en_sentence: I will be there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 用件ですが、大谷さまに折り返しお電話いただけるようお伝えいただけますでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: So, could you ask Ms.Otani to call me back?

conversation.ja_sentence: 支払いスケジュールに関してご意見を伺いたいのですが、数日お返事をいただけておりません。
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to hear her opinion about the payment schedule but haven't heard back from her for a few days.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知いたしました。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: 遅くなり申し訳ございません。
conversation.en_sentence: We apologize for the wait.

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し伝えます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will let her know.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!

conversation.ja_sentence: お電話ありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your call.

conversation.ja_sentence: よい一日を！
conversation.en_sentence: Have a nice day.

conversation.ja_sentence: そちらもよい一日を！
conversation.en_sentence: You too!

title: Face-to-face conversation: Asking about Company A

conversation.en_sentence: Have you heard of Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社って聞いたことありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I've met their management team last summer.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、去年の夏に経営陣に会ったことがあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I met them at a seminar hosted by the government.
conversation.ja_sentence: 政府主催のセミナーで会ったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: What did you think of them?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな感じでした？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Their technology is interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の技術は興味深いよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But when I visited their demonstration facility, I wasn't sure if they were legitimate.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、デモ施設に行ったら、これ合法じゃないかもって思った。

conversation.en_sentence: How so?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういうところが？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The facility was very dirty and they had trouble starting it up when they wanted to show me how it works.
conversation.ja_sentence: 場所はなんか小汚いし、どう作動するのか見せてくれようとしたけど、トラブってた。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So why did you ask about Company A?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてA社のことを？

conversation.en_sentence: They contacted me last week for a meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週、ミーティングしないかってあちらさんから連絡が来たんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wouldn't bother with them if I were you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕だったら行かないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Their president was very inarticulate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長はなんだか歯切れが悪いし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He kept avoiding my questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の質問をうまくはぐらかしてたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You mean Mr. Jim Lackey?
conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、ジム・ラッキーさんのことですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Jim Lackey?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジム・ラッキー？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The president was a guy called Mike Moss.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長はマイク・モスという人だったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe the management changed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣が変わったのかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me check their website real quick.
conversation.ja_sentence: ホームページでチェックしてみよう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, it seems their entire management team changed.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、経営陣が根こそぎ変わっている。

conversation.en_sentence: When did that happen?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ変わったんでしょう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: According to the website, the change happened two months ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: ホームページによると、２ヶ月前に刷新だって。

conversation.en_sentence: That's pretty recent.
conversation.ja_sentence: ついこないだじゃないか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I guess they realized the existing management had issues.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今までの経営陣には問題があるってことに気づいたんじゃないかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Their idea was good, but their execution was subpar.
conversation.ja_sentence: アイディアは良かったど、執行能力は標準以下だったね。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe it's worth talking to them now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今なら、話をしてみる価値があるかもしれませんね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I think it would be good.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、いいかも。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think I can join you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も参加してもいいかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Sure why not.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

title: Training: How to send a document

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Elaine, can I ask you something?
conversation.ja_sentence: エレイン、ちょっと聞いてもいいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、何でしょう？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm trying to send the original hard copies of this shipping document to my customer in China.
conversation.ja_sentence: この船積書類のハードコピー原本を中国の客先に送ろうとしているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you usually use Company A or Company B but which one should I use?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも、A社かB社を使っているみたいですが、どちらがいいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I would use Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社を使うかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Their rates has been cheaper lately.
conversation.ja_sentence: あそこ、最近、料金安くなってるから。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is it your first time sending something?
conversation.ja_sentence: 送るの始めてなの？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうなんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, I'll show you how to do it then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、送り方を教えてあげます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: So first you will need to log-in to Company A's website.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、まずA社のホームページにログインします。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: This is our account ID and password.
conversation.ja_sentence: これが、うちのアカウントIDとパスワードです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Write it down somewhere.
conversation.ja_sentence: どこかに書いておいて。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: So once you've logged in, click this create shipment tab.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、ログインしたら、新規送付タブをクリックします。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will then fill out the sender and recipient information.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから送り主と送付先の詳細を記入します。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Make sure to save the information in the address book so you can pull it out quicker next time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次回もすぐに使えるように、詳細はアドレスブックに忘れずに保存してください。

conversation.en_sentence: So I don't have to enter everything manually every time right?
conversation.ja_sentence: そうすれば、毎回入力しなくてもいいんですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's right!
conversation.ja_sentence: そういうこと！

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: After that's done, all you have to do is click send shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが済んだら、送付ボタンを押すだけ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Then print out the waybill which will be placed on the envelope.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうすると送り状が印刷されてくるから、封筒に貼ればいいのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Where is the envelope?
conversation.ja_sentence: 封筒はどこにありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's in the drawers near the administration department.
conversation.ja_sentence: 総務部近くの引き出しに入ってます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Want me to show you where it is?
conversation.ja_sentence: 連れて行ってあげましょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh it's okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll figure it out on my own.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で探しますんで。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much for your help!
conversation.ja_sentence: ご丁寧にありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me know if you have any questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: わからないことがあったら聞いて。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります！

title: Phone: Sign request

conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Sam.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、サムです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh hi Sam.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、あっ、サムか。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you busy right now?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今お忙しいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I know you're out with a customer right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: この時間、お客さんと出先なのは知ってます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I am actually with the president of Company A right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、実は今、A社の社長と一緒なんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What do you need?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうした？

conversation.en_sentence: I need you to e-sign an invoice so we can process it today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日処理できるよう、請求書に電子署名をしてほしいんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is it urgent?
conversation.ja_sentence: それ、急ぎ？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We need to process the payment today to pay it by the deadline.
conversation.ja_sentence: 期限までに支払うために今日支払処理しないといけないんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Why didn't you tell me earlier?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして、もっと前に言わなかったんだ？

conversation.en_sentence: We actually didn't get the invoice until just today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書がやっと今日来たんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I've been pushing them to send us the invoice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書を送るようずっとプッシュしてたんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Send it to me now and I'll sign it when I get a chance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、送ってといてくれ、チャンスがあったらサインするよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I should have some time to sign it in two hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２時間以内に署名する時間がとれると思う。

conversation.en_sentence: Sorry about the rush request.
conversation.ja_sentence: 急なお願いですみません。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll send it over now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、そちらに送ります。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、これで。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ。

title: Phone call: customer complaint

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Rachel from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のレイチェルと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi Rachel, how have you been.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、レイチェル、元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I need to talk to you about the last shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 前回の出荷の件でお話ししたいのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what's wrong?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです、何かありましたか？

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: My customer contacted me yesterday and said there were some damages to the product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日、お客様から連絡があり、商品にいくつか傷みがあったそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: What kind of damage?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな傷みですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There were dents on the edges.
conversation.ja_sentence: 角がつぶれていたそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The dents prevents them from being able to process it at their facility.
conversation.ja_sentence: 潰れていると、客先の設備では処理されなくなるそうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: It might have been damaged when it was loaded in the container.
conversation.ja_sentence: コンテナに積まれたときに凹んだのかもしれませんね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you ask them to send pictures of the damage?
conversation.ja_sentence: 凹みの写真を送るように頼んでいただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I have the pictures already so I'll send them right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 写真はすでにこちらにありますので、今、お送りします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it seems the damage likely occurred when it was being loaded on our side.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、これは、当社で積み込まれたときに凹んだようですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So what can you do for me?
conversation.ja_sentence: どう対処していただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about I issue you a credit note that you can use for the next shipment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次の出荷で使えるバウチャーを発行するというではいかがでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be very helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それは助かります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Apologies for the inconvenience.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑をおかけいたしました。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please ask your loading staff to be more careful for next time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次回はもっと気をつけるように、運送担当に伝えてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will have a talk with them later this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週中にスタッフと話をします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure it was an irregular incident.
conversation.ja_sentence: 毎回起きるというわけではないので。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: But I will remind them to be more diligent.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、もっとしっかりするように注意しておきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can I help you with anything else?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他には何かありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: No, I think I'm good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、ないと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your time today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、お時間をありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ケン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Talk to you soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、また。

conversation.ja_speaker: レイチェル サンプソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します。

title: Meeting: Preparing for audit (internal)

conversation.en_sentence: So we will have Cheryl from Company A conduct an audit from next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、来週、A社からシェリルさんが監査にいらっしゃいます。

conversation.en_sentence: She has given us a list of documents we will need to give her for the audit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女から、監査に必要な書類の一覧をいただいきました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見てみましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So it seems like it's the usual set of documents every year?
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、毎年同じ書類一式のようですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Pretty much.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: But we have to include shipment records of the new business that we started this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、今年始めた新事業の輸送記録を含まないといけません。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you get Elaine to prepare these documents?
conversation.ja_sentence: エレインさんにその書類を準備してもらってください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What time period do you need these for?
conversation.ja_sentence: それはどのくらいの期間分必要ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: We'll need it until October 2018.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2018年10月までの分が必要です。

conversation.en_sentence: We just started this business in March 2018 so from March 2018 to October 2018.
conversation.ja_sentence: この事業は2018年3月に始めたばかりなので、2018年3月から2018年10月までということになりますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, I'll have Elaine prepare this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、エレインさんに準備してもらいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else we need?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に何か必要ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: We need to conduct an internal review if anything has changed since last year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 去年から変わったことがないかどうか社内で見直す必要があります。

conversation.en_sentence: I think we can just use last year's document and just change the date.
conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の書類を使って、日付を変えればいいんじゃないかと思うのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that should be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、それで大丈夫でしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll print that out and have you sign it later.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、では、印刷して後であなたに署名してもらいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So, seems like the audit shouldn't be too complicated this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやら今年の監査はそれほどややこしくなさそうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it shouldn't be too bad.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、大したことないでしょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: What time is Cheryl coming again?
conversation.ja_sentence: シェリルさんは何時にいらっしゃるんでしたっけ。

conversation.en_sentence: She said she will be here from 9 o'clock to 2 o'clock.
conversation.ja_sentence: ９時から２時までだとおっしゃっていましたが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you arrange lunch for her?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女とのランチを手配してくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Should we just get the usual?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつものやつを頼みましょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: From the sandwich store downstairs?
conversation.ja_sentence: 下の階のサンドイッチ屋さんからですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure that's fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Get some sandwiches, soup, and drinks.
conversation.ja_sentence: サンドイッチとスープ、飲み物を頼みましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Any preferences?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かお好みは？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Anything is fine for me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は何でもいいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask Elaine to arrange this?
conversation.ja_sentence: エレインさんに用意してもらっていいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that's fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、いいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, I'll talk to her later about this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、じゃあ、後で彼女とこの件について話しておきます。

title: 中間研修の実施方法改正

conversation.ja_sentence: 人事部研修にご参加いただきありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for joining us for HR training.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本日の主な議題は、こちら。
conversation.en_sentence: Here is today's main topic.

conversation.ja_sentence: 人材育成・中間研修プログラムについてお話しします。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll talk about human resource development and continuous training program.

conversation.ja_sentence: 昨年末より社内環境改善プロジェクトが進行中なのはご存じかと思いますが、今月も全社で様々な取組みを行っております。
conversation.en_sentence: Since the end of last year, as you know we've been running a project to improve our work environment, and we're working on various things throughout the company this month as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: その一環として、今回はスキル自己診断アンケートを行いました。
conversation.en_sentence: As a part of the project, we conducted a skill self-assessment survey.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それ新人研修の参考にするって、若手社員にやらせたやつですよね？
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, it's the one that you had junior employees answers to use as a reference for new hire training, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、前回は入社３年前後の社員にお願いしました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we asked employees who had been with us for about three years last time.

conversation.ja_sentence: そして予想外に大きな反響が返ってまいりました。
conversation.en_sentence: There was an unexpectedly big response then.

conversation.ja_sentence: その為、今回のアンケート調査は全社員を対象に実施したものです。
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore, a questionnaire survey this time has been conducted with the entire company.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらのグラフをご覧ください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please take a look at this graph.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回の回答率はどのくらいだったんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What was the response rate this time?

conversation.ja_sentence: 全社員の半数強といったところです。
conversation.en_sentence: A little over half of the entire company.

conversation.ja_sentence: さて、「現職に必要なスキルが不足している」と感じている社員が多い事が判ります。
conversation.en_sentence: Now, as you can see, a lot of employees feel they "lack some skills necessary for the current role."

conversation.ja_sentence: この結果を受け、こちら、「人材育成プログラム」として今年度後半に向けて予算が組まれる運びとなりました。
conversation.en_sentence: On receiving the results, we are going to budget  "Human Resource Nurturing Program" for the latter half of the fiscal year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新たな人材確保が難しい中、既存社員の育成と定着率を上げる事を主な目的とします。
conversation.en_sentence: As we're facing the challenging situation in terms of securing new talents, our main goal is to nurture existing employees and increase their retention rate.

conversation.ja_sentence: このプログラムに伴い、来月からの研修は人事が一括管理する事となりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Along with the program, HR is going to be in charge of all the trainings from next month.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本日の管理職研修では、新しい研修管理システムのご紹介と承認申請方法を確認していきます。
conversation.en_sentence: In this manager training today, we'll show you our new training management system and go over application procedures for approval.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、事業企画部、但馬です。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, I'm Yu, in business planning.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中間研修は各所責任者が管理し、部の予算内で行ってきました。
conversation.en_sentence: Training for long-term employees has been under the management of each section head, and they've been held within our divisional budget.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今後は人事が全て実施するという事でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Would they all be conducted by the HR from now on?

conversation.ja_sentence: 7月からは研修費用が別予算から下りる事となります。
conversation.en_sentence: From July, you'd get training expenses from a separate budget.

conversation.ja_sentence: が、研修自体は各部署主導です。
conversation.en_sentence: But training itself is mainly conducted by each department.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、各部署で研修計画を決められるとの認識で宜しいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: So, that's each division to decide on training plans, am I right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的にはそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Basically, yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただし、今但馬さんが仰られた通り、これまで各部門主導で数々の研修を実施してきました。
conversation.en_sentence: However, as Yu just mentioned, we have had numerous trainings conducted by departments up to now.

conversation.ja_sentence: にも関わらず、自分の役割に必要なスキルに不安を感じる社員がかなり多い。
conversation.en_sentence: In spite of that, there are so many employees who do not feel confident with necessary skills in their roles.

conversation.ja_sentence: 既存の研修方法では期待された成果が出ていないという事は、我々は時間と予算を無駄に費やしてきたわけです。
conversation.en_sentence: The current training method has not given us desirable results, which means that we have spent our time and money inefficiently.

conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、人事で承認された研修のみ実施されます。
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore, only those trainings that are approved by the HR will be held.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand.

conversation.ja_sentence: また、各部署に外部から入る人材育成関連の情報は、全て一度人事に集める事とします。
conversation.en_sentence: Add to that, all the HRD-related information, which each department receives from outside, will at one time be collected by HR.

conversation.ja_sentence: 外部情報と社内研修の要望を人事で精査、集約して研修リストにします。
conversation.en_sentence: HR will examine these information and requests for in-house trainings, then put together a list of training.

conversation.ja_sentence: このリストは研修管理システムからアクセス、全社で活用できる様になります。
conversation.en_sentence: This list will be available in the training management system, so the entire company will be able to make use of it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全て社内システム上で行える、という事でしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: You mean, we'll be able to do everything on the intranet?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、申請書もシステムを通して受け付けます。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, application will be accepted through the system, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 申請は各所の責任者判断で宜しいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can we apply with a permission from a person in charge at each section?

conversation.ja_sentence: 参加者が20人を超える研修の場合は部門長の承認が必要です。
conversation.en_sentence: You will need approval by department head for trainings with over 20 participants.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、申請フローについてですが...
conversation.en_sentence: And, about the application procedures....

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません、杉岡さん。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm awfully sorry, Makoto.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先ずはこの管理システムの説明をさせてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Let me explain the management system first.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご質問はその後でも宜しいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Would it be okay if I take your questions after that?

title: 職場での服装ルールについて

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、山本さん、今お時間ありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Hello Ms. Yamamoto, do you have time to talk now?

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、人事の中村さん、ありますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, hi Ms. Nakamura, yes I do.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週から講師たちの服装についてのルールが変わりましたが、ご存知ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I think you know that we changed the dress code for instructors as of last week.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、連絡が来ていました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we got a message.

conversation.ja_sentence: 香水や匂いのきつい化粧品などは避けるように、ということですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: It is about not using perfume and cosmetics with strong smell, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: プライベートレッスンなどの場合、小さな部屋で講師と生徒が向き合うことが多いじゃないですか。
conversation.en_sentence: For example, in a private lesson, it is likely that an instructor and a student are stuck in a small room all the time.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ。
conversation.en_sentence: Uh-huh.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、数人の生徒さんから苦情が来ていました。
conversation.en_sentence: Some students have complained.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、分かる気がします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I think I understand why.

conversation.ja_sentence: グループレッスンでも、人数が多く、部屋の空気がこもることがありますし。
conversation.en_sentence: There are times the air in the room is so stuffy in a group lesson when we have so many people.

conversation.ja_sentence: 夏場も匂いはきつくなりますしね。
conversation.en_sentence: The smell can get strong in the summer, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, right.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、その件で何か問題でも？
conversation.en_sentence: So, is there any problem with this?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、外国人講師の中で、まだこのルールをちゃんと理解していない人たちが数人いるようなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it seems that some of the foreign instructors do not fully understand this rule yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: ルール変更の連絡は英語でも来ていましたよね？
conversation.en_sentence: Was the message about the rule change in English, too?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですが、英訳が間接的過ぎたのか、いまだに苦情が来ています。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but the translation must have been too indirect that we still get some complaints.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、そちらのスクールの主任講師である山本さんにお願いが。
conversation.en_sentence: So, I would like to ask you to do something as the head instructor of that school.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私のほうから、皆に言っておくと言うことでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: You mean you want me to talk to them?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、お願いできますか。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, can you?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私から話してもいいんですが、どうやら人事の人間が来て話すと警戒しがちなようで。
conversation.en_sentence: I could talk to them myself, but it looks like they get alarmed when a person from HR comes to talk to them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 同じ講師仲間から言っていただいたほうが良いかと。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought it would be better to have another instructor talk to them as their peer.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、うちは講師間の絆が強いですから。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, and we have a tight bond among instructors.

conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: I appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 外国製の化粧品には匂いの強いものも多いですから、本人は気づいていないかも知れません。
conversation.en_sentence: There are some foreign cosmetics that have strong smell, and they might not have noticed it themselves at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそれはありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: 外国の匂いというか、独特の。
conversation.en_sentence: It's something like a foreign smell, which is quite unique.

conversation.ja_sentence: 別に屋外ならいいんですが、そちらの学校は教室の窓が開けられないので。
conversation.en_sentence: It's fine if it's outside, but you can't open the windows at your school.

conversation.ja_sentence: ビルの上のほうにありますからね。
conversation.en_sentence: We're on the higher up in the building.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私の思うところでは、多分エミリーじゃないかと思うのですが、まずは全員を集めて話しておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it's Emily but first I will ask all of them to gather and address that to the group.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでも変わらないようなら、エミリーと個人的に話しますね。
conversation.en_sentence: If nothing changes, I will individually talk to Emily then.

conversation.ja_sentence: 山本さんにはいつも助けてもらってますね。
conversation.en_sentence: You're always helpful, Ms. Yamamoto.

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、これも主任講師の仕事ですから。
conversation.en_sentence: No worries, this is part of a head instructor's jobs.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I can rely on you then.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、失礼いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, talk to you later.

title: How to handle angry customers

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Gerald, do you have a minute?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえジェラルド、ちょっといい？

conversation.en_sentence: Of course Maria, what's up?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、どうしたのマリア？

conversation.en_sentence: A customer who called in early this morning kept screaming and yelling at me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今朝早く電話してきたお客様がずっと叫んだり怒鳴ったりしてるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I tried my best to help him, and even resolved the issue but he was still so angry.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく親身に対応して、問題自体はもう解決したんだけど、まだ怒ってるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What did he say exactly?
conversation.ja_sentence: なんて言ってるの？

conversation.en_sentence: He said "I want my money back, and I want it now"!
conversation.ja_sentence: 「今すぐ返金しろ」って言ってるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then he said "I'm sick and tired of all of your mistakes, and I'm telling everybody I know how bad you really are"!
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの手違いが多すぎてうんざりだから、どれだけうちの会社が酷いかみんなに言いふらすって。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe I'm not a good fit for customer service.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私カスタマーサービスに向いてないかも。

conversation.en_sentence: That's not true Maria.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんなことないよ、マリア。

conversation.en_sentence: You help a lot of people everyday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は毎日沢山の人を助けてるじゃないか。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't let this guy ruin your day.
conversation.ja_sentence: そいつに負けちゃダメだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We all get irate customers from time to time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 怒りまくってる客に当たることは誰にでもたまにあることだからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Irate, rude, unhappy and sometimes abrasive customers can drain you emotionally.
conversation.ja_sentence: 怒ってたり、失礼だったり、不幸だったり、傲慢だったりする客の相手は精神的に消耗するよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How should I handle them?
conversation.ja_sentence: どう対応したらいいのかしら。

conversation.en_sentence: Ask them to explain their experience and rate how much they felt each emotion along the way.
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな事があって、それぞれどんなふうにその時感じたのかひとつひとつ説明するようにお願いして。

conversation.en_sentence: To help calm them, you might say, “That sounds frustrating".
conversation.ja_sentence: 「それはイライラしますよね」とか言って相手を落ち着かせるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: When customers realize that their emotions are heard, they should start to become rational again.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の気持ちを理解してくれたと分かれば、お客は理性を取り戻すからね。

conversation.en_sentence: That’s when they’re more likely to share the facts and not just their feelings.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうすればその後は感情的にならずに事実について話し始めるから。

conversation.en_sentence: I see, so I should get them to share their story and empathize with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、じゃあ話をしてもらって、共感してあげればいいわけね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, also customers will more likely share their story in a realistic, rational way if they know they’re being written down.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうそう、後はね、記録をとっているとわかるともっと現実的かつ理性的に話してくれるようになるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: So, it's a good idea to take notes.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、じゃあメモをとったほうがいいのね。

conversation.en_sentence: It allows service professionals to keep a solid account of what the customers share, and it reminds customers to slow down and get their facts straight.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうすれば、こちらもお客様が話したことをきちんと記録しておけるし、彼らも落ち着いて事実をきちんと話してくれるからさ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's brilliant Gerald!
conversation.ja_sentence: それは賢いわね、ジェラルド！

conversation.en_sentence: Another thing to keep in mind is that it's never personal.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう一つ覚えておかなきゃいけないのは、個人的に受け取らないこと。

conversation.en_sentence: The customers don’t even know you.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様は君のことなんて知らないんだからさ。

conversation.en_sentence: Your job as a representative involves taking responsibility and taking the blame for something you probably didn’t do.
conversation.ja_sentence: カスタマーサービスの仕事は自分がやったことじゃないことに責任を負うことがほとんどなんだから。

conversation.en_sentence: When you answer the phone or greet a customer in person, you are the company to that person.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君が電話を取ってお客様に挨拶する時は、君はその人に取って会社の代表なんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Accept the responsibility of the situation.
conversation.ja_sentence: その状況に対しての責任を受け入れるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Be very willing to help, because if the customer senses an insincere apology or a ho-hum attitude that will make the customer stay angry.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく誠意を持って対応するんだ、適当に謝ってるとか、面倒くさがっている態度なんかに気づいたらお客は怒りっぱなしだから。

conversation.en_sentence: Most customers want sympathy or empathy almost as much as they want the problem fixed.
conversation.ja_sentence: ほとんどの客は問題解決と同じくらいに、同情されたり共感してもらうことを望んでいるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: It’s disturbing and frustrating to tell your complaint to someone who obviously doesn’t care.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明らかに何も気にしていない相手に苦情を伝えるのはイライラするし、気分が悪い事だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: You're absolutely right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am representing the company, and I need to accept responsibility.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は会社の代表として、その責任を受け入れなきゃね。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you do though when people start cussing at you?
conversation.ja_sentence: でももし誰かが罵声を浴びせてきたらどうするの？

conversation.en_sentence: Every once in a while, someone will use a swear word or really abusive language, and that’s unfortunate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら稀にものすごく口の悪い人ってのはいるよね。

conversation.en_sentence: This works 99 percent of the time.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな時はこれが99パーセントの割合で効き目があるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I say "Excuse me, I can handle your problem".
conversation.ja_sentence: こう言うんだ、「失礼いたします、問題に対応させていただくことはできます。」

conversation.en_sentence: "I’m not able to handle your abusive language".
conversation.ja_sentence: 「ですが、言葉の暴力には対応しかねます。」

conversation.en_sentence: Does it work?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで効き目はある？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, they usually get embarrassed and apologize to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あるある、だいたい恥ずかしくなって謝ってくるよ。

title: Calling in sick

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Ben.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、ベンです。

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning Ben, this is Sam.
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、おはようございます、サムです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm actually not feeling too well and would like to take the day off today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、体調があんまり良くないので、今日はお休みを頂きたいんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Fever?
conversation.ja_sentence: 熱ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it's not pretty.
conversation.ja_sentence: えぇ、良くないんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Don't force yourself to come.
conversation.ja_sentence: 無理して来ないでください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We don't want you to spread it to others.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の人達に移してほしくないし。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I will just sleep the whole day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はもう一日ただ寝ます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Rest well.
conversation.ja_sentence: よく休んでくださいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything you need me to take care of?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かこちらで引き受けることありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: No I think it's okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、大丈夫だと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I should be able to come to work tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日には出勤できると思いますので。

conversation.en_sentence: I might ask you to do something if I can't come to work tomorrow though.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし明日、出勤できなければ、何か頼むかもしれませんが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright, just let me know then.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、そうなったらまた知らせてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Rest well.
conversation.ja_sentence: ゆっくり休んでください。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、これで。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye.
conversation.ja_sentence: では。

title: Booking a hotel

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I just bought the tickets for your whole team.
conversation.ja_sentence: さあ、あなたのチーム全員分のチケットを買ったわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: The total came to 389 dollars 23 cents.
conversation.ja_sentence: 合計は389ドル23よ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to email you the confirmation code, since I put it on the company credit card.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社のクレジットカードで購入したから、確認コードは電子メールで送るね。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, I've been keeping all of the receipts in the shared folder on the server, in case we get audited again.
conversation.ja_sentence: また監査を受けた場合に備えて、すべての領収書はサーバー上の共有フォルダーに保存してあるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: That was such a mess last year when we got audited, and the IRS wanted to see everything.
conversation.ja_sentence: 去年監査を受けた時はIRSは全部見たがって酷かったね。

conversation.en_sentence: You really were a lifesaver Lisa.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は本当に命の恩人だよ、リサ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, before I forget.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、忘れる前に。

conversation.en_sentence: Now that you've bought the tickets to the Food Expo, go ahead and book our rooms as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: フードエキスポのチケットを購入したから、僕たちの部屋も予約してくれるかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Good Afternoon, thank you for calling Hotel Chain A Chicago.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ホテルチェーンAシカゴ店にお電話いただきありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: How may I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういった御用でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'm calling to reserve four rooms from May 2nd until the 7th.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、5月2日から7日まで4部屋予約したいんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely, good thing you called in early, that's the week of the Food Expo, and we're filling up fast.
conversation.ja_sentence: かしこまりました、フードエキスポの週ですでに埋まってきておりますので、早めにお電話いただいてよかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I have the name of your Company and the card you would like to put the rooms on?
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様の社名とご予約にご使用になるカードの番号をいただけますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Certainly, It’s Cheese Vendor A, The card number is xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、社名はチーズベンダーA、カード番号はxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxです。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, I know Cheese Vendor A, doesn't your company produce the cheese for Fast Food Burger Chain A?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、チーズベンダー Aを知っていますよ、御社はファストフードのバーガーチェーン Aのためにチーズを生産していらっしゃいませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's us!
conversation.ja_sentence: それはうちの会社です！

conversation.en_sentence: How cool!
conversation.ja_sentence: すごいですね！

conversation.en_sentence: I've heard the Food Expo is a blast!
conversation.ja_sentence: フードエキスポは凄く楽しいと聞きました！

conversation.en_sentence: My cousin goes every year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のいとこは毎年行っています。

conversation.en_sentence: He's a buyer for Fast Food Chicken Chain A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はファーストフードチキンチェーンAのバイヤーです。

conversation.en_sentence: What a small world!
conversation.ja_sentence: なんて世間は狭いんでしょう！

conversation.en_sentence: Tell him to stop by our booth, and ask for Eric.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちのブースに立ち寄ってエリックを呼び出すように伝えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Will do.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうします。

conversation.en_sentence: All right, your order is complete.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、ご予約が完了いたしました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for choosing Hotel Chain A Chicago.
conversation.ja_sentence: ホテルチェーンA シカゴ店をお選びいただきありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Eric, Guess what!?
conversation.ja_sentence: ねえ、エリック、何があったと思う？

conversation.en_sentence: I just spoke to a lady at the hotel, and her cousin is a buyer for Fast Food Chicken Chain A!
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はちょうどホテルの女性と話をしたんだけど、彼女のいとこはファーストフードチキンチェーンAのバイヤーなんですって！

conversation.en_sentence: That's Amazing!

conversation.ja_sentence: もっと早く起きなさいよ。

title: 忘年会について

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年の忘年会はどうしようか。

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: You're probably right.

conversation.ja_sentence: それと飲み放題に日本酒が入ってなかったので入ってるお店にしてくれないかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Also, the bottomless drinks menu didn't include nihonshu, so could we find one that does?

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほどだね、男子社員はなにかリクエストはあるのかい？

conversation.en_sentence: They say they'd like a place where the bottomless drinks menu includes draft beer.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年はそうじゃなかったっけ？

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年は一人2杯までという制限があったんです。

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだったんだね、じゃあ生ビール飲み放題の店にしよう。
conversation.en_sentence: You're right, let's choose a place that has bottomless beer.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他に全体からリクエストはあったかい？

conversation.ja_sentence: 料理についても希望がありました。

conversation.ja_sentence: それならそうしましょうか、早速探してみます。

title: Phone: Look for spot contract at request from Tokyo office

conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ベン。

conversation.en_sentence: How is your trip in Japan coming along.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東京出張はどんな感じですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's been good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 好調だよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Lots of productive meetings.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有意義な会議で充実しているよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It'll be around forty thousand tons per year.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can send you the specification sheet later today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日中に仕様書を送るよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess I will get in touch with Company A and Company B?
conversation.ja_sentence: A社とB社に連絡をとったほうが良さそうですね？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that will be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうしてくれると助かるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_sentence: 最後にA社と話をしたのはいつだっけ？

conversation.en_sentence: It was around one year ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: だいたい１年前でしたね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh wow.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's been that long.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結構前だね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I hope they still remember us.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、先方が私たちのことを覚えてくれていると良いんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you try to get a meeting with them next week?

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Any preference on the date?

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
