title: Webinar campaign

conversation.en_sentence: Today, we will begin our month long webinar campaign.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日より、私達は一か月にわたるウェビナーキャンペーンを始めます。

conversation.en_sentence: What's a webinar?
conversation.ja_sentence: ウェビナーとは何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's like a seminar but online, hence the name webinar.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはセミナーのようなものですが、オンラインなのでウェビナーと呼びます。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, OK.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, what's it about?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、それは何についてですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Dr. Merriwether will be discussing tactics for student retention and attrition.
conversation.ja_sentence: ドクターメリウェザーが、学生の維持と減少においての戦術について議論します。

conversation.en_sentence: He will also be discussing how to foster campus community through programs, resources, and involvement opportunities.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、プログラム、リソース、そして参加の機会を通して、キャンパスコミュニティをどのように育んでいくかについても議論します。

conversation.en_sentence: After the presentation, participants will be invited to ask questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンテーションの後、参加者の質問を受け付けます。

conversation.en_sentence: So, will I invite faculty and academic department heads?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、教員と学部長は招待しますか？

conversation.en_sentence: No, we will be targeting Provosts, Vice Principals, and the department of student affairs.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、プロボスト、副校長、および学務部がターゲットです。

conversation.en_sentence: What does a Provost do anyways?
conversation.ja_sentence: プロボストとは何をするんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: They're mostly in charge of the university's academic and budgetary affairs, but they also play a really big role in student retention.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは主に大学の学務と予算関係を担当していますが、学生の維持にも非常に大きな役割を果たしています。

conversation.en_sentence: The less students a university has, the less money they make.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大学にいる学生が少なければ、彼らの稼ぎは減りますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: This is a pain point to bring up in your conversations with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: このペインポイントから会話に持っていくんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you walk me through the sales process?
conversation.ja_sentence: セールスプロセスを説明してもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: What is the ultimate goal of having them attend our webinar?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らをウェビナーに参加させることの最終目的は何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Having Dr. Merriwether on board gives us a lot of credibility.
conversation.ja_sentence: メリウェザー博士を迎える事で私達は高い信頼を得ることができます。

conversation.en_sentence: During the presentation, he will also discuss Product A, which is our student retention software.
conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼンテーション中に、彼は学生維持ソフトウェアである製品Aについても話します。

conversation.en_sentence: How does software prevent students from dropping out of university?
conversation.ja_sentence: ソフトウェアを使って、どうやって学生が大学を中退するのを防ぐのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: All of the schools data about students is collected, grades, attendance, age, extra curricular activities, student loan debt, etc.
conversation.ja_sentence: 成績、出席、年齢、特別カリキュラム活動、学生ローンの借金など、学生に関する学校の全てのデータが集められます。

conversation.en_sentence: The data is combined, and creates a profile for each student.
conversation.ja_sentence: データが集約され、各生徒のプロファイルが作成されます。

conversation.en_sentence: Through predictive analytics, the student affairs team can see which students may need extra help, or consulting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 予測分析を通して、学生事務チームはどの学生が特別なヘルプを必要としているか、あるいは助言を必要としているかを知ることができます。

conversation.en_sentence: You know they're all going to ask, so how much is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: みんながきっとこの質問をするでしょうけれど、それはいくらですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Let me ask you this Louise, what's the average yearly tuition at a state university these days?
conversation.ja_sentence: ルイーズ、君に聞くけれど、最近の州立大学での年間平均授業料はいくらだと思う？

conversation.en_sentence: Um, I don't know, probably about $15,000 a year.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、わかりません、おそらく年間約15,000ドルくらい。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, that's for one student.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り、それは一人の学生分だね。

conversation.en_sentence: And listen close, because here's the sales pitch.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここからが売り文句なので、よく聞いてください。

conversation.en_sentence: What if you could save just one student?
conversation.ja_sentence: もし一人の生徒だけを救うことができたらどうなりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: The school would save $15,000.
conversation.ja_sentence: 学校は15,000ドルセーブできますね。

conversation.en_sentence: What if this software could save one hundred students?
conversation.ja_sentence: このソフトウェアが100人の学生を救うことができたらどうなりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Great, so how much is Product A Stan?
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしい、それで製品A はいくらなんですか、スタン。

conversation.en_sentence: It retails at $20,000. However, we intend on giving all of the schools a special 10% discount.
conversation.ja_sentence: 小売価格は2万ドルです。しかし、私たちはすべての学校に10％の特別割引を与えるつもりです。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I had better start making those calls.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、私は電話をかけ始めた方が良いですね。

title: 日本出張について

conversation.ja_sentence: トム、少し聞きたいことがあるんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: Tom, I have something to ask you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何？
conversation.en_sentence: What?

conversation.ja_sentence: トムは日本に何度も出張に行ってるよね。
conversation.en_sentence: You have been to Japan on a business trip many times, haven't you?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、もう10回は行ったかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, at least 10 times so far.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕、来月初めて行くんだけど、ちょっと不安で。
conversation.en_sentence: I am going there for the first time next month, but I am pretty worried.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本社に行くの？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you going to headquarters?

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、エンジニアの田中さんに技術を教えに。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'll be there to teach an engineer, Mr. Tanaka, some technologies.

conversation.ja_sentence: あの部署は、英語が話せる人が多いから過ごしやすいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: There are lots of people who speak English in that department, so it should be comfortable for you.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かる。
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、上の人に会った時の挨拶とか名刺の出し方とかがちゃんと出来るかなと思って。
conversation.en_sentence: But, I'm worried if I could do things like greet someone higher up or exchanging business cards correctly.

conversation.ja_sentence: こっちに皆が出張で来た時に出来てるんだから、それで大丈夫だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You do it right when they come here on a business trip, so you should be fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: こことはビジネスマナーが違うんじゃないかな、と思うと不安でさ。
conversation.en_sentence: It makes me worry that the business etiquette here is not the same as there.

conversation.ja_sentence: ま、確かにお辞儀の仕方とか、カジュアルな服装はだめだ、とか色々あるけどな。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, there are things like how to bow or no casual clothing.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと、接待とか食事が心配で。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, I am concerned about being entertained and food.

conversation.ja_sentence: あれ、日本食苦手だったっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, did you not like Japanese food?

conversation.ja_sentence: 結構好き嫌い多くて、寿司とか魚とか絶対だめ。
conversation.en_sentence: I am a rather picky eater, so I can't eat sushi or fish at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはちょっとやっかいかもなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: That could be an issue.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、焼肉とか焼き鳥に連れてってもらえばいいんじゃないか？
conversation.en_sentence: But, you can be taken to barbecue or yakitori grilled chicken skewers?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、田中さんにそう言ってみる。
conversation.en_sentence: True, I will tell Mr. Tanaka about that.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは、通勤の電車も心配なんだよな。
conversation.en_sentence: And I am worried about the trains to commute.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本社の近くにホテルとってないの？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you not staying at the hotel near the headquarters?

conversation.ja_sentence: いっぱいだったから、二駅先のホテルなんだよな。
conversation.en_sentence: It was full, so I am staying at the hotel two stops away.

conversation.ja_sentence: 朝の電車って混みこみなんだろ？
conversation.en_sentence: Trains are so crowded in the morning, aren't they?

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、あれはすごいぞ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yup, those are quite something.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全然動けないからな。
conversation.en_sentence: You can't move at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱりそうなのか。
conversation.en_sentence: That's what I thought.

conversation.ja_sentence: ま、頑張れよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, good luck with that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 初めてのことだから不安だらけで、困ったもんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm at a loss since this is the first time and I have a lot to worry about.

conversation.ja_sentence: 俺も最初はそうだったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It was like that for me for the first time, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなもんか。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that right?

conversation.ja_sentence: そのうち慣れるって。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sure you'll get used to it eventually.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今じゃ、俺は日本大好きだからな。
conversation.en_sentence: I love Japan now.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよな、出張楽しみにしてるもんな。
conversation.en_sentence: So true, you look forward to your business trips.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、楽しんでこいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yup, so, have fun there.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、また出発前に聞きたいことがあったら、話聞いてくれる？
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, can I talk to you again if I have more questions before I leave?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

title: Talking about the weekend

conversation.en_sentence: So any plans for the weekend?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、週末は予定あるの？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I have the president of Company A here this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、今週ここにA社の社長をお迎えしててさ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He's leaving on Saturday so I need to take him to the airport.
conversation.ja_sentence: 土曜日に帰られるから、空港まで送らないといけないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh that's too bad.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、それは残念。

conversation.en_sentence: Can't he just take the taxi?
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長、タクシーで行けないのか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: He could.
conversation.ja_sentence: 行けるでしょうよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But I want to stay on his good side.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、彼に気に入られたいし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think he wants to eat lunch before going to the airport too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 空港に行く前に昼食も食べたいだろうと思うし。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほどね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: After that, I think I'll just go home and rest.
conversation.ja_sentence: その後は、ただ家に帰ってゆっくりするよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Catch up on sleep.
conversation.ja_sentence: 睡眠時間を取り戻す。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds exciting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 楽しそうだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very exciting.
conversation.ja_sentence: めっちゃ、楽しいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How about you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は？

conversation.en_sentence: I need to finish a report.
conversation.ja_sentence: レポート終わらさないと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is it the one for the Tokyo office.
conversation.ja_sentence: それって、東京オフィス用の？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they want it first thing next week in Japan.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、来週の朝一で日本に欲しいんだって。

conversation.en_sentence: Which means I need to send it to them by Sunday morning here.
conversation.ja_sentence: とすると、こっちの日曜の朝までに向こうに送らないといけないってこと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Right, because their Monday morning is our Sunday afternoon.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、向こうの月曜の朝は、こっちの日曜の午後だからか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう。

conversation.en_sentence: I should be able to finish it on Saturday though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 土曜には完成させられるだろうけどね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I hate writing reports for the Tokyo office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は東京オフィスにレポート書くのすごい嫌だわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Why is that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何で？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They usually don't even read it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼ら、大抵、読みもしないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Really.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, there was this one time they asked me about something and I told them that it was in the report I sent last month.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、これ一回あったんだけど、彼らが何か聞いてきて、先月送ったレポートに書いてありますよ、って言ったんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you believe that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 信じられる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's like they are too busy to even read emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: 忙しすぎて、Eメールすら読めない、みたいな。

conversation.en_sentence: That's not very encouraging.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは、気乗りしないな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Tell me about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: だろ。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess it's good to keep a record of things for yourself though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で記録を取っておくのにはいいかもしれないけど、ね。

conversation.en_sentence: You never know when you might need to look at it again.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう一回見直さないといけないこともあるかもしれないし、わからないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうだね。
